story:
"Who Are you fools?!"

Shattered Glass is a conductorless string orchestra based out of New York City. Virtuosic and versatile, SG balances vibrant excitement with a meticulous respect for piece, composer, and tradition. With a repertoire that ranges from Bach, Britten, and Bartok, to Schoenberg, and Stravinsky, SG also offers innovative programming and collaborations with Grammy-award winning pop artists. At the core of SG is a commitment to the special relationship it creates between audience and ensemble. By performing without a conductor and tailoring each performance with exceptional attention to audience and venue, listeners can't help but experience a connection with every one of the musicians. Barriers typical of the classical music experience are, well, shattered! 

"Ok, so why do you need my help?"

We established ourselves in January of 2012. In our short existence we have already done some great things (Please visit www.Shattered-Glass.org for more details) but we are held back by one thing alone: NO FUNDS!

This money will help us to spread our music to a larger audience as well as develop and spread our image. This money will be used for:

-Recording sessions

-Website

-Photoshoot

-Concert booking

-Travel expenses 

-and more!

Every single donation helps more than you could possibly even imagine! We would love you forever if you can donate any amount that you are comfotable with. We promise to stay in touch with you and let you know exactly how your donation is helping us!

"Hm, I wish I could help... But I'm broke :("

That's ok! We are broke too and feel your pain! 

The success of this financial campaign depends on how many people we can extend the reach of it too. If you could take 13.25 seconds to share this campaign on your Facebook, twitter, maybe even email it to some people you think would be interested in an ensemble like this, it would be amazing! We might cry a little bit. Just out of pure joy. You are beautiful. 

"You are really great, but I want to take things slow baby. Can I get to know you better first?"

Please do! 

visit us at www.Shattered-Glass.org or www.Facebook.com/ShatteredGlassEnsemble

follow us on Twitter @SGensemble

email us: MaxJacob@shattered-glass.org

Hell, even call the executive director/bassist Max (732-690-2265)

story:
Why Django? Why a Benefit? Why Now?

Guitarist Django Reinhardt was a Gypsy born in Belgium, who spent most of his adult life in France. While in Paris, in the thirties, Django heard the music of Louis Armstrong and Duke Ellington, and set out to emulate it. He ended up creating a uniquely beautiful, rhythmically driven genre of music that has been emulated all of the world. Today, Django's style of playing is known as Gypsy Jazz.

The Brooklyn Djangology Festival was created to celebrate to celebrate Django's Legacy. We have hosted 4 of these festivals in the past. All have sold out. This year, though, it has an additional calling.

Coney Island Hospital and Bellevue Hospital, two of New York City's major public hospitals, were evacuated as a result of Hurricane Sandy. Bellevue is New York City's oldest full-service hospital, and the oldest continuously operating hospital in America. Coney Island Hospital services South Brooklyn, much of which was damaged by flooding from the storm. Extensive work needs to be done to repair the damage done by the hurricane, and make both hospitals safe for patients.

HHC's mission is to provide high quality care to all patients regardless of ability to pay, and as such, services patients from all over the city and from all backgrounds, ranging from artists and musicians to victims of torture. Brooklyn Djangology will be combining music's powers of healing and celebration in service of Hurricane Sandy's victims all over New York City.

Your contribution would ensure that we are able to cover the expenses of hosting this event, thus maximizing our contribution the city's public hospitals, and to families in need. Our goal is to donate all of the money from ticket sales to HHC. Our wish is to support both the musicians and to alleviate the strain on New York City.

Please contribute, attend the festival if you can, and spread the word. For details, visit our web page at <http://www.brooklyndjangology.com>, and "like" our facebook page at <http://www.facebook.com/BrooklynDjangologyFesti...>

story:
Thank you for contributing your attention, time, and money to this project. I embarked upon this project for two reasons:

I want to use this gift of music to give a voice and a presence in the global community to a reality that is often unseen: a prosperous Africa.

Africa can groom and raise successful and gifted kids. I want to offer the visibility of that success because I recognize how much younger kids today get educated by what they hear and see on TV. Their bias and preferences are shaped by what TV shows or doesn’t show. With the platform that we have today, we have the responsibility to tell another story about Africa, one that doesn’t always involve misery and neediness. As real as misery is, it doesn’t bring the best out of us. Successful and inspiring stories on the other hand do inspire people to invest. People only invest when they feel good about themselves, about others, and about where we’re going as a species.

I want to spread the art form of Jazz into a more widespread audience.

Jazz has always had a black audience and the upper class white audience. It hasn’t been mainstream for a good while because it hasn’t traveled very much beyond its traditional boundaries. Touring extensively continents like Asia, the Middle East, South America, and Africa with this art form will be a game changer because it will introduce jazz to a brand new crowd and therefore increase the popularity and earning power of this art form. Asia for instance is currently experiencing an economic boom like no other region in the world today. People there are dying for new experiences and innovation. I hope to take this art form there and give them something worth their money, time, and energy.

That is the vision I will materialize. I thank you for being part of this journey. Now, let's do our part.

story:
Greetings from  Sunday wilde, in a very small town set in the wilderness of Northern Ontario. I am a self taught piano player , vocalist and songwriter, and I am currently working on my fourth album. I write jazz blues and something that lays on the edge of both of those genres. 

My last album   “What man? Oh THAT man!!” was very successful as it:·   
  • Hit the top 100 Blues albums of 2011 on theRoots Music Report (Itnl)·  
  • Won Best International Blues Release on blues411·   
  • Runner up for the Best Acoustic Blues Album of the Year on Wasser Prawda    
  • Nominated Album of the Year Solo Artist for the Northern Ontario Music & Film Awards·    
  • Won Best Blues Song of the year Voters Choice for the Independent Music Awards (Itnl)

Some words from reviewers:

·        “wilde rips apart the fragile emotional wake oflove from dawn to dusk” W. Haskell, No Depression·        “Ms. Wilde shakes, rattles, glides and purrsacross the landscape.” D. McCloskey, The Alternate Root·        “Wildes own unique voice mixes sweet innocence witha dusky raspy edge that conjures up images of Early Ethel Waters and SisterRosetta Tharpe” The American Blues Blog

This new project will consist of almost 22 new origina lsongs some jazzy some bluesy some a bit on the edge of both of those genres.  Most excitedly I have dreamt of recording an album in a wilderness cabin surrounded by the wilderness where I live. Most artists dream of going to Nashville or to Memphis to record, but I want to record in the wilderness, close to where I have raised my two sons and close to where I live. This experience will be unencumbered by television and the city noise, where the artists can come together and work for a week. We will be there just in time to enjoy the fall colours and evade the mosquitoes!! We may not end up recording all 22 new tracks, depending on how it all comes together, but there is certainly enough new material to select from.

I have contacted  musicians to come in on the project to lend their creative juices to help me create the sound – a clarinet player, upright jazz bass player, guitarist, and an accordion player.  Some from the area, and others from southern Ontario. It will be certainly an interesting sound using clarinet and accordion on some blues boogie songs.

We visited the lodge recently and low and behold I discovered that the owners have an old upright honky tonk piano in the main lodge, so part of the funds will be used to bring in a piano tuner to see if we can get it sounding up to snuff for a recording.

I am so pleased that Branch’s Seine River Lodge www.seineriverlodge.com has generously offered the use of one of their cabins on the banks of Seine River for one week to record. The owners are passionate arts supporters and they even offered a fish fry after the recording is done! This will be an ideal serene location to create, mesh, meld, play, sing and record.

In order to do this, there are a few expenses involved:

·        Musician fees

·        Engineering and Technical Assistants

·        Mastering

·        Travel for the musicians which includes gas andflights for some

·        Food for the week for 6-8 people

·        Wages for a cook as I am sure I will be very busy

·        artwork, cd pressing, promotion and a radio campaign

Anything you can give towards the project will be great! If you cannot give financially perhaps you can share this with your email list of friends or on facebook or twitter.

For CANADIAN Residents only

One way of supporting the project without actually giving any money towards it is by opening an ING Bank Account, when you do if you useby Orange Key #26876920S1, ING, God bless them, will put $50 in myaccount ($25 after August 31st) and also give you $50 as part of their friend referral program. I thought I might take advantage of this for my album fundraising. www.ingdirect.ca is the link.

Note for the blueberry jam lovers; I will be picking berries over the next month and hoping the crop will be good this year, but if it isn’t the jam perk will be in very limited quantities. If the bears give me any kind of trouble I may have to substitute the jam flavour.

Note for the Executive Producer Perk – There may be long term royalties involved in this perk, so we can discuss this, or if you have questions please feel free to email me.

If you are unable to give towards this project, I urge you to please go SEE LIVE MUSIC. It helps build a community of artists, supports local business and is just plain good to get away from the television and see people.

Thanks for reading and watching.

story:
Short Summary

Midi Steamboat as I'm sure many of you know was the band that Paul and I started back in 2010. Since the first show we've played a handful of other on-campus shows and recorded an EP and part of a full-length. As we have since graduated from college and don't know when the next time we'll even play a show is, let alone see each other. This T-shirt was designed by me and is meant to give something back to all of those who actually came to our shows and supported us. 

What We Need & What You Get

Basically the main issue we have here is that making T-shirts can be expensive. I've opted to run the whole operation myself, creating my own screen, buying blank shirts, and printing them myself. This allows us to cater better to a realistic number of customers and gives all of you a discount on actual cost of the shirt. The funding will be solely used for purchasing supplies. 

The $500 goal is the minimum for a project, but we honestly don't need nearly that much. We've opted for Flexible Funding so we still get a large chunk of the funds raised if we don't make it to $500. If for whatever reason we don't make enough to fund the materials with just donations I will make every effort to push the rest out of my own pocket. I promise that anyone who pays for a t-shirt will get one. If we can't get enough funding right away we might have to push the expected delivery date but I will make it happen even if it's just one person. 

This campaign is essentially existing as a sort of good-faith pre-ordering system. If you support us now in setup you will guarantee yourself a t-shirt. The cost is reflective of materials and shipping for those who live outside of the Chicagoland area. 

The Impact

Those who are contributing are helping us with one of the final stages of Midi Steamboat. I can say that I personally loved every moment of Midi Steamboat, from the first night when we wrote "I Like Riding Steamboats" in Paul's apartment to our final show at Ringling College. You'll be helping us provide the few and proud die-hard fans with something to cherish from the band as well as help carry on the memory of the band forever. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, share the music, tell your friends! It's never too late to be a Midi Steamboat fan.

story:
**Within 24-hours of your contribution, a music download link will be emailed to you.  All other perks (t-shirts, thank you notes, concerts, mentions, etc.) will be delivered AFTER the campaign has ended.**


First of all, thank you SO much for visiting this page family & friends!  Now for the story behind why you are even on this page in the first place...

 

I had a source of income that was to be used for recording and creating a new music video, and unfortunately I lost most of that when I got laid off from my job.  I scrambled around trying to find other ways to fund the project, and I did find a great way to earn all the money I need.  Unfortunately, it didn't work and sent me back to the drawing board.  Business loans are not an option as banks almost never lend to Record Labels, much less an artist.  Personal loans are impossible without employment.  Selling high value items are not really an option either, as I found out, because I have high value items no one wants but me.  Also, my royalities from the "Satisfy You" EP won't come in for another 6 months.

Which is why I am reaching out through IndieGoGo.com and attempting to crowdfund my music with your help.  This amount of money can and will literally make my dream become a reality.  Allow me to explain...

 

First, this started with one single song I was going to write and sell on my website to raise money for an album.  Then somehow one song turned into four more and now I have an entire EP.  I spent an entire week writing non-stop (throwing most of it out), barely eating, going to bed when the sun came up every morning, and I literally dreamt about writing music in my sleep.  I was relentless about breaking all of my musical boundaries and writing the best damn chart-topping material I could... all in less than one week.  I did it.  And I'm really really proud of these songs I wrote all by myself.  In fact, I was so stunned after I finished the demo for "Live In the Dream" that I had tears welling up in my eyes.  I knew in that moment, I had just written the song that would change my entire life.


I got into the studio with a producer.  He's worked with artists such as Shakira, Timbaland, Jason Durelo, and Miley Cyrus.  I've worked with him on recording, mixing and mastering my vocals before, and the man is a freakin' genius!!  Matt knows how to get that radio-ready sound faster than anyone I've ever seen.  He definitely brought a great sound out of the songs!


After all these songs were written, out of nowhere I came up with this music video concept for "Live In the Dream" and felt a strong spiritual sense wash over me, and a knowing that this video has to happen no matter what.  Immediately, I contacted a friend of mine in Austin who is a news camera man, films music videos, and creates some of the most stunning fashion photography I've ever seen in my life!  I told him my idea in depth and he immediately jumped on board.  We are going to make a visually beautiful and emotionally moving music video showing people from all walks of life.  I am unable to say more than that at this time, unfortunately.  Both the videographer and I agree the music video concept + the song, along with my 7,000+ fan base, are almost guarenteed to go viral.  As he said, "This video will be viral for a very long time.  The song and concept have serious staying power."  Normally, he only works with high-profile clients who can pay $1,000 a day or more (along with all travel costs), but he is willing to work for a drastically reduced rate of whatever I can comfortably pay without breaking the bank.  I would really like to pay him at least $1,000.  He's driving all the way from Austin, staying with friends, and is wanting to dedicate an entire week to filming and editing the music video.  The only reason he is doing this video is because he genuinely believes in the project and my music.  He's taking a chance on me.


The AshleySpencer.com exclusive EP is a fundraising effort to make high amounts of money so I can make a real album, with real musicians and great music videos.  This is a good money-maker for me and with the 90-95% chance the music video has of going (and staying) viral, it could potentially change my entire life.  This year everything I've been dreaming about since I was a tiny toddler could come true.  Absolutely ANY funding help you want to contribute, it would mean so much to me!  Even if it's $1, every little bit helps.  As Joel Osteen says, "No amount of lack can keep God's destiny for your life from coming to pass."

 


Here is how everything is getting broken down:

 

- Music video

- Recording Costs (already covered!)

- Merchandise Line (no costs here, doing it myself)

- Graphic Design work for EP/Flyers/etc  (no costs here either, making it myself)

 

Your financial gifts will be helping with the music video.  We're aiming to film the music video in around 6-8 weeks. The videographer has no idea I am going through a site such as this one to raise the money.  So, here I am asking for your help.  Any help at all.  I am unable to offer much of a reward at this time, BUT I can promise to send you the EP for free way before it's ever released.  If I can, I'll give you some free merchandise if you want them.

 

Thank you so much for reading this little essay and listening to the video.  And thank you in advance for any contribution you make.

 

 

Much Love,

Ashley Spencer

 

 

 

"It's calling you, It's calling me

To stop hiding from destiny

God is on our side, He's on our side

The road is only one step at a time

We can all live in the dream

Yes, we can all live in the dream." 

       - "Live In the Dream" Music Video Title Track

Which is why I am reaching out through IndieGoGo.com and attempting to crowdfund my music with your help.  This amount of money can and will literally make my dream become a reality.  Allow me to explain...
 
First, this started with one single song I was going to write and sell on my website to raise money for an album.  Then somehow one song turned into four more and now I have an entire EP.  I spent an entire week writing non-stop (throwing most of it out), barely eating, going to bed when the sun came up every morning, and I literally dreamt about writing music in my sleep.  I was relentless about breaking all of my musical boundaries and writing the best damn chart-topping material I could... all in less than one week.  I did it.  And I'm really really proud of these songs I wrote all by myself.  In fact, I was so stunned after I finished the demo for "Live In the Dream" that I had tears welling up in my eyes.  I knew in that moment, I had just written the song that would change my entire life.

I got into the studio with a producer.  He's worked with artists such as Shakira, Timbaland, Jason Durelo, and Miley Cyrus.  I've worked with him on recording, mixing and mastering my vocals before, and the man is a freakin' genius!!  Matt knows how to get that radio-ready sound faster than anyone I've ever seen.  He definitely brought a great sound out of the songs!

After all these songs were written, out of nowhere I came up with this music video concept for "Live In the Dream" and felt a strong spiritual sense wash over me, and a knowing that this video has to happen no matter what.  Immediately, I contacted a friend of mine in Austin who is a news camera man, films music videos, and creates some of the most stunning fashion photography I've ever seen in my life!  I told him my idea in depth and he immediately jumped on board.  We are going to make a visually beautiful and emotionally moving music video showing people from all walks of life.  I am unable to say more than that at this time, unfortunately.  Both the videographer and I agree the music video concept + the song, along with my 7,000+ fan base, are almost guarenteed to go viral.  As he said, "This video will be viral for a very long time.  The song and concept have serious staying power."  Normally, he only works with high-profile clients who can pay $1,000 a day or more (along with all travel costs), but he is willing to work for a drastically reduced rate of whatever I can comfortably pay without breaking the bank.  I would really like to pay him at least $1,000.  He's driving all the way from Austin, staying with friends, and is wanting to dedicate an entire week to filming and editing the music video.  The only reason he is doing this video is because he genuinely believes in the project and my music.  He's taking a chance on me.

The AshleySpencer.com exclusive EP is a fundraising effort to make high amounts of money so I can make a real album, with real musicians and great music videos.  This is a good money-maker for me and with the 90-95% chance the music video has of going (and staying) viral, it could potentially change my entire life.  This year everything I've been dreaming about since I was a tiny toddler could come true.  Absolutely ANY funding help you want to contribute, it would mean so much to me!  Even if it's $1, every little bit helps.  As Joel Osteen says, "No amount of lack can keep God's destiny for your life from coming to pass."
 

Here is how everything is getting broken down:
 
- Music video
- Recording Costs (already covered!)
- Merchandise Line (no costs here, doing it myself)
- Graphic Design work for EP/Flyers/etc  (no costs here either, making it myself)
 
Your financial gifts will be helping with the music video.  We're aiming to film the music video in around 6-8 weeks. The videographer has no idea I am going through a site such as this one to raise the money.  So, here I am asking for your help.  Any help at all.  I am unable to offer much of a reward at this time, BUT I can promise to send you the EP for free way before it's ever released.  If I can, I'll give you some free merchandise if you want them.
 
Thank you so much for reading this little essay and listening to the video.  And thank you in advance for any contribution you make.
 
 
Much Love,
Ashley Spencer
 
 
 
"It's calling you, It's calling me
To stop hiding from destiny
God is on our side, He's on our side
The road is only one step at a time
We can all live in the dream
Yes, we can all live in the dream." 
       - "Live In the Dream" Music Video Title Track

story:
Our Story

David Biedenbender is planning to write new concerto for alto saxophone and wind ensemble. This project allows for you to have a direct role in the commissioning of this new work for the saxophone.

The Impact

 

By donating to this project you can play an integral, and more personal role in this symposium and the creation of new music. All while being on the cutting edge of commissioning music in the twenty first century.


 

What We Need & What You Get

Just a $50 donation will get you your own copy of the saxophone concerto and piano reduction. All donors who pledge $50 or more will receive their own copy of the concerto with performance rights, shortly after the initial performances of the work.  Donations in excess of $50 will be graciously rewarded by various combinations of David's other saxophone compositions.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If the goal is 100% raised you can still continue to donate!  There is no limit to the number of concertos available to be distributed to donors!  Aside from donating, there are many other ways you can help support this project.  Simply "liking" our project on the Indiegogo page will help us become a featured project in the site.  Additionally, you can post our project on your Facebook, tweet our campaign to your followers, embed the project video on your website or blog, share the project via email, or use your Google account to +1 out project.  There are many easy ways to help spread the word on this great project.


About the Composer

Award winning composer David Biedenbender has had the privilege of collaborating with many talented performers and ensembles, including Alarm Will Sound, the PRISM Saxophone Quartet, the Eastman Wind Ensemble, the Detroit Symphony Orchestra, bass trombonist Randall Hawes, the Juventas New Music Ensemble, the Washington Kantorei, The Boston New Music Initiative, Composer's Inc., and the University of Michigan Symphony Orchestra among others. Recent awards and grants include an ASCAP Morton Gould Young Composer's Award, regional winner of the SCI Student Composer Competition, the Third Millenium Ensembleï¿½s Composition Prize, honorable mention for the ASCAP/CBDNA Frederick Fennell Prize and the Michigan Music Teacherï¿½s Association Composition Competition, and a Composer Assistance Program Grant from the American Music Center. His music has been heard in diverse venues such as Symphony Space (New York City), the Fifth Avenue Presbyterian Church (NYC), the German Embassy (Washington, DC), the Middle East (Boston, MA), the Antonï¿½n Dvo?ï¿½k Museum (Prague, CZ), the Old First Church (San Francisco, CA), the Settlement Music School (Philadelphia, PA), the Interlochen Center for the Arts (Interlochen, MI), Hill Auditorium (Ann Arbor, MI), the University of Michigan Museum of Art (Ann Arbor), and on WNYCï¿½s (New York City Public Radio) Soundcheck with John Schaefer.  For more information please visit www.davidbiedenbender.com


Saxophonist Sean Murphy is the principal fundraiser for this project .  Please contact him at www.seanmurphysaxophone.com with any questions.

story:
Short Summary

For those of you that don’t know who I am, my name is Beejus.  I am a hard working lyricists from West Oakland with a unique style.  There isn’t a moment when I am not working on my music.  Even at my day job or when I am with my daughter, I am still developing my skill as a lyricist.  Most of my performances that I have done and all my music that I have created have been free for all my fans.  I have learned how tough the music industry is and I am struggling to keep going.  I have come a long way by myself, but my dream is to make a career of my music.  By supporting me, I will be able to take one step closer to my dream. 

 

What I Need

 

I love my family, friends and fans very much, which is the reason I haven’t asked for very much.  I am thankful for all the love I have received.  Currently I am looking to make physical CD’s of my latest album, FBET, make stickers of my logo, which is currently being designed, pay for promotion so people outside my fan base will actually be able to hear my music, and a video about me is also being made by Entao Productions which allows my fans to learn more about me.  All of these expenses add up to $2500.  $650 for CDs, $350 for stickers, $1000 for promotion, and $500 for the video made by Entao Productions.

 

Ways To Help and What You Will Get

I understand that these are tough times but anything will help to keep my music career going, and it would be greatly appreciated.

Here are some Perks for all of those who are so generous to help me out.

I will write a personalized email or letter to anyone who donates, no matter the amount. 

Donation Sizes and Perks

$10-25: a free FBET CD.

$25-100: an autographed FBET CD and a pack of Beejus stickers.

$100-500: free tickets to a Beejus concert, an autographed FBET CD, and a sticker.

$500-1000: VIP at a Beejus Concert, chill with Beejus after the concert, an autographed FBET CD, a Sticker, a pack of pins, a FBET or Beejus T-shirt, and a *chance to travel with Beejus to an out of town show.( *Only applies to those that are in the local bay area)

Donate to the right!

 

*Note: If the goal is not met, donation gifts may be subject to change.

 

Other Ways to Help

Spread the word of the campaign through Facebook, Twitter, and anywhere else you can think of!!  Help to make Beejus’ dream come true!  Join the Team by sending me your email address!  Just send me a message on through my Indiegogo profile.

Also If you havn't heard my music or downloaded my album go to http://beejusmusic.com/

I appreciate you taking the time just to read this...

Thank you,

Beejus

story:
Our Story

What is JAYA Music?

JAYA Music is a non-profit recording studio housed in a private community coffee house.

The JAYA Music experience is strictly positive and uplifting.

What you will hear in JAYA Music is

· Open and affirming messages

· Positive affirmations of life

· Inspiration to deeper living

· Motivational messages of faith

· Traditional and not so traditional genres

· Fresh new artists who otherwise may never have had their talents heard!

What you will NEVER hear in JAYA music is any message of:

· hate, racism, sexism, anger or homophobia

Scholarships

JAYA Music will offer scholarships to those who meet this criteria, which will allow them to professionally record a single song or entire cd at no charge to them.

Where is JAYA Music?

JAYA Music will be housed in the JAYA Center, home to Just As You Are, a non-profit community coffee house that operates on a volunteer basis.  No JAYA Staff is paid.  The JAYA Center occasionally host's free concerts highlighting local (Atlanta area) indie artists and garage bands who perform G rated positive music including the best open and affirming Christian artist on the circuit.

Attention Musicians!

Beginning this summer, your voice will be heard! JAYA Music will create many new recording artists that may have never been heard by the masses.

Attention Song Writers!

Have an original score, lyrics or complete song that you wrote and want to see it performed by a talented singer?  Here is your chance to have that work become a reality

 

JAYA Music Community Label is not just for musicians!

There are many people outside of the musicians that make the production of a completed cd possible.  JAYA Music will offer free training to individuals who wish to learn how to edit and mix the tracks.  While we do not offer a degree or certification, you will learn how to produce an audio cd using a variety of technology and skills.  All new JAYA Engineers must assist in helping produce future cd 's at JAYA Music as a trade off for the education.
In addition, JAYA Music already has some of Atlanta's best photographers and graphic design artist's willing to donate their services for cover artwork.

 

Music Marketing 101

JAYA Music will offer classes on everything from obtaining rights to re-record another artist's cover song, to registering your original work, to creating the proper website and facebook fan page,to getting your music published on cd baby and itunes!

What We Need

Your investment goes to purchase the equipment needed to begin our project and the birth of JAYA Music!  Remember, no one at JAYA Music is paid, so all the collected money will go to equipment!  Here is a list of the equipment we will purchase:

La610 MK2 Preamp

C414XLII Microphone

Presonus Studio Live Console

Dynaudio BM5a Monitors

Auralex Studiofoam Pro Kit for Vocal Booth

Dynaudio BM5amkII Studio Monitor Speakers

Apple Logic Pro Studio Recording/mixing Software

Furman PL Plus -c Power Conditioner Surge Protector

Radial ProDI DI Boxer

Stands Cables Budget

Auralex Roominator Pro Plus Kit Acoustic Treatment

Sony Mdr7506 Studio Headphones w/ 2yr coverage

Apple iMac 27" 4 GB RAM - 2.8GHZ Quad-Core Intel i5

AppleCare Protection Plan for Imac

Glyph 500gb External Recording Hard Drive

AKG C414XLII Condensor Vocal Microphone

Universal Audio LA610mk2 Preamp Compressor

Shure SM57 Mics

Presonus Monitor Station Controller with Talkback Mic

Presonus Studio Live 16ch Digital Mixer / Recorder


What You Will Get When You Partner With Us

$25; 1 compilation cd

$50; above + Christmas cd

$100; above + JAYA Music T-Shirt & JAYA Cup

$250; above + name on dedication wall at JAYA

$500; above + all cd's produced for 1 year

$1,000; above + listed Associate Producer on all compilation cd's

$10,000; above + vocal booth named in honor (only one available)

story:
Short Summary

I'm Cynthia Tarr and I've been a professional singer all my life. For over 20 years, I performed in Los Angeles, but it is only when I moved to the wine country of Sonoma, California, that I became inspired to make the CD of my lifetime. The beauty and serenity of Northern California has given me new creativity and inspiration. And with your support, I'd like to share it with you!

The talent I have assembled for this project is astounding--amazing players with an intense commitment to making "Here's to Life!" the best it can be. I believe I have achieved a level of vocal richness, resonance, power and subtleties. And, combined with these wonderful players and some gorgeous tunes,  you'll have a CD that you can listen to intently or play to set a mood. We do it all here--jazz, samba, smoky ballads, pop, Brazilian and some of my original songs.

If you support my project by contributing here, you'll not only have a beautiful, original CD, you'll have my undying gratitude.  Let's make some beautiful music together!


What We Need & What You Get

Our budget is figured to the dollar. Your contributions will help us fund the whole CD--top to bottom with terrific musicians, studio space, engineering, mixing, creating the cover and of course, getting it into your ears!

Everyone who contributes $25 or more will get a copy of the CD. We've also included a bunch of fun perks to entice you even more--everything from receiving a signed CD in the mail to having your name on the credits of the CD itself to coming to a recording session. Plus, if you aren't too far away, I'll come and sing for you!

I'd also be doubly grateful if you could gift us by letting your email and Facebook friends know about "Here's to Life" and this campaign. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, I'd love it if you'd spread the word about this campaign to your friends by telling them, posting on your FB page and using the share tools here on Indiegogo. I'm also singing at The Bistro here in Sonoma on September 26 at 7 p.m. Please join us and tell your friends about it too! I'd love to see you there.

story:
Why a Balkan Songbook?

Здравейте – zdravejte – hello!  We are Orfeia Vocal Ensemble – a non-profit Maryland/D.C.- based, internationally-recognized Balkan women’s choir dedicated to preserving traditional Bulgarian music and culture.  We’re raising money to produce a Balkan Songbook and learning CD in order to share the captivatingly beautiful traditional music of Bulgaria and the Balkans. 

Your tax-deductible donation will help us sustain our musical mission.

Orfeia plans to produce the songbook not only to share and memorialize a unique collection of songs but also to keep our group alive and strong and able to continue to celebrate these traditions in the coming years, and to support our amazing teacher who has worked tirelessly to give us the gift of the Balkan sound. 


Orpheus, the legendary musical story-teller and our inspiration, is said to be from the Balkan region of Thrace, so it's no surprise that the music of the Balkans is known for its breathtaking harmonies, exciting dissonances, and remarkable and unique rhythms.  If you’ve heard the music, you know what we’re talking about and you’ve already fallen under its spell.  If this is your first time, be prepared to fall in love. Orfeia has had the opportunity to travel and perform in Bulgaria, and each trip has deepened our commitment to the music. One of our favorite memories from our 2010 trip is Tatiana directing us in this impromptu performance of a medley of traditional songs in the Old Town of Sozopol, surrounded by ancient remnants of the southern fortress walls.


The music and cultures of the Balkan region (including Bulgaria, Serbia, Greece, Macedonia, and Bosnia) are centuries old. Traditional vocal music has been handed down from parent to child over centuries, but these traditions are becoming lost. We want to sustain and make available this wonderful heritage and no one is better qualified to do so than Bulgarian national treasure Tatiana Sarbinska, Orfeia’s artistic director.  Formerly a principal soloist with the Pirin Ensemble and recipient of the Ivan Vasov award for contributions to Bulgarian culture, Tatiana brings to the project an encyclopedic knowledge of Bulgarian traditional music and culture and more than three decades of teaching vocal technique to beginner and professional, young and old. 

In 2012, Tatiana and Orfeia recorded, transcribed, and assembled teaching materials for a Balkan vocal residency with Carpe Diem Arts in Montgomery County, Maryland. Through this workshop we led a multi-age, multi-cultural community choir in learning and performing songs from across Balkan regions, including Bulgaria, Serbia, Greece, Macedonia, and Bosnia. After just four rehearsals the group joined Orfeia for a successful public concert and a performance at a local music festival. This experience was part of the inspiration for the Balkan Songbook.

“I had never sung Balkan music before but Tatiana’s teaching methods made it fun and accessible for our diverse group of singers. I was so taken by Tatiana and the music that I auditioned and joined her ensemble Orfeia.” Rhonda Kranz, Carpe Diem singer and Orfeia member

The Songbook and CD will feature a selection of twenty-five songs from Orfeia’s repertoire, drawn from the archives of Tatiana Sarbinska. The songs will be a voyage through the unique and diverse styles of the different folk regions of Bulgaria, with side trips across its borders to other areas of the Balkans. The Songbook can be easily used by individual singers, duets and trios, and small to large choruses. The book will offer an overview of Balkan vocal techniques and authentic sound production and placement, together with words, music, and translations.  The learning CD will give instruction on pronunciation, a recording of the full song with all parts, and individual recordings of each vocal part.


What We Need & What You Get

Orfeia’s fundraising goal to support Tatiana's time and produce the book and CD is $7,000.  Production includes selecting music, transcribing musical scores, developing the instructional content for the Songbook, and recording and engineering the learning tracks for the CD. Our first stretch goal of up to $10,000 will allow us to add additional demonstrations of Balkan vocal techniques and exercises (including placement and ornamentation) on the learning CD, and to increase the production quality of the book, including original cover art. A stretch goal of up to $12,000 will allow us to expand the content of the book with photographs and original artwork, descriptions of the cultural context of the music, and to include unique food recipes from different Bulgarian regions.

Orfeia is a non-profit 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization, so your donation is tax-deductible! 

We would like to thank you for your donations and have put together a special set of gifts we think you will enjoy - see the perks on the sidebar! 

From Orfeia's 2010 trip to the National Festival of Bulgarian Folklore in Koprivshtitsa


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone who is excited about the Balkan Songbook Project is able to contribute financially, but that's not the only way you can support our work! Please help us get the word out to all of the music-loving people and Balkan enthusiasts out there:

Email, Facebook, or tweet the link to this page!

If you are in a performing ensemble or are involved with arts and music events, email us at info@orfeia.org and we'll be happy to send you flyers to distribute.
story_txt:
Why a Balkan Songbook?
Здравейте
– zdravejte
– hello!  We are Orfeia Vocal Ensemble – a non-profit Maryland/D.C.- based, internationally-recognized Balkan women’s choir dedicated
to preserving traditional Bulgarian music and culture.  We’re raising money to produce a Balkan
Songbook and learning CD in order to share the captivatingly beautiful
traditional music of Bulgaria and the Balkans. Your tax-deductible donation will help us sustain our musical mission.Orfeia plans to produce the songbook not only to share and memorialize a unique collection of songs but also to keep our group alive and strong and able to continue to celebrate these traditions in the coming years, and to support our amazing teacher who has worked tirelessly to give us the gift of the Balkan sound. Orpheus, the legendary musical story-teller and our inspiration, is said to be from the Balkan region of Thrace, so it's no surprise that the music of the Balkans is known for its breathtaking harmonies, exciting dissonances, and
remarkable and unique rhythms.  If you’ve
heard the music, you know what we’re talking about and you’ve already fallen under
its spell.  If this is your first time,
be prepared to fall in love. Orfeia has had the opportunity to travel and perform in Bulgaria, and each trip has deepened our commitment to the music. One of our favorite memories from our 2010 trip is Tatiana directing us in this impromptu performance of a medley of traditional songs in the Old Town of Sozopol, surrounded by ancient remnants of the southern fortress walls.
The music and cultures of the Balkan region (including Bulgaria, Serbia, Greece, Macedonia, and Bosnia) are centuries old. Traditional vocal music has been handed down from parent to child
over centuries, but these traditions are becoming lost. We want to sustain and make available this wonderful
heritage and no one is better qualified to do so than Bulgarian national
treasure Tatiana Sarbinska, Orfeia’s artistic director.  Formerly a principal soloist with the Pirin
Ensemble and recipient of the Ivan Vasov award for contributions to Bulgarian
culture, Tatiana brings to the project an encyclopedic knowledge of Bulgarian
traditional music and culture and more than three decades of teaching vocal
technique to beginner and professional, young and old. 
In 2012, Tatiana and Orfeia recorded, transcribed, and assembled
teaching materials for a Balkan vocal residency with Carpe Diem Arts in
Montgomery County, Maryland. Through this workshop we led a multi-age, multi-cultural
community choir in learning and performing songs from across Balkan regions,
including Bulgaria, Serbia, Greece, Macedonia, and Bosnia. After just four rehearsals the group joined Orfeia for a successful public concert and a
performance at a local music festival. This experience was part of the

first stretch goal of up to $10,000 will allow us to add additional

ornamentation) on the learning CD, and to increase the production quality of
the book, including original cover art. A stretch goal of up to $12,000 will

descriptions of the cultural context of the music, and to include unique food
recipes from different Bulgarian regions.Orfeia is a non-profit 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization, so your donation is tax-deductible! We would like to thank you for your donations and have put together a special set of gifts we think you will enjoy - see the perks on the sidebar! From Orfeia's 2010 trip to the National Festival of Bulgarian Folklore in KoprivshtitsaOther Ways You Can HelpWe understand that not everyone who is excited about the Balkan Songbook Project is able to contribute financially, but that's not the only way you can support our work! story:
Short Summary

Greetings,

I am Prashanth Ramesh, working as a Music Tutor in a reputed Music School in Chennai, India. A sudden financial crisis in my family has forced me to stay away from my parents for few years. They are now completely dependent on me for survival.

I am hoping to make it big in the Music and Film industry with few of my friends, who have been a constant support for me. Music started off as my passion, but now I want to make it my career! We are already involved in some potential projects and also planning to release an album, for which the work is in progress. But to go further, I need to buy equipments which will help me in my goal and also gain experience.

Your contribution will be a major turning point in my life, which will help me put an end to all my problems and unite me with my family as soon as possible.

What I Need

I will need $5000 to take my creativity to the next level, which consists of the following:

1. A high performance laptop.

2. A Soundcard.

3. Monitors.

4. A Keyboard for Programming.

5. Good quality Mics

6. DAW Licensed Softwares

I am confident that you will definitely help me in realizing my dreams, but in case I don't reach my target I will have funds at least to buy some, if not all of the above mentioned equipments.

The Impact

My team and I are a bunch of enthusiasts, who want to make an impact in the Industry because we believe we are The Future! I have already done a lot of interesting projects in the Media Industry, in association with Eclipse Creations, a Media Works firm based in Chennai, India, some of which you can find on the YouTube channel : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vnD7VVSTu0c&list=PLIhbkHayRPF8VFgSZkIODk1y5YW2PAEBD

Other Ways You Can Help

Kindly spread the word about my campaign so that it can reach more people who are willing to help me.

Do contact me personally at rp1990@gmail.com once you make your contribution and I will make sure you get a free copy of our Album CD along with your Name mentioned in the credits.

story:
Who is REENIE?

I'm Reenie Perkovic, a Toronto-based guitarist, vocalist, and songwriter!

This project, my sophomore album Parallel Place, represents a culmination of moving to Toronto, a full leap into pursuing my passion as a musician, an incredible outpouring of support and love from a new musical community, learning to listen to my own voice and fighting "the good fight," as Paulo Coelho puts it, every day towards developing that sound.

I have taken my classical training as an instrumentalist and composer, and inspiration from the many talented pop and jazz musicians I have met and collaborated with here, and am creating something that I am truly proud of.

This album will feature:
Tara Kannangara - trumpet
David Rubel - tenor sax
Aidan Sibley - trombone
Chris Pruden & Winston Matsushita - piano/keys
Dave Haskett & Phill Albert - bass
Robert Diack - drums
Lea Kirstein & Rachel Capon - strings

BUT, it is an ambitious project, and I need your help to realize it in its entirety.

 

What is the inspiration behind Parallel Place?

We've all wondered: "What If?" What would life be like if I'd gone a different direction? We're all searching for that Parallel Place in the universe where we have all the things we desire, where we feel fulfilled.

This album is about every day people, searching for more from life and from themselves. It's about the artist in all of us, searching for that one song, that one melody, that one texture, that one lyric that will make us feel complete and connected.

Well folks, we've finally found an album full of those moments and we REALLY want to share them with you!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're recording at a studio in town called Canterbury Music Company, with a talented engineer named Jeremy Darby, who has worked with the likes of: Ella Fitzgerald, Aerosmith, Keith Richards...to name a few. SO EXCITING.

But there's much more that goes into making a successful recording:

Recording/mixing: $5,800
Producer: $800
Paying all the musicians fairly: $3,700
Mastering: $600
Album artwork: $200
Making physical copies of the CD: $1,320

TOTAL: $12,420

*************

As you can see, this campaign won't cover everything. But I've applied for a couple of grants to help with the remainder. Wish me luck!

***** By PRE-ORDERING the album in advance you will help us finish it and get it to your ears ASAP! *****

And if you're feeling especially supportive, take a look at our list of AWESOME perks. You can order a new song written by us for you, or dinner and a night of serenading, or we may even take requests for YOUR OWN perk ideas!

The Impact

We've gone into the studio a couple of times already, so that we can continue to show you sneak previews of what we're working on!

The rest of the album all relies on you and your belief in us, my friends!

I've finally created something I'm so incredibly proud of, and cannot wait to share it with you. A fusion of old school R&B and modern pop. Songs about things we all feel.

So much of my heart is in these compositions. It would mean the world to me to make this a reality.

 

Don't have the funds? You can still help!

Here are other ways you can help:

  • Make some noise! Let your family, friends, & friends of friends know about our campaign! Please share the link wherever you can, if you believe in our project!
  • If you're in town, attend our shows! We'd love to see you.

story:
Our Story

Lady Sings it Better are going to Edinburgh Fringe! After sell out seasons in Sydney and Adelaide, we've been offered a spot by Remarkable Arts in 2012. This baby's going international!

Lady Sings it Better are a cabaret troupe of six female singers (and a 3 piece band), who take songs written by men and reinvent them in a woman's voice. Put simply, we tell stories about women, with glorious, surprising arrangements. But anyone who's seen us will say we're much more than that! The audience get a playful, sassy, tongue-in-cheek, feminist romp through popular culture (and some alternative culture too). This is really "something for everyone" cabaret!

The Impact

For the performers, this tour will have a lasting impact on their artistic careers. They will benefit from intensive training during preparation, and from performing in front of presenters, programmers, directors and producers at the world's largest international fringe festival.

For blackcat productions (Maeve and Phoebe), this opportunity is about proving ourselves and launching our careers as Producers of high quality women and queer cabaret artists. At the Edinburgh Fringe we will meet the world's best producers, directors and cabaret performers, and we'll network with producers, programmers and promoters from all around the world. We will use the connections made and experience gained to expand our portfolio of work, develop new cabaret productions, and approach other artists, offering our services for the production of their local and international tours. This is a career-making adventure, the spoils of which we hope to share with Sydney's growing community of independent cabaret artists.

What We Need

So we're off to Edinburgh, but it ain't cheap! The total budget (carefully planned by Phoebe)  is over $50,000! We're pursuing a number of fundraising sources, from sponsorship, to gigs, to grants, to precious pennies currently being saved in Maeve and Phoebe's own bank accounts! So, why Indiegogo? Why now?

The $25,000 we hope to raise on indiegogo pays for flights and accommodation, which we want to book and pay for as soon as possible, so as to get good deals and lock in the trip! The money raised on indiegogo will be spent as follows:

- flights: $16,500 approx. (for 11 people: 9 performers, 1 sound op and Phoebe!)

- accommodation: $8,500 approx. (1 month in Edinburgh and a few nights in London: we promise to blog about the hilarity of shared living!)


What happens if we don't raise this much? We'll have to pursue other funding sources - sources which are, unfortunately, much harder to access. This fundraising will be slower, meaning we have to pay for costs later, most likely making them greater. At worst, we won't be able to go. If we can't go to Edinburgh, we'll use funds raised to tour within Australia, to Melbourne and Adelaide, with a view to heading to Edinburgh in 2013.

What You Get

Check out the 'perks' for what we're offering. But if you're a big spender (or even a little one!) and you want something we haven't thought of, please get in touch. We want to make donating worth your while!


IMPORTANT NOTE RE CURRENCY: Prices are in US$ meaning that you'll probably be charged a little less than you 'officially' donate, if you're Australian. Bear in mind the exchange rate!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Help spread the word! Tell your friends about our fundraising! Maybe they like the arts (or the women) and will sling us $20 or so. Or maybe they're millionaires just gunning to press go on the big bucks! Either way, the more people you tell, the better!
  • Come to our gigs. We'll be singing in public a lot more, to fundraise, but also to put us through our paces for the grueling 4 week Edinburgh run!
  • Donate in-kind support. Don't have much money? No worries. You might have old costumes, free rehearsal space, connections at flight centre... maybe you know how to build websites or you're a hot photographer. In-kind support is just as valuable as $$$!
  • Give us your honest feedback about the show. Cheers and compliments are great, but we want to know when a song or joke doesn't work. They aren't our friends in Edinburgh. You - our test audience - are our best gauge of success. We'd love to hear what you think of Lady.

“As far as cabaret goes, this particular incarnation by the girls who form Lady Sings It Better is spectacular, in the real showstopper sense… Talk about sisters doing it for themselves…the showstopper was just the start of the show.”
- Vanessa Lahey, Lady Sings it Better review, Australian Stage Online

story:
My Story

My name is Quaz and I am a hip hop recording artist, producer and songwriter here in Charlotte NC.  I have had the opportunity to inspire, uplift, and motivate people thru my music for years. I have even had the opportunity recently to start my own record label BE.E.Z. records and released my first solo album this year. 



I have enjoyed having the freedom of having my own recording studio as it allows for greater creativity and allows me the opportunity to collaborate on a greater level. 

However that freedom was taken away as my studio was recently robbed on Valentines Day (Yea of all days).

My studio computer, backup hard drive, monitors, microphones, guitars, were all stolen. This has forced me to delay the release of my second album T.R.A.P. (Tomorrow Really Aint Promised). I will have to re-record most of the album and also pay for singers, musicians, and other artist to redo their contributions to the album. \

But i was made to do this! Im not gonna let the loss of equipment slow me down. Im going to rebuild my studio and make it better than ever! BUT I NEED YOUR HELP.

What is needed:

Computer

Studio Monitors

Preamp

Monitors

Microphones

Guitars (acoustic and electric)

Audio cables

Mic Stands

Audio Software

 

The Investment

I have built my career on innovation in hip hop while still maintaining a positive message. After having my studio broken into and stripped of most of the components I not only lost recording equipment but also years of music from myself and other indie artist. I want to show my listeners, friends, family, and those who look up to me that no matter what the odds are faith and work ethic always prevail. 20% of the proceeds from my next album T.R.A.P. will go to developing the Urban Music Foundation. With your help we can turn a unfortunate event into an opportunity to inspire children from every walk of life. I invite you to help me

story:
Dear BMS Music Room B alums and their families,

TWO NOTES: 1) THIS CAMPAIGN is set to END ON TUESDAY 9/2/2014 at 12 noon pacific time as originally planned. 2) David just announced on 8/25 that he will soon be teaching at Lawrence Catholic Academy grades K-8 which is great news for him and his family.  If you still want to donate we're guessing he can still use some extra resources given this will now be a much longer commute.

If you still want to donate, consider it a" good bye and best of luck in Lawrence" gift.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Before Mr Lu landed his new job this campaign began and was titled:  Wouldn't it be nice to give Mr Lu a Sabbatical? The title has since changed but below is the original message.  We 're still including it for people who are not familiar with events of 2014...

For those of you whom have not heard, David Lussier left Blanchard Middle School at the end of this year. Although he loved teaching at BMS, he resigned when he was told that his position was cut to a half- time position.

As you know David is one in a million as an inspiring teacher, mentor and coach. He taught at Blanchard for 14 years where he has helped hundreds of BTA middle school kids build their confidence and their talents.

Many of us think this is a loss for Westford, but with his many talents we know that he will land on his feet and some other community will be so blessed.

This campaign is to raise funds but to show support too.  Any contribution amount is welcome. 

While many did get to honor David at a wonderful goodbye party, unfortunately we are not able to do a huge event that would span the alumni from the past 14 years (have you ever seen the ending of the movie, MR HOLLAND'S OPUS?). Instead we thought "Hey, let's show him our appreciation and deep respect through a crowd sourced campaign that spans friends and fans of Mr. Lu  from the past 14 years."  

Whether you know Mr. Lu from the year 2014, or from 2000, or any of the years in between, thank you for participating. 



(p.s. For further verification of this campaign contact either jane.bouffard@gmail.com or Heather Lussier, weebomoo2@gmail.com)
story_txt: Dear BMS Music Room B alums and their families,TWO NOTES: 1) THIS CAMPAIGN is set to END ON TUESDAY 9/2/2014 at 12 noon pacific time as originally planned. 2) David just announced on 8/25 that he will soon be teaching at Lawrence Catholic Academy grades K-8 which is great news for him and his family.  If you still want to donate we're guessing he can still use some extra resources given this will now be a much longer commute. If you still want to donate, consider it a" good bye and best of luck in Lawrence" gift.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Before Mr Lu landed his new job this campaign began and was titled:  Wouldn't it be nice to give Mr Lu a Sabbatical? story:
Indiegogo Blues


Indiegogo résume en un seul mot

Une panoplie d'émotions bien connues des artistes dans ma situation

Si c'est un concept nouveau, laissez-moi vous expliquer en gros.


J'ai besoin d'argent ! Et j'ai besoin de vous

Je vais jouer, chanter, composer pour vous, en espérant que vous me donnerez des sous

Pour payer les musiciens, les techniciens, les frais de studio et l'accord du piano.


I need money! And I need your generosity

This, my friends, is a rare opportunity to play a part in the making of art!

I'm sure you'll be content with the gifts that I'll present.


En contribuant à cette campagne de financement

Vous recevrez pour votre générosité : un album, une photo, un concert en solo ou en duo, même un cours de piano !

Et ma reconnaissance réelle en format virtuel sur les médias sociaux.


Whether you give a little or a lot, and even if you cannnot, please spread the news!

Maybe that Facebook friend you've never met will be thrilled by the prospect of helping

To put the fun in crowdfunding and ease my Indiegogo blues.


© Marie-Claire Durand 2014


À propos / About



Du prochain album / The new album

Accompagnée par Joel Kerr à la contrebasse et Eric Thibodeau à la batterie, j'enregistrerai ma collection de chansons cet été, sur ruban 2" au studio 451 à Verdun. Les autres collaborateurs du projet incluent Madeleine Palmer (coach vocal), Graeme Humfrey (mixing) et Guy Hébert (mastering). La date prévue de sortie est en octobre 2014.

                                          --------------------------------

Accompanied by Joel Kerr on bass and Eric Thibodeau on drums, I will record my collection of songs this summer, on 2" tape at studio 451 in Verdun. Other collaborators include Madeleine Palmer (vocal coach), Graeme Humfrey (mixing) and Guy Hébert (mastering). The album is to be released in October 2014.



Des chansons / The songs

(Vous pouvez écouter trois chansons sur mon site !)

C’est entre autre la réalité montréalaise, québécoise et canadienne, de la danse intime entre le français et l’anglais, qui explique mon choix d’écrire dans les deux langues. En français, langue maternelle et intimement liée à mon enfance, j’ai la liberté de peindre avec les mots un univers intérieur, méditatif et imagé. En anglais, ma seconde langue, plutôt relationnelle et professionnelle, mon vocabulaire est limité et plus direct, ce qui me permet d’exprimer clairement une émotion en m’adressant à un interlocuteur. Les textes de Richard Desjardins et Joni Mitchell sont une source d’inspiration continuelle.

Dans les deux langues, les thèmes explorés sont universels : l’amour, le deuil, la recherche de soi et du bonheur, la nature. Le ton y est parfois contemplatif, parfois conversationnel, autres fois humoristique. Bien que le style musical prédominant soit le jazz, l’intention fondamentale dans la composition est de peindre le texte en musique. Cela résulte parfois en une forme musicale conventionnelle, parfois en une forme qui épouse les contours du poème.

                                                   --------------------------------

(You can listen to three songs on my website!)

Inspired by her bilingual life in Montreal and Canadian singer-songwriters like Richard Desjardins and Joni Mitchell, Marie-Claire Durand writes unique and compelling songs in both official languages. In French, her mother tongue, she uses words to paint images of an introspective and meditative universe. In English, a language she associates with her relationships, she writes in a more direct way, communicating her emotions to a listener.

In both languages, Marie-Claire explores universal themes: love, grief, the search for peace and happiness, and for oneself. The tone of the songs is at times contemplative, other times conversational, and sometimes humorous. 

Stemming from her musical background as a jazz pianist, Marie-Claire's songs can mostly be described as jazz, although the fundamental intention of each composition is to paint the words with music. This sometimes results in a classic song form, and sometimes in an original form which follows the contours of the poem.



Du budget / The budget

Voici à quoi serviront vos contributions:

  • Frais de studio et de techniciens: 2000$
  • Frais de musiciens et coach vocal: 2500$
  • Mixage: 1000$
  • Matriçage: 1000$
  • Impression de CD: 1000$
  • Design de l'album: 700$
  • Vidéo, photo et promotion: 800$ minimum

Le total des dépenses s'élève à 9000$. Les contributions au projet jusqu'à maintenant incluent une bourse de FACTOR d'un montant de 1500$. Je paierai de ma poche la balance des frais.

                                     ------------------------------

Here's what your contributions will help fund:

  • Studio and technician fees: $2000
  • Musician and coach fees: $2500
  • Mixing: $1000
  • Mastering: $1000
  • CD pressing: $1000
  • CD design: $700
  • Video, photo and promotion: $800 minimum

The sum total of expenses is $9000. Contributions to the project so far include a $1500 FACTOR grant. I will cover the balance of the expenses out of pocket.



Des spectacles live / Live shows

Venez entendre live ce qui se trouvera sur l'album, et vous donner le goût de prendre un cours de piano, ou de vous offrir un concert maison !

Le samedi 26 avril à 17h, vous pourrez entendre mes compositions en solo, alors que je partagerai les planches du Café Artère avec mon ami Damon (Out of Sight of Land). Plus d'information ici.

Le lundi 26 mai à 21h, ce sera en trio au café Résonance, 5175a Avenue du Parc.

                                         --------------------------------

Come hear us play music of the new album, and to convince yourself to contribute for a piano lesson, or a house concert !

On Saturday, April 26th at 5pm at Café l'Artère, I will be playing a solo set, sharing the bill with my friend Damon (Out of Sight of Land). More info here.

On Monday May 26th at 9pm, I will be playing two sets with the trio, at Café Résonance, 5175a Avenue du Parc.



Merci !

Merci de prendre le temps de me lire et contribuer à ma campagne de financement. Si vous n'êtes pas en mesure de contribuer, merci de faire passer le mot autour de vous ! Visitez www.marieclairedurand.com pour plus de détails.

Cette campagne n'aurait pas pu être réalisée sans l'aide précieuse de deux amis, Chris Henschel (vidéo et photographie): www.chrishenschel.com et Renée Yoxon (promotion et design web): www.reneeyoxon.com.


Thank you!

Thank you for reading and contributing to this fundraising campaign. If you cannot contribute, thanks for spreading the word! Visit www.marieclairedurand.com for more details.

This campaign could not have been possible without the precious help of two dear friends, Chris Henschel (video and photography): www.chrishenschel.com and Renée Yoxon (promotion and web design): www.reneeyoxon.com.


À propos de Marie-Claire / About Marie-Claire

Originaire de Québec, Marie-Claire Durand est établie à Montréal, où elle a obtenu une maîtrise en composition jazz de l'Université McGill. Elle est active en tant que musicienne (piano, voix, composition, improvisation et arrangement) et enseignante, notamment au Cégep de Sainte-Foy.

Ses autres projets incluent le Quintet Marie-Claire Durand (OFF Festival de Jazz de Montréal 2009, Festival On Jazz sous la lune 2011), dont l'album, Mai, est paru en février 2011.

Un autre de ses projets, le trio Takk, (Festival International de Jazz de Montréal 2010, Festival de Jazz d'Halifax - Concours Galaxie Rising Star 2012) rassemble desmusiciennes (Charlotte Cornfield, Averil Parker) dont les influences et expériences diverses convergent en un résultat qui transcende les genres.


Marie-Claire est également pianiste au sein du trio Bean (OFF Festival de Jazz deMontréal 2012) avec Joel Kerr et Mark Nelson. Axé sur l'improvisation libre, le trio se spécialise dans de courtes improvisations ludiques.      

                                            -------------------------

Marie-Claire Durand is a Montreal-based musician, active as a pianist, vocalist, arranger, as well as composer and teacher (Cégep de Sainte-Foy). She received a Masters in Jazz Composition from McGill University.

Her album Mai, released in February 2011, a collection of eight original compositions for jazz quintet, was featured at the 2009 OFF Festival de Jazz de Montréal, and the 2011 Festival On Jazz sous la lune.

Her other projects include Takk, a genre-bending jazz-pop-rock trio with drummer/singer Charlotte Cornfield and saxophonist Averil Parker. (2010 Montreal International Jazz Festival , 2012 Halifax Jazz Festival - Galaxie Rising Star Contest)

She is also pianist and co-leader of Bean (Joel Kerr, Mark Nelson), a free-jazz trio focused on playful and short improvisations. The trio was featured at the 2012 OFF Festival de Jazz de Montréal.

story:
Shout Back Festival
An anarcha-feminist, queer, radical, anti-capitalist DIY music festival for anyone who wants it or thinks they might want it. A celebration in smashing patriarchy, showcasing artists who are underrepresented. This festival is for everyone who is disaffected or disgusted by the current independent music culture, dominated by straight, white males. We refuse to adapt and accommodate this inherently oppressive, hierarchical structure.  Let’s break the binary and build a new space, one that is safe, and inclusive, based on solidarity. Music for everyone.
We aim to affirm and encourage all artists doing it ourselves and empower us to keep moving forward, doing it together. Creating an environment where we break systemic barriers, help foster conversations and build relationships. Offering resources, workshops, and skill sharing. Solidarity in the struggle. Gender Liberation. What we have is RADICAL and its time to party HarD.I.Y, shred, sing along, dance our hearts out, be heard, have fun and bring this to all things we do, every action.


Because we agree that patriarchy hurts everyone!

Because we agree that music + noise making are a force for GENDER LIBERATION!

Shout Back! Fest takes place on unceded Coast Salish Territories (Vancouver BC Canada).


Why we need your support
This fest is volunteer-run, DIY and anticapitalist. All the money raised will go toward securing venues, feeding festival-goers, helping with gas costs for touring bands, printing posters, making merch. $2000 is the estimated amount to get the festival up and running. Any money remaining from the festival will be evenly split among performers.



All the awesome things that are going to happen
WORKSHOPS
Skill-sharing on a variety of subjects, such as:

❈ Anti-oppression and Decolonization❈ Direct Unionism❈ Fat Panic!❈ Feminism and Hip Hop❈ Fix Yr Bike❈ Skateboarding❈ Women in Comedy
with more TBA!!

And so, so many super bands, including..

▼ Thee AHs▼Artistic Crisis (Bellingham)▼ Ashley Pitre▼ Autococoon (Seattle)▼ Bitpart (Paris/Olympia)▼ Bumflap▼ Bushtit▼ Cascadia▼ Catty Kits▼ Cellmate (Portland)▼ Centre (Oakland)▼ Chelsea Johnson▼ Copy/Paste▼ Dad Thighs▼ Daisy World (Oakland)▼ Dead Soft▼ Derek Wheeler▼ Dream Baby▼ Fake Tears ▼ Ghost Ease (Portland)▼ Freaky Pup (Bellingham)▼Hans▼ Hard Bitch▼ Hooves▼ Hot Fruit (Olympia)▼ Hot Tears (Olympia)▼ Huntley▼ Imaginary Pants▼ Janette King▼ Kilikina▼ Kimpossible▼ Leila Neverland▼ Lié▼ Loose Tights▼ Love Cuts▼Lunchlady▼ Make Love▼ Mam Glam▼ Margy Pepper (Olympia)▼ Mass Marriage▼ Megabog (Seattle)▼ Mi'ens▼ Minnow (Olympia)▼ Movieland▼ Nancy Drew Pentagrams (Olympia)▼ Nation of Two (Seattle)▼ The Nausea▼ Noisy Tits▼ Nun un▼ Pansy▼ Ponderosas▼ Poor Choices▼ Prank War (Olympia)▼ Ratis▼ Regular Fantasy▼ Remembran (Santa Barbara)▼ Reverter▼ Rose Melberg▼ Sajia Sultana▼ Screaming Queens▼ She Dreams In Colour▼ Shearing Pinx▼ Sigh Down One▼ Skunt▼ Sontag▼ Spell▼ Stefana Fratila▼ Therapy▼ True Crush▼ Uncanny Valley▼ Village▼ Waxing Hearts (Seattle)▼ Whip

story:
Rock Tour Hire-a-Youth Fund

The Rock Tour is New Community Church's high school summer camp. Each year we take 30-50 students on an awesome adventure that includes worship, teaching from God's word, thrill rides, white water rafting, food, fun and friends. This is often a life changing experience for our students and at the very least creates fond memories they will always cherish. 

We need your help

We want every single student in our ministry to be able to go to summer camp which is why we offer them the chance to work to pay their way (our Hire-a-youth program). Over the last few years the amount of work that our church body has been able to provide has declined. That is where you come in. We are asking for donations so that we can provide hire-a-youth work here at the church for students who's families can't afford the cost of camp. 

  • We have 20+ students that need to earn anywhere from $50-$300 
  • Anyone that can help with a donation of $50 or more will receive a "Keep Calm and Rock Tour" t-shirt. 

The Impact

A week at camp will help students grow in their relationship with God, their friends and the leaders of our youth ministry.  

  • One week at camp is often more impactful on our students then a school year's worth of youth groups. 
  • Every year at camp we have a handful of students that put their faith in Jesus as their Lord and Savior.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, there are a few others ways to help out. 

  • Share our campaign with your friends and family personally or through Facebook and Twitter. 
  • Pray for us that we will reach our goal, that all our students will be able to attend camp, and that we will have an amazing time at camp growing in our faith.
story_txt:
Rock Tour Hire-a-Youth Fund The Rock Tour is New Community Church's high school summer camp. Each year we take 30-50 students on an awesome adventure that includes worship, teaching from God's word, thrill rides, white water rafting, food, fun and friends. This is often a life changing experience for our students and at the very least creates fond memories they will always cherish.    We need your help We want every single student in our ministry to be able to go to summer camp which is why we offer them the chance to work to pay their way (our Hire-a-youth program). Over the last few years the amount of work that our church body has been able to provide has declined. That is where you come in. We are asking for donations so that we can provide hire-a-youth work here at the church for students who's families can't afford the cost of camp.  
We have 20+ students that need to earn anywhere from $50-$300  Anyone that can help with a donation of $50 or more will receive a "Keep Calm and Rock Tour" t-shirt.    The Impact A week at camp will help students grow in their relationship with God, their friends and the leaders of our youth ministry.   
One week at camp is often more impactful on our students then a school year's worth of youth groups.  Every year at camp we have a handful of students that put their faith in Jesus as their Lord and Savior.   
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you can't help financially, there are a few others ways to help out.  
Share our campaign with your friends and family personally or through Facebook and Twitter.  Pray for us that we will reach our goal, that all our students will be able to attend camp, and that we will have an amazing time at camp growing in our faith.

story:
Yoshi Gish is on a lone mission to visit his elderly grandmother in Cincinnati, Ohio to perform for her 83rd birthday, before moving to Los Angeles, CA. Yoshi's Grandmother is very dear to him, and he wants to see her before he moves across the country to play and record his music.

       After being gone a second time for a whole month, he has gained life changing experience on the road. This has opened doors for many opportunities for Yoshi Gish.  With the help of fans,  friends, and his family, this tour can happen.
    This Fall Tour of 2014 will start in Florida, initially financed only by Merch sales and the money he earns from each show he plays on his journey. Yoshi will be passing through large cities, ones where he will be less likely to get shot, or car jacked in his sleep. In two months time the tour should end in Hollywood, California. 

NEW PRIZE OFFER!!!  
With a wristband, you will be able to Enter the Return of Yoshi Gish in Florida
FREE!

$5 - If you can help me with gas money:*****in a video collage for my 2014 TOUR VIDEO at www.Youtube.com/yoshigish 

<Video Release Target Date: Thanksgiving Day 2014>

$10, or more, I can send you 1 glowing wristband and PERK #1!*PLUS PERK #1 FREE SHIPPING!!! (one per Backer) 1/2" band & - IT GLOWS BLUE!! 
<Wristband grants free admission for participating shows in the near future>

$15 Get a CD


Perks #1, #2. & #3

$20 you can pick up your pre-ordered shirt at the venue on Tour list.*OR $30 WILL GET YOU A SHIRT AND A WRISTBAND FREE SHIPPING!!! 
*Thank you for your support Brenda! \m/>:)\m/
*Thank You for your support Loni! |m/>:)\m/

$40 - will include a CD!
Perks #1, #2, #3, & #4

$50 will get you a personalized CD shipped FREE to you!PLUS PERKS #1 & #2

  • $60 to include Perk #3
      -OR
  • $70 to include Perk #4

$100 VIP Private Party Package!!! Includes Perks!!!
*Thank You Sherry Scott
*Thank You Trish Rivers
PERKS #1, #2, & #3

$150 Platinum Public Event!!! Promoter/Venue Package!!!
*Thank You Kerri Jerominski and Todd @ HOTD
PERKS #1, #2, & #3
*I will make a Flier for the event to help Promote you and your Venue*
Look for the Facebook Event Page



Preparing for the Journey

Many things need to be taken care of before departure, and again during the adventure. here is an example of those expenses you can help me with.

  • Oil change ($25)
  • Brakes/rotors ($100)
  • Motor mounts ($100)
  • Merch: CD's, Shirts, Stickers ($1,000)

Costs & Expenses while on the road

Yoshi will be traveling alone, from one state of friends and family, to another by what he earns from playing each venue, and from what merch he can sell.

  • Food (value meals)
  • Oil change ($30)
  • Gas (23/mpg)
  • Storage ($100/mo)
  • Cell Phone ($100/mo)
  • Car Insurance ($100/mo)

  • Medicine (in case of illness)
  • Truck Stop Showers (Not Safe, but effective)
  • No Hotels (Too creepy, too expensive)

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just won't be able to go to all of the shows, but you can still help fund the rest of the tour:

  • fund gas at $5/gal for 25mpg.
  • buy a CD or shirt!
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask friends to get the word out and make some noise about this fund raiser.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!  


These are the dates to look for him in your state:

 Yoshi will be strategically Zig-Zagging across the country for 9 weeks, driving 6,000+ Miles, hitting 40+ cities and 27+ states to play his music for his distant fans, friends, and family.

story: This is a project to raise funds for a strong and professional single song that could really impact my music career. It is important for artists such as myself to have people to believe in me and to know that I have the support from my friends, family, and fans. I will be using 100% of the funds from this project to write, record, and produce a single and to shoot a video to go along with the songs as well. This will help me create a strong presence on the web and even in many local areas, and will ultimately let people know exactly what I am setting out to accomplish. I thank you for your time and encouragement throughout this process and project.
