story:
Short Summary

My name is Lola Moore and I am a Pastor and Worship Artist based out of Panama City, Florida. While I've been in Pastoral Ministry for nearly four years, I have been singing in choirs and as a soloist for as long as I can remember. 

I've had opportunity to minister across the United States and internationally as Worship Artist, sharing with congregations through preaching and song . Consistently, I am nearly harassed for not having music product to share. I hope to change that, this year. 

Grammy-nominated Producer and phenomenal musician, Kelvin Wooten will produce this short project and is slated to work with me on the full album, as well. It's been so exciting to watch and hear what I've hummed in my kitchen coming to life through his work. 

I've already begun funding this project but need your help. My hope is to release recording in the beginning of December in Huntsville, Alabama. Three events will provide fantastic opportunities to get the word out. Because they're in the same geographic region, they provide major opportunities for maximum impact.


The funds you give will:

  • Sponsor music: Studio time, background vocalists, live musicians.
  • Underwrite marketing: Graphic Design, Photography, Packaging, Promotional Material.

I believe God has given me gifts for the world. I have dreamt that if I could just have the opportunity, God would accomplish mighty works through me. It's happened on small scale and this is my attempt to see if there's more. 

Also, you can ask yourself if what God does through me has blessed you. If so, perhaps you can help me bless others, as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Along with your financial contribution, you can help by:

1. Sharing this campaign with others!

2. Purchasing the music when it's released in December. 2013!


Thank you!

story:
WHO IS TASH ANDERSON? 

I’m a singer-songwriter from Melbourne, Australia. I have been writing songs since I was a young girl and music has always been my true passion in life. My songs are inspired by personal experience and my music has been described as “songs of substance.” 


In 2010 I was contacted by a music manager in America who expressed interest in helping me move forward in my journey as an artist. At the time I had no management in Australia and was struggling to even book shows. We forged a team and I am now at the point where things are really starting to come together and it’s time to start seriously pushing my music. 


THE PROJECT


I recorded and produced an independent EP last year (“Overstayed Welcome”) in the US which has garnered a lot of attention in the music industry. As a result of this, I have been invited back to re-record more of my original music in a professional studio in Manhattan, New York City. I am aiming to record a full length album which has always been a dream of mine and I want to give my songs the best production possible.


COSTS INVOLVED


The recording costs for a full length album with 12 original songs will equate to between $18,000-$20,000, which breaks down to:

  • $1,500 to produce and record each song
  • $75 - $100 to master each song 

   To this point I have raised just a little over half of these funds and I now need YOUR help and support to raise $9,000 in order to realise my recording goal. 


WHEN AND WHERE


The recording will take place at Mirrortone Studios in Manhattan sometime over the next six months, depending on availability of producers and studio. 



THE IMPACT


This is a very exciting opportunity for me as things are finally beginning to take off after years of pursuing my musical dream. 

The impact will be that I can finally unleash my music upon the world in a professionally produced format that is suitable for worldwide release. This album will open many doors for me as an artist. It will allow my music to reach more people and to build a larger fan base, it will also enable me to tour and play my music live, which is my favourite thing to do!



HOW YOU CAN HELP WITHOUT

 DONATING MONEY


I understand that some of you may not be able to donate money to this campaign. You can still support me by telling all your friends and family about my campaign, and by sharing this link and video on social media such as Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. 


WHAT YOU WILL GET 

There are a number of offers for all those who donate. I will be sending out CD’s, T-shirts, signed photos and you can even get your own song written for you about you! 

PLEASE VISIT MY WEBSITES:

  • www.tashanderson.com 
  • www.youtube.com/tashanderson1
  • https://www.facebook.com/pages/Tash-Anderson/36305334203?fref=nf
  • www.twitter.com/tashanderson1
  • https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/overstayed-welcome-single/id695419312


PLEASE WATCH THIS MEDLEY OF MY SONGS:


THANKYOU, THANKYOU, THANKYOU!!!!!

story:
The Burlington Boys Choir is a diverse ensemble consisting of auditioned boys, ages 8-12, from Alamance County. The mission of the choir is to maintain a living choral tradition in Alamance and to promote self-esteem and discipline among its members.

Annually the choir performs about twenty times in venues ranging from local church services and civic functions to their own public concerts and symphonic performances. The choir has traveled both at home and abroad.  This year the choir plans to travel to Washington D.C. from April 25-27 to perform at a local church in Alexandria, VA, at St. John's Episcopal Church, Lafayette Square, and at the capitol building.  It will cost approximately $600 per child for travel expenses, including room and board.  In order to provide equal access for all the boys, we are campaigning for the total cost of the trip.

Be sure to spread the word about our campaign and check out our Burlington Boys Choir webpage for further information.

#LoveAndHashtagsTour

APRIL 13-24, 2014

                 4/13 The Outer Space - Hamden, CT   9-10:30pm *

                     4/14 Open Mic Contest, Lizard Lounge - Cambridge, MA   8-11pm**

4/17 Pianos (upstairs lounge) - New York, NY   7-10pm

4/19 Mugshots Coffeehouse  - Philadelphia, PA   4-6pm

4/22 Radio Bean - Burlington, VT  8:30-9:30pm

4/24 Globehoppers Coffeehouse & Lounge - Richmond, VA   7-9pm

*$5 cover charge. **Not a full gig, $6 cover charge

All other shows are FREE

We are playing this tour for tips and donations ONLY

(ADDITIONAL APPEARANCES TBD - #PayWhatYouCan VIRTUAL CONCERTS via STAGEIT.com TBA )

ABOUT US - or- 

Hold Up- Here's Why This Is Epic 

Laurie Lehner (NY), Scott McLaughlin (CA) and Charlie Barker (WV) 

are solo artists whose paths crossed while each began gaining new listeners from the same fan community on Twitter. The three singer-songwriters will meet in person for the first time when they tour the East Coast to play their original songs & signature multi-genre covers together. A tweet of support from their champion, violinist Boyd Tinsley (Dave Matthews Band) inspired a name for the tour;

 >>Click the GALLERY tab for more photos and videos of us!

>>Check out our EPK for bios, mp3s, videos and updates at #LoveAndHashtags


We are gratefully accepting donations for: 

  • $$$ TRAVEL (Tolls, Fuel for the tour van)
  • $$$ ACCOMMODATIONS (Hotel rooms, showers, virtual gig venues)
  • $$$ ADDITIONAL COSTS (Promotional materials, incidentals)
  • $$$ MEDIA RECORDING (audio/video, if we can afford it)


         Follow us on Twitter

                          @phishmarket15   @LaurieLehner   @scottmmusic


                                                    Like us on Facebook 

                   The Laurie Lehners    ScottMcLaughlinMusic   CharlieBarker

                                                  Visit our Official Websites 

                      LLmusicOfficial   Charlie Barker EP   ScottMmusicOfficial

1 random selection from an assortment of lovely hand-made dmb-style jewelry 

Artist, Cassandra Chancey @everydaydmb1341  http://www.etsy.com/shop/EverydayDmb41



HandCrafted Tin Can Luminary

Repurposed Soup Can Lantern Art - Unique Perforated Design 

Courtesy of: Kira Zawacki, Artist

Dreaming Dancer Tote - $100 Handmade by Artist, Josie (@DocMac)


Fire dancer Canvas - Original - $300 Donation - 1 available 
Artwork on flat 16x18 Canvas. Multi-colored Ribbon Background Featuring Firedancer 

Courtesy of: William Roediger, Artist



Thank You if you donated to the last campaign! It is such a huge help to us and we are workin' on getting your perks to you! 

Do you want to host a virtual gig from your living room? Do you live on our tour track and can let us crash for the night? Let us know!

CONTACT: Laurie Lehner MakeLove23@gmail.com

Laurie Lehner (NY), Scott McLaughlin (CA) and Charlie Barker (WV) 
are solo artists whose paths crossed while each began gaining new listeners from the same fan community on Twitter. The three singer-songwriters will meet in person for the first time when they tour the East Coast to play their original songs & signature multi-genre covers together. A tweet of support from their champion, violinist Boyd Tinsley (Dave Matthews Band) inspired a name for the tour; >>Click the GALLERY tab for more photos and videos of us!>>Check out our EPK for bios, mp3s, videos and updates at #LoveAndHashtags
We are gratefully accepting donations for: 


$$$ TRAVEL (Tolls, Fuel for the tour van)

$$$ ACCOMMODATIONS (Hotel rooms, showers, virtual gig venues)
$$$ ADDITIONAL COSTS (Promotional materials, incidentals)
$$$ MEDIA RECORDING (audio/video, if we can afford it)
         Follow us on Twitter                          @phishmarket15   @LaurieLehner   @scottmmusic                                                    Like us on Facebook                    The Laurie Lehners    ScottMcLaughlinMusic   CharlieBarker                                                  Visit our Official Websites                       LLmusicOfficial   Charlie Barker EP   ScottMmusicOfficial   Everyday Love - Jewelry1 random selection from an assortment of lovely hand-made dmb-style jewelry Artist, Cassandra Chancey @everydaydmb1341  http://www.etsy.com/shop/EverydayDmb41HandCrafted Tin Can LuminaryRepurposed Soup Can Lantern Art - Unique Perforated Design Courtesy of: Kira Zawacki, Artist  Limited Edition Tour Poster Artwork by Kira Zawacki, Designed by Laurie Lehner (the poster girls)Dreaming Dancer Tote - $100 Handmade by Artist, Josie (@DocMac)

Fire dancer Canvas - Original - $300 Donation - 1 available Artwork on flat 16x18 Canvas. Multi-colored Ribbon Background Featuring Firedancer 
Courtesy of: William Roediger, ArtistThank You if you donated to the last campaign! It is such a huge help to us and we are workin' on getting your perks to you! Do you want to host a virtual gig from your living room? Do you live on our tour track and can let us crash for the night? Let us know!CONTACT:
Laurie Lehner
MakeLove23@gmail.com

story:
My Story

Hello there. My name is Milo Hayden. I'm an independent composer and artist based out of Portland, OR.

For years I played music in the classical scene, playing violin at competitions, in orchestras, and in chamber groups. It was fun to perform, but there was a certain element that was lacking. I could make the violin sing, but where was my voice?


Armed with a laptop and a pickup, I aimed to start exploring the music of my heart and see where that journey would take me. Now, nine months later, the path I am on is leading me to a debut album. The songs are there, the interest is there, I just need help with the final push to make it a reality.


60 days of fundraising for 60 minutes of music. Sounds like a challenge.



The Impact

Almost all the music I make has found it's audience in the performing arts. I've performed with aerialists, acrobats, dancers, and for friends. My music has been featured on tv, in nightclubs, and at large and small events. 
In all these instances it has simply been word of mouth and trust in my abilities that have granted me an audience and a chance to perform. With this album I can reach more performers, a larger audience, and greater opportunities to perform my music and create unique experiences within listeners.



What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to reach $5000 by the end of the campaign.

That should cover recording time with a professional recording studio, mastering for the entire album, a physical CD release, merchandise, release party/performance, and a music video.


The final result will be a high-quality professional release that will be available to everyone that donates to my campaign. Also, for those of you in the Portland, OR area, there will be an official release event where the entire album will be played from start to finish, live and with musicians. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I'm going to get this out there as much as possible within the next 60 days, but it doesn't end there. It's important that this campaign goes far and wide with your help. Share it on facebook, email it to friends and other musicians, and if there are any blogs or websites that you think it would be perfect for... send it their way.


Thank you for help and interest.

story:
The Impact

If we are able to make it to LA to showcase we will be able to get our break as other notable bands have done before us at the World Wide Radio Summit. Bands such as Dead Letter Circus and Temper Trap have all showcased and have then gone on to be some of this country's biggest bands. We don't expect the world to ever come from anything, but this is the biggest opportunity we've ever been given and we'd love you to share in this with us.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The opportunity to showcase at the World Wide Radio Summit has come to us unexpectedly and with little notice, and we are forever grateful to be accepted, and we need to get there!

 

This year has seen us head to the studio and record two new singles, that each one of you will get for free when you donate, in return you will share with us the journey of reaching our goal to fly to LA and showcase our music to the USA.

 

On this journey you will receive daily video updates and photo via an exclusive mailout, and also receive a signed copy of our last release.

 

For those of you that pledge the top dollar (2 only) we will bring Alibrandi to you for a fully fledged rock concert and classic Australian BBQ. (SE Queensland/ Northern NSW only)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot pledge it would mean a great deal to us all if you were to share this link via Facebook or Twitter and help get the word out.

story:
Our Story

transit is a five-man Vocal Band from Raleigh, North Carolina. transit is five singers, that's it.  Our only instruments are our natural born voices.  Everything you hear from the stage and on our studio recordings begins with the human voice.  Utilizing the latest technology we combine our vocal talents with stage and studio effects to bring our music to life and put on a show that those who have never seen a vocal band will hardly believe.


transit draws on the combined talents of 5 extraordinary individuals who have been a part of the vocal music scene for more than ten years.  Their love for a cappella is second only to their love for music.


We need your help to keep our show on the road and spread our unique style of music to the World.  We take a cappella into the realm of Rock n' Roll in a way that you cannot believe. We are dedicated to bringing our music to people all over the World and Rock Your Face Off!  

In order to take our sound to the next level, we need new equipment for our live show and for the recording studio.  We've launched a wide range of exclusive, never-before-seen transit perks of all kinds for you guys!  Take the step from fan to VIP today!

The Impact

We play hundreds of shows for thousands of people every year.  We bring our music to people of all ages, backgrounds, and tastes at bars, festivals, concert halls, colleges, and schools. Our educational outreach programs reach thousands of students every year, and by showing them that music can be cool, rockin', and fun, we help foster a new generation of musicians of all styles.  


What We Need & What You Get

Every single dollar that comes our way will go towards improving our live sound and studio efforts. In order to take our sound the next level, we need the following equipment: 

(5) TC Helicon VOICE-LIVE 2 Pedals: 

 These will allow us to run our sound right from the stage without having to rely on a dedicated sound engineer.  These pedals can adjust our sound with the touch of a button, while also running other standard Rock N' Roll effects such as distortion, reverb, and more.  


In-Ear Monitor setup: 

These custom fit in-ear monitors will allow us to cut down on our total equipment setup, while improving our overall performance.  They are smaller and quicker to setup than traditional monitors, and much easier to take on the road. Our on-stage monitor sound will not change drastically from place to place and because we perform in so many different stages and venues, this is invaluable.

Studio time and Recording Engineer: 

Studio equipment and time is expensive, and without additional help we will not be able to release another album for another year.  With your help, we will be able to spend more concentrated time in the studio and make the best album you can imagine.

So what do you get for your help? 

We have set up an array of options in our VIP Perks store for those interested in helping us get what we need. With everything from backstage passes to limited exclusive first-look downloads and custom songs and performances just for you, there is something for fans of all kinds.  Check out all of the available perks, and see what we can do for you! And, as always, if you have any questions at all, don't hesitate to ask! We would love to customize your perk to make it as personal as possible.   

Other Ways You Can Help

For just five dollars you can earn our undying gratitude and help us get what we need.  If you can't give $5, thats ok! You can still help be a part of this project by sharing our story with as many people as you can! Friends, family, coworkers, that guy at the dog park - every person who hears about us helps to make this project possible. So share it on Facebook, we'll friend you! Put it on twitter, we'll RT! Share our project on blogs, websites, myspace, youtube, anywhere you can think of, and we'll do whatever it takes to make sure you know how much we appreciate everything you do to help us out.  Thank you!

story:
On Saturday, May 25th, ChamberLab is turning one year old! And you can be a part of it, whether you're in Tucson or not!

---------

THIS CONCERT IS SOLD OUT!

Thank you all for your incredible support! By early Saturday afternoon, we'll know if a any seats open up. Please email Chris Black at chrisblack.genius@gmail.com to be put on the stand-by list, and please include your phone number and number of seats desired in that email.

Contributions are still welcome for such perks as downloads and physical copies of the finished CD, but we have sold all available seats for the show.

For advance notice of future concerts, please sign up for our email list at chamberlab.tumblr.com.

For ticket holders: Dinner seating is SOLD OUT. We are looking into the possibility of adding tables. If more seats become available, we'll post an update and all backers will receive and email. 

-----------

ChamberLab -- Tucson's Alt-Classical, DIY Chamber Music Series -- is celebrating its first anniversary with a special concert at Cafe Desta. This concert will feature some of our favorite pieces from the last year, and it will be recorded by Craig Schumacher of Wavelab for a live album.

The show starts at 7:30 and ends at 9:30, with an intermission, and seating will be limited, so please contribute here to reserve your place!

ChamberLab has grown.

ChamberLab is on a mission to tunnel under the wall that separates classical music from every other kind of music in the world. This series started with a bunch of frantic emails and a couple of rehearsals, and has grown with each quarterly concert into something truly wonderful. It's time to step up and show off what we've done, and to make a record of it in the process. This is our victory lap!

It's also a great opportunity for those of you who've missed some of our previous concerts to hear our favorite pieces from the last year. We'll feature music by Chris Black, Benjamin DeGain, Dante Rosano, Marco Rosano (seen in the video above), Tony Rosano, and more ...

The instrumentation is eclectic in the extreme! You can count on bassoons, contrabassoon, violin, cello, piano, double bass, tuba, accordion, trombone, clarinet, flute, piccolo, vibraphone, glass bowls ... we have quite the assortment.

Video of our last concert is available on our YouTube Channel. Audio of our previous shows, and more information about ChamberLab, can be found on our Tumblr. Take a listen to what we've done so far, and be a part of our One-Year Anniversary Celebration!

This show has a budget to meet!

This is our most ambitious ChamberLab concert yet, and here's what we need to make it happen:

  1. $1000 to pay the musicians -- a new record for us! And by the way, the composers have not yet been paid for these shows! Everything we've made has to gone the talented musicians, giving their time and effort to make this happen!
  2. $150 to rent some chairs for you to sit in!
  3. $250 for the recording and mastering.

GRAND TOTAL: $1400

This is just the bottom-line, must-have goal to make this concert work! More is better. More is much better! If we can raise more, we'll be able to hire a videographer for the night, have fancier packaging for the CDs, and maybe even pay the composers for once!

Please consider the "Sustaining Support" contribution level to help us make this concert and this album the best that it can be.

Also, please note that every $5 or $15 added to the admission contribution level for downloads and CDs is seriously appreciated. Ticket sales alone will not likely cover our costs.

NAME YOUR PERK!

Don't see the reward you want? Let us know! Shoot us an email with your idea -- maybe you'd like to be present at a rehearsal, maybe you'd like a T-shirt, maybe something we haven't even thought of -- and if it's possible, we'll add it to the list for you!

We need your support to make this happen!

Again, this is the biggest show we've attempted, and we need your help to succeed! Please treat this Indiegogo campaign as a way not only to get advance tickets -- which is very important to us -- but also as a way to support the series, pay the musicians, and get some great music into the bargain.

Also, consider sharing this campaign with your friends via Facebook and other social sites. We truly appreciate it!

Concert Details:

  • WHAT: ChamberLab 1-Year Anniversary. (ALL AGES)
  • WHERE: Cafe Desta, 758 S. Stone Ave in Tucson.
  • WHEN: Saturday, May 25th.
  • DOORS: 7pm, show from 7:30 to 9:30 with an intermission.
  • ADMISSION: $15 at the door, or $10 through this Indiegogo!
  • REFRESHMENTS: Cafe Desta offers delicious coffee, tea and juices. Beer and wine is BYOB!

Also, consider sharing this campaign with your friends via Facebook and other social sites. We truly appreciate it!


Concert Details:




WHAT: ChamberLab 1-Year Anniversary. (ALL AGES)

WHERE: Cafe Desta, 758 S. Stone Ave in Tucson.

WHEN: Saturday, May 25th.

DOORS: 7pm, show from 7:30 to 9:30 with an intermission.

ADMISSION: $15 at the door, or $10 through this Indiegogo!

REFRESHMENTS: Cafe Desta offers delicious coffee, tea and juices. Beer and wine is BYOB!

story:
Bobby Paltauf is now 13 years old,  he is a young Blues entertainer, that plays from the heart. He has been playing guitar since he was 7 years old,  Opened shows for America, Ivan Neville, Played with Buddy Guy, Anders Osborne and many more!

He is headed to Memphis TN, to represent CT in the IBC, INTERNATIONAL BLUES CHALLENGE.

It will be for a week of events, and he will play at many events, with many kids from around the world!

He needs help to pay for this trip, your donation will help pay for gas, hotel and food.

In return for your suport we are having perks, we will send you for every donation over 20.

I know that some friends cant help with money , however if you can help by forwarding this to your friends it is still a huge help!

www.rjpmusic.webs.com

paltauf@gmail.com

or call and chat 203-223-2927 Dad Robert Paltauf Sr

story:
Dammit!

                

Hello we are Dammit! A San Francisco California based Metal/Punk band. What we are trying to do is record our feature length album and then set off on a tour. San Francisco has a rich history of Thrash Metal from bands like Exodus, Death Angel, Metallica and we are hoping to fulfill our dreams of following in the footsteps of these great bands and bring you the best possible record. Our dreams of the album are long overdue and that is why we are finally asking you for help.  Our band has been doing local gigs for years in seedy dive bars around the Bay and the proverbial clock is ticking. Is there a time limit on your dreams?

Often we think to ourselves with the high cost of living in the area how the hell are we going to afford the costs for recording and releasing our album especially as an indie band. We all live the grind of the boring day job that just barely gets us by and are driven to make music, it is our passion and obsession against great odds to break our band out to the world.

 

So our plan is this, we are trying to raise $6000 to make an amazing, epic and spine crushing metal album for you to rock out too.

                                                  

What would you get out of this?

Let me tell you first off any donation will get your name on our album jacket, also placed on our website and any other promotional materials.

Second a Dammit! Sticker or many Dammit! Stickers depending on your donation.

With a larger donation you can help star in our upcoming music video which will be filmed in the San Francisco area.

       

 

These funds gained will go to the recording and pressing of our upcoming album "All To Hell" anything extra will help fuel the tour.

 

Please help pass this along to your friends and spread the word that Metal is alive and well in San Francisco.

Thank you from Dammit!

                     

Remember the IndieGoGo Share tools to help spread the word.

Let me tell you first off any donation will get your name on our album jacket, also placed on our website and any other promotional materials.
Second a Dammit! Sticker or many Dammit! Stickers depending on your donation.
With a larger donation you can help star in our upcoming music video which will be filmed in the San Francisco area.
        
 
These funds gained will go to the recording and pressing of our upcoming album "All To Hell" anything extra will help fuel the tour.

 
Please help pass this along to your friends and spread the word that Metal is alive and well in San Francisco.
Thank you from Dammit!
                      

Remember the IndieGoGo Share tools to help spread the word.

story:
Hey y’all it’s us, lespecial.

We are three musicians who have grown up playing music together since we were young pups.  We have been a band for 8 years now, first emerging from the barren woods of Connecticut, and now based out of Boston and Millerton, NY where we run our independent music school, “The Music Cellar.”

Over the past several months we have been working tirelessly on our new EP, “Ceremony,” which will be released February 12th.

The EP was recorded at Studio Metronome in New Hampshire and we are proud to say that we have created a piece of work that truly represents who we are as a band. We will be touring the East Coast in February and March in support of it and we are very excited to share our new music with all of you.  Our goal is to raise $5000 in support of this tour toward merchandise expenses, gas, insurance and repairing our van. Throughout the 8 years that we have been a band we have gotten to where we are because of our friends, families and supporters and we thank you sincerely for your continued support.

This Indiegogo has been designed as a way for you sweet pea’s to support our band while also receiving your choice of a number of unique pre-sale packages only available here. Packages range from a $5 digital download of the EP to music lessons at the Music Cellar, limited edition screen prints, an intimate dinner with the band and more. We invite you, our friends, families and supporters to be a part of this new EP, tour and the next chapter for lespecial.

Even if you are unable to donate you can still contribute by helping us spread the word about this campaign. Thank you all so much and we will see you soon.

story:
Hey everyone I’m Erin Timperley and I’m here to tell you why I started Give To Others.

In 1994 at the age 7 my older brother  Joel was diagnosed with non Hodgkin’s lymphoma(type of cancer). He would spend the next couple of years in and out of Children’s Hospital of Los Angeles. It was very tough battle but he fought hard and pulled through.

 

One of things that stood out most to me while my brother was in the hospital. Is  he would always come home from the hospital with a bunch of toys. For some reason  those toys made him feel so much better. Although I was a jealous five year old and wished I could have all his cool new toys. I knew he needed them more than me.

 

In 2001 I was 12 years old and decided I wanted to give back to the hospital that saved my brothers life.  My cousin Allie Nelson  joined me and together  with help  from  our parents we would form Give To Others!

Give To Others goal is to put a smile on hundreds of faces and give hope back to those who have lost it. We never knew that a simple thing such as a toy can make a child want to fight back. For the past eleven years around the holidays we ask our friends and families for donations. With those donations  we buy brand new toys and deliver them to Children’s hospital of Los Angeles.

 

Fundraising Goal

Each week Children’s Hospital disputes over 500 toys to patients.  Our fundraising goal is to be able to delivery 500 or more toys. 

We do accept toy donations, as long as the toy is brand new and never been opened. However we have found that money donations are the easiest way to donate, that way we can pick out toys that are in need at the hospital.

 

Can’t make a Donation? You can still help!

If you can’t afford to make a donation don’t worry you can still help us.

Tell your friends and family about our cause.

Like us and follow us on facebook.

Share this video.

Spreading the word about GTO is a huge help!

 

Fun Fact

Allie and Erin were both recognized on ABC News for their hard work.

Like Give To Others on facebook and watch our  news segment. 

 

Reminder: As stated on our website we still do not have our 501C3 license.

Which means we can not give Tax Write Offs. But like many organzations on Indiegogo we assure you all money we recieved will go towards buying toys for Children's Hosptial. 

If you would rather donate a toy leave a comment and I will tell you how you can do that. Thank You!

story:
Please don't forget to follow us on facebook and share and suggest your friends this campaign to support us!

If you are outside of the USA and would like to help us, we'd greatly appreciate if you could add few extra bucks since International shipping will cost us extra. You are prompted to enter in the contribution amount above the perk you selected. Thank you for your support!

We are Hemoptysis (He-mop-ti-sis) from Tempe, Arizona. We have been together for five and a half years. In that time we have accomplished a lot. We released an EP in 2008 called "Who Needs a Shepherd?" that received almost 40 possitive reviews. We released a full length album in 2011 called "Misanthropic Slaughter" with producer Ryan Green (Megadeth, NOFX, Alice Cooper) that received almost 70 positive reviews and more than one rating of "Best Album of the Year" for 2011. We made two music videos in support of the album for the songs "Shadow of Death" and "M.O.D." We were signed to Rock It Up Records out of Germany in 2011. We received two Phoenix Music Awards for "Metal Artist of the Year" in 2009 and 2010. We won the Independent Music Award in 2012 for "Best Metal Song" for "M.O.D."

We are very proud of our accomplishments but we don't want to stop there. We have recently written some of the best songs in the history of our band. The new material is heavier, faster, the musicianship has stepped up a couple notches and the lyrics are very personal to us. We are very proud of what we did on our full length album but we are confident we can make a recording of this new material even better. We don't just want to record this album, we NEED to record this album, but we need your help.

We want to record a five song EP of all new material and re-record two songs from the "Who Needs a Shepherd?" EP for a special promtional release. We have saved up a good chunk of money to do this, but we don't have nearly enough to cover all the expenses such as recording, production, mixing, mastering, artwork, photography, liner notes, and CD pressing. We need $6,000 and only your contributions will help us make this happen. We have created a donation list with some really cool rewards for everyone that donates. There is some unique, one of a kind memorabilia available like signed drum heads from the recording of the "Misanthropic Slaughter" full length album, signed drum head and broken cymbals from the "M.O.D." music video, T-shirts worn in the "M.O.D." music video, a huge Hemoptysis banner with the "Who Needs A Shepherd?" EP artwork that we used on stage, and much more. You could get a private show or a jam session with the band, or even a private BBQ with the band where we will cook for you! You could be listed as the executive producer on the album, or do your own personal mix of one of the new songs that no one else will have! There are too many awesome prizes for your donations for us to list here. Check them all out as they are listed below.

Your donations and support are VERY important to us. If you can't afford to donate anything, that is OK. Just spread the word about the band fundraiser in any way and that will be a great help to us.

If we don't raise the full amount for this fundraiser your donations will still be used to record the new 5-song EP of all new material but it will either take a lot longer for us to save up the money ourselves or we will have to abandon the plan to re-record the two songs from the "Who Needs A Shepherd?" EP. Either way, this EP of all new material will be recorded and released but your donations will help us do it this year with enough money to make it a quality recording that will do these amazing songs justice.

Thank you in advance to everyone that donates to this cause or promotes it to others! We appreciate your support more than words can say. You won't be disappointed! We will make this recording totally worth it! Thank you!

story:
Support Orchestra Next and ensure that live music will be part of the Eugene Ballet's Nutcracker this year!  You'll also be supporting a training orchestra model that will bring critical professional experience to up-and-coming musicians in the region.  All donations will go through the Eugene Ballet (501c3) and are tax-deductible. 

Live Music is Better!

For the past several years, the Eugene Ballet has been performing The Nutcracker with pre-recorded music.  This isn't how it should be in Eugene!  We have the talent and the expertise - but we need to help raise the money.  

Training Orchestras are Needed!

Training orchestras are designed to give aspiring professionals and students real-world experience and training in the art of orchestral performance.  These orchestras provide essential training for students who literally sit next to professionals in the field. Students need:

  • professional opportunities 
  • professional rehearsal schedules
  • repeat performances 
  • mentorship

Orchestra Next will accomplish all of this. 

If we can do this, we can keep live music happening for one of Eugene's most popular events at the Hult Center AND provide training for our up-and-coming musicians.

Here's what we need

We're looking to raise $10,000 on this campaign.  

We've already raised the money to hire our principals for the season which amounts to $16,800.  This covers 15-16 principals for 6 rehearsals and 6 concerts at $90 a service. 

We need about $14,500 to give $500 to each trainee over the course of the season.  Of that, we've raised $4,500 already, and are looking to boost that by $10,000.  On this site, if we raise more than $10,000, we'll simply return that surplus to the trainees as an added bonus.  They certainly deserve it!

Your donations are tax-deductable and, what's more, we have perks!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help with a donation at this time, please consider doing the following:

  • forward this indiegogo link on to people you think might be interested in helping
  • and go to the performances Dec 21-24! 

Based in the Pacific Northwest, Orchestra Next remixes the orchestral model by resurrecting the tradition of the mentor-apprentice relationship.  This an effort to bring live music back to the Eugene Ballet’s production of The Nutcracker. Orchestra Next will combine Eugene’s creative young professionals with the region’s most talented protégés. This model is a pioneering, innovative type of pre-professional and post-professional orchestra that will create a fresh hybrid atmosphere, mixing modern pop culture with ruthless classicism.

story:
Hello!

I am Sharon Nutzati, I'm a singer songwriter from Thornhill, Ontario and I am currently making my very first full length album! I've been playing music for a few years now and everyone has been asking me "Where can I buy your album?". With your help, I can answer those people's questions! 

Some of you may be asking "Sharon, why should I give you money if you've already spent some money on recording?" And I'm going to be completely honest with you about that. Yes, I have already put money into the album, but working as a part time pet store employee and a full time musician can only do so much. This money will help pay for the rest of the album and to get the CDs printed (because that costs money too!)

Even if you think that $1 won't matter, it does! Every penny helps! Please take the time to look at the perks as well, as no good deed will go unrewarded!

I appreciate the ongoing support from my friends and family, and I am very excited to be releasing this album!

Please check out the video for a preview of the album!

If you would like to hear my EP check this link: http://sharonnutzatimusic.bandcamp.com/

Also follow my Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SharonNutzatiMusic

My Twitter: @sharon_nutzati

and

My Instagram: @sharonnutzati

story:
A Rollerblading Street Contest

Funds raised will go to the winners. I'm trying to guarantee $1000 to First Place
A portion of the funds will go towards a group donation to St. Jude Children's Hospital. St. Jude's walk is the morning of the contest. I have a team already. Let me know if you wanna sign up to walk from 8-10 the morning of the 19th.
Money for Second and Third (amount to be determined)

The majority of the planning is done. Now I just need the money to do it. We have been hosting fundraising events already and have more planned in the future. With your help we can turn this into something great. Last year is going to be hard to beat (anyone who attended will attest to that) but I am perfecting my method so I foresee this contest really raising the bar.

SCHEDULE OF EVENTS FOR THE WEEKEND
Friday Evening- Downhill Race
Saturday- Street Contest
Sunday- Beach Party

I currently have a few potential places for the race, 5 spots picked out for the contest (bangers) and the location for the beach party. 

Spread the word. Lets get this thing going. If you are a shop or company and interested in supporting the contest please contact me by email at bran_don_t@yahoo.com

Brian Bruno is currently sitting on the throne. Who wants a shot at the Crown? Who will be the next King of Cleveland?

Hope to see everyone in the CLE
-Brandon Lorenzo Thompson

story:
Hello Friends!
It has been almost 2 years since we recorded our debut EP, "The Harbor." The response has been incredible! People all over the country, and even the world, have heard the message of God's love through our music! People dear to us have told us how our songs have helped them get through some of the difficult times in their lives. These testimonies of God working through us mean so much more than any amount of money or fame. Bringing peace to the broken and love to the lonely is why we do what we do!

Since releasing our EP we have been continuing to lead people in worship and continuing to write songs of hope for people. We are, once again, to the point where we want to share these songs to the world. This time around, we have so many songs we want to share, that we have decided to make our first full length album! We made an acoustic music video of the song "The Divine Architect" to give you a sample of what is to come. This song, and more, will be on the album!

Unfortunately, making an album is expensive. Our ideal budget is $15,000. This would cover all the expenses of recording, producing, mastering, and CD production. This number may seem daunting, but if enough people contribute, we know we can meet this goal! No donation is too small! We are also offering some awesome perks for your donations, so be sure to check those out.

The impact of our music has no monetary value. But for our music to reach people, we need your help. We believe God is calling us to make this album to continue share the good news with the world. In this small way, you can help us provide this beacon of hope for God's kingdom. We believe that through God, all things are possible!

Thanks you all so much!

story:
About Contemporary Undercurrent of Song Project

Contemporary Undercurrent of Song Project (CUSP) is Princeton’s newest concert series dedicated to the performance, preservation, and promotion of modern art song composition, bringing the songs of today’s most imaginative composers to listeners previously unaware of the music happening all around them. While there is a great deal of excellent music happening in Princeton, much of it happens within the walls of academia. CUSP reaches the audiences outside of those walls and the communities within the Central New Jersey area.

CUSP has both created and curated interesting and diverse programs and invited existing ensembles to present programs of their choosing. Past programs include:

  • the Princeton premiere of Renascence by Martin Hennessey
  • Princeton Connection: the music of local composers
  • Duo Cortona (Rachel Calloway, mezzo soprano and Ari Streisfeld, violin)
  • Justine Aronson, soprano and graduate of Westminster Choir College accompanied by Richard Valitutto, piano
  • Composer Portrait: a benefit concert for Christian Carey (a local composer and professor recently diagnosed with cancer)
  • FURY: the will to be heard | the music of women composers

Funding Goals

Our goal is to raise $1,500, and $1,000 will be generously matched by an anonymous donor. Every dollar you donate is actually $2! How will this be used?

  • 80% goes to artist fees and artist expenses
  • 10% goes towards documentation fees
  • 10% goes towards general operational support

In addition, this means that any funds raised from ticket sales can supplement the cost of a performance instead of defining the budget.

What You Get!

  • Up to $25 - Thanked in our 2017 programs
  • $25-49 - Thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
  • $50-99 - A free ticket to a 2017 concert of your choice, thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
  • $100-199 - A free ticket to two of our 2017 concerts, thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
  • $200-249 - A free ticket to each of our 2017 concerts, thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
  • $250-499 - Sponsor an upcoming artist of your choice and your name will appear in our programs and on our website as that artist's sponsor, plus all of the above perks
  • $500+ - Underwrite a concert and be recognized both at the concert and in our programs and on our website, and receive two free tickets to each 2017 concert.

About the 2017 Concerts

March 25 - Composer Portrait: Juliana Hall

Juliana Hall is known primarily as an American art song and vocal chamber music composer whose music has been heard in 26 countries on six continents. This concert will feature selections from The Poet's Calendar, a performance of Night Dances, and the world premiere of The Bells - a cycle which sets the poetry of Edgar Allen Poe.

April 8 - Featured Ensemble: sTem Trio

sTem champions the aural and theatrical possibilities of vocal chamber music through dramatic performances, innovative commissions, and community outreach. Their concert with CUSP will focus on the poetry of women, particularly Sylvia Plath, with Ned Rorem's Ariel serving as an energized nucleus. World premieres of commissioned works by Cornell student composers round out the program.

April 29 - World Premieres Concert: Two Sopranos and Oboe

Amy Petrongelli, soprano; Alexandra Porter, soprano; and Zach Pulse, oboe will present a program of world-premiere pieces for their new ensemble. Works by Andrew Davis, Nima Hamidi, Kerrith Livengood, Pamela Stein Lynde, and Brandon Scott Rumsey.

CUSP’s Impact Over Two Seasons

In its inaugural season and the beginning of its second season thus far, CUSP has:

  • employed sixteen local musicians
  • presented the music of eight living local composers
  • presented the music of twenty two living American composers
  • presented world premieres of three pieces
  • engaged over 200 audience members in the community
  • posted over two hours of recordings available to stream by the greater public

By supporting CUSP, you support a growing community of new music enthusiasts and curious listeners hearing the music created within Princeton and the performances of renowned guest artists.

Risks & Challenges

The first five years of any new arts organization present significant challenges. In its inaugural year, CUSP was supported by an existing 501(c)3 organization: Princeton Opera Alliance. This year, we stand alone with our own non-profit status and are working to secure grant funding and establish a growing and dedicated audience base. We are the only organization in Princeton dedicated to presenting contemporary art song outside of academia, featuring emerging and established artists and presenting world premieres of exciting works by living composers. By supporting our 2017 concerts, you support a growing community of performers, composers, and music lovers interested in exploring an expanding repertoire of diverse art song and vocal chamber music.

Can’t Donate? Other Ways You Can Help!

  • Share this campaign via email or Facebook
  • Join our mailing list
  • Attend the 2017 concerts
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter
story_txt:
About Contemporary Undercurrent of Song ProjectContemporary Undercurrent of Song Project (CUSP) is Princeton’s newest concert series dedicated to the performance, preservation, and promotion of modern art song composition, bringing the songs of today’s most imaginative composers to listeners previously unaware of the music happening all around them. While there is a great deal of excellent music happening in Princeton, much of it happens within the walls of academia. CUSP reaches the audiences outside of those walls and the communities within the Central New Jersey area.CUSP has both created and curated interesting and diverse programs and invited existing ensembles to present programs of their choosing. Past programs include:
the Princeton premiere of Renascence by Martin Hennessey
Princeton Connection: the music of local composers
Duo Cortona (Rachel Calloway, mezzo soprano and Ari Streisfeld, violin)
Justine Aronson, soprano and graduate of Westminster Choir College accompanied by Richard Valitutto, piano
Composer Portrait: a benefit concert for Christian Carey (a local composer and professor recently diagnosed with cancer)
FURY: the will to be heard | the music of women composers
Funding GoalsOur goal is to raise $1,500, and $1,000 will be generously matched by an anonymous donor. Every dollar you donate is actually $2! How will this be used?
80% goes to artist fees and artist expenses
10% goes towards documentation fees
10% goes towards general operational support
In addition, this means that any funds raised from ticket sales can supplement the cost of a performance instead of defining the budget.What You Get!
Up to $25 - Thanked in our 2017 programs
$25-49 - Thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
$50-99 - A free ticket to a 2017 concert of your choice, thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
$100-199 - A free ticket to two of our 2017 concerts, thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
$200-249 - A free ticket to each of our 2017 concerts, thanked in our 2017 programs and on our website
$250-499 - Sponsor an upcoming artist of your choice and your name will appear in our programs and on our website as that artist's sponsor, plus all of the above perks
$500+ - Underwrite a concert and be recognized both at the concert and in our programs and on our website, and receive two free tickets to each 2017 concert.

story:
Who We Are:  Fourth Coast Ensemble is a Chicago-based vocal quartet founded in 2013 by Karen Ann Baron, soprano; Bridget Skaggs, mezzo-soprano; Zachary Vanderburg, tenor; & Reuben L Lillie, baritone. 

Our Mission:  Chicago's Fourth Coast Ensemble is committed to performing programs of creative yet accessible vocal chamber music. Our goal at each performance is to communicate an atmosphere of warmth, variety, and genuine expression. We strive to create a dialogue that invites each audience member to feel comfortable as though they were listening to music in their own living room, surrounded by friends. 

Our Season:  This is Fourth Coast Ensemble's first full season.  Our goal and passion is to bring high-caliber and accessible art song performances to Chicago.  Whether it is singing fiery German quartets, exploring modern American songs, or showcasing rare French melodies, this season will bring incredibly beautiful, moving music to many parts of Chicago.  We cannot accomplish our dream without your support.  Any level of generosity directly helps to make our season possible. 

Our Need:  Our fundraising campaign helps make our season a possibility by paying our fantastic collaborators; paying for venues, print materials, and publicity; purchasing music; and helping to defer our costs that we, as young developing artists are not able to afford on our own.

Your Generosity's Impact:  The support you give us directly helps bring impeccable art song performances to many diverse areas of Chicago and helps solidify Chicago as a home for art song.  Your generosity helps Fourth Coast Ensemble connect with our audience and impact their lives for the better through music.  We have been given an incredible opportunity by the Collaborative Arts Institute of Chicago as their Fellow Artists for the 2014-15 season to grow as musicians and to receive the training to develop further as an ensemble.  The financial support you give helps to further the artists of Fourth Coast Ensemble as we develop and give our dreams life.

Our Gift to You:  We have many gifts to say "thank you" for your support.  They range from listings in our season's programs to a private concert in your home.  Your support means so much to us, and we want to let you know just how much. 

    Other Ways You Can Help:  Join us at our performances this season and connect with us in a new and innovative concert experience.  Invite your friends.  Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter.  Spread the news of Fourth Coast Ensemble's season and share our Indiegogo campaign with others who can lend their support.

story:
Basic Summary

We're going to travel to Jordan, Lebanon and Iraqi Kurdistan to assist 20 humanitarian aid organizations, who are providing relief to Syrian and Iraqi refugees and internally displaced persons (IDPs), draft and post their first crowdfunding campaigns.

Background

Humanitarian aid organizations helping Syrian and Iraqi refugees and IDPs are overwhelmed. The conflict in Syria alone has displaced over nine million people since 2011, creating an immense and worsening humanitarian emergency.

Local-level aid organizations in particular are struggling to raise support for their operations and need assistance to vastly expand their fundraising networks.

Crowdfunding can help! However, most aid organizations operating in and across Jordan, Lebanon and Iraqi Kurdistan have never experimented with crowdfunding. Technical obstacles also make it difficult to access and utilize crowdfunding from crisis-zones. Much needs to be done to improve humanitarian crowdfunding and make crowdfunding more useful to professional aid organizations.

Our Project

With your help, we're going to assist 20 humanitarian aid organizations draft and post their first crowdfunding campaigns. We're going to setup a pathway for crowd-raised funds to reach these organizations and use technical support provided by Twilio and Zendesk to enable these organizations to launch their next crowdfunding campaigns conveniently via SMS.

We're going to demonstrate how humanitarian crowdfunding can be improved. Firstly, by making changes to campaign information to meet professional humanitarian disclosure standards governing operational reporting and aid transparency and secondly, by making campaign information acquirable by news aggregators.

In addition, we're going to use our project to generate 20 snapshot crisis reports using campaign information and interviews, and publish these on Medium - a popular online publishing platform indexed by news aggregators.

Lastly, we're looking to produce an article on crisis reporting using crowdfunding appeals, suitable for publishing in the magazine Scientific American.

Request

In logistical and field expenses, it is going to cost $400 per aid organization to get our first set of 20 professional-quality humanitarian crowdfunding campaigns online. We're seeking contributions to offset these costs. Funds raised in excess of our goal will be donated equally to crowdfunding campaigns generated by this project, minus Indiegogo fees and payment processing costs.

Contributions made to this campaign are tax-deductible. This is a project of Beehive and Empowerment Works, both 501c3 nonprofit organizations. So join in helping us!

Team

This project will be carried out by: Brent Phillips, a former United Nations staff person specializing in humanitarian operations and financing, needs assessments and data formatting; photojournalist Jodi Hilton, currently working on a project in Iraqi Kurdistan providing emergency medical training to journalists, whose work with Syrian refugees can be seen at Jodihilton.com; and Emma Young, an expert in technology, innovation and operational coordination, who is passionate about humanitarian operations and conflict resolution. In the field, we’ll be joined by a local driver and translator and by a locally based journalist with experience in crisis reporting, Cathy Otten, Cathyotten.co.uk. 


Visit Beehive's blog for campaign updates.

Thanks for joining us!


Syrian Aid Groups Train An Army Of Activists! Jodi Hilton for NPR

story:
Who is The Minstrel's Ghost?

The Minstrel's Ghost is a melodic rock/progressive band featuring Blake Carpenter (writer, singer, keyboards and guitars), Troy James Martin (bassist and singer), Mike Troupe (drummer and singer) and Jartse Tuominen (lead guitars). If you love Pink Floyd, The Alan Parsons Project, Asia, Saga and the like then you will love us too. We do not try to sound like anyone else but the influences can be heard in our music. From the jazzy drums and rippling bass to the fluid guitar leads, sweeping keyboard riffs and story telling vocals our music takes you on a journey from beginning to end.

What is this all about?

This campaign is to raise funds for our third album and a movie to accompany it. The album is a take on the life of Jack the Ripper, a kind of back story if you will. A little creative license applied and we see how difficult growing up in the late 19th century is for a young boy. The harsh realities of prostitution, brutality and shocking loss leave young Jack struggling to cope. How will he deal with it all? We are planning on making a silent film using the music from the album as the story teller.

This has been in the head of Blake, the writer of the album, for a long time. The vision of making a movie instead of a couple of videos to accompany an album came when he was looking through old Victorian images on the web and trying to put a story line together with pictures.  There is a story to be told here, this is about Jack but it could be about anyone who suffers hardship and tragedy at a young age. We all handle our pain in different ways and that, at least to some extent, defines us, no matter where or when we live.

Why we need you.....

Making this movie is a big deal for us! We are still a young band trying to make our way into a much larger family of melodic, progressive bands. We hope that this movie will help us reach more of those whom we know would love our music. Please know that what ever we do it will always be about the stories inside the music and giving you the opportunity to laugh or cry, smile or frown and take something away from the music and story that will help you through your day, week, or life.

What We Need & What You Get

We have some things already in place and are using the barter system to get portions of the production done but we still need some equipment and perhaps some licenses to use public areas for filming. This fundraiser is also for CD and DVD manufacture as well as artwork for the whole project.


We are looking for $15,000 to secure:

  • camera and lighting rentals
  • a video editing machine
  • any licenses we may need for filming in public places
  • any potential extras needed for the film such as wood, paint and other building materials for sets
  • paid actors (if we need to as most are included in the bartering)
  • feeding actors and crew
  • all artwork for the CD and DVD (not your typical insert, a full sized newspaper)
  • CD and DVD manufacturing
  • Photo shoot for the artwork
For your contribution you can get:
  • posters
  • t-shirts
  • Signed copies of both CD and DVD from all members of the band
  • your name in lights at the beginning or the end of the movie
  • and much more

If the goal is not reached, we will do what we can with the funds raised and work out other arrangements for the perks we are not able to fulfill. We will work with you personally on all substitute perks if it comes to that – but let’s make sure it doesn’t come to that! 

    Risks & Challenges

    We have been down this road before, just like so many other bands and artists so we know all too well that things happen that can get in the way of a happy ending. We also know that we have you, our friends and fans to join us in jumping over any hurdles we may come across. That said, we will be sure to make this happens in some way, shape or form for everyone to enjoy.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

    SHARE, SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!!!!!!!!!! Tell your friends, use Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Google+, and all the other outlets you can to let everyone know about this project. Don't forget music forums you may be a member of, please, if you can, print up a few flyers and throw them up around town. Don't forget that there are tools right here on this page that you can use to share this project and help it reach as many people as it can.

    Don't forget to sign up for the The Minstrel's Chronicle our (almost) monthly newsletter at minstrelsghost.com

story:
Hello , My name is John Gillette, A.K.A  "Johnny G." I started playing guitar @ the ripe old age of 8, started my first band @ 12 , Was gigging regularly @ 14 , and as soon as I graduated high school , I was on a bus to Hollywood CA. I graduated top ten in my class from Musicians Institute in 1984, and have been active on the L.A., N.Y., Seattle , and Florida music scenes, either working for or performing in support of such acts as Ronnie Montrose , Tesla , and Mahogany Rush to name a few, and although I have been writing , recording , and touring for the past 30 years, It's always been in a band setting , and I've yet to record a solo project.  In 2012 I saw an ad in guitar world magazine for the "song of the year " song writing contest ,so  I submitted a song that I had recently recorded on my little home studio called " don't look down" . I was pleasantly surprised when I was notified that my song came in # 10 in the instrumental category out of thousands of entries . It was then that I decided to contact my long time friend D.A. Karkos , http://theunderdogstudios.com/ and see what he thought of some of the stuff that I had been working on, He responded , and said he really liked the material , and would be interested in producing Me . And so here We are, ready to Rock !
    All the ground work has been laid, the material is written, and we are confident that the campaign amount we are trying to reach is enough to cover tracking , mixing , and mastering 5 to 7 songs.
    $ 1-100 recieve an electronic copy of "Imaginary Real"
    $101-200 recieve an electronic copy , and a signed hard copy of "Imaginary Real"
    $201 and up recieve an electronic copy and a signed  hard copy of "Imaginary Real" plus a bonus CD encompasing some of the best Johnny G. recordings from over the past 20 years

story:
COLORS OF RESISTANCE: our first album!

The Eco-Music Big Band is a 15-piece, multigenerational and unique big band that that includes some of the nation's most acclaimed jazz musicians (such as bass trombonist David Taylor, drummer Zack O'Farrill, and trumpeter Adam O'Farrill).  Founded by Fred Ho before his death in 2014, the Eco-Music Big Band is led by Marie Incontrera, his final composing-and-bandleading protege.  

We are proud to announce the recording of our first studio album, COLORS OF RESISTANCE, this October, and we need you to help us in the final push to our goal.  COLORS OF RESISTANCE features new works by up-and-coming composers Livio Almeida, Felix Del Tredici, Marie Incontrera, Albert Marques, Zack O'Farrill, and Stefan Zeniuk; celebrates the five-decade career of bass trombonist and composer David Taylor; and reimagines iconic works by the late Chinese-American composer and baritone saxophone virtuoso Fred Ho and late composer and activist Cal Massey.

COLORS OF RESISTANCE will be recorded on Halloween weekend at Peter Karl Studios in Brooklyn.  We have an exciting season planned (an opera premiere at BAM Next Wave Festival; a feature on the American Composers Orchestra SONiC Festival for composers under 40; a collaboration with Hard Rubber Orchestra; and our very first Philadelphia show, among others!), and this is a necessary step in our work as an ensemble.  And we need you to make it happen!

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $5000 for our recording expenses.  Funds go to:

  • Paying 16 musicians a fair wage for their time
  • Studio time (fourteen hours over two days!) and mastering time
  • Production and distribution costs for the album (record label costs, iTunes, Amazon)

The Impact

Our first priority is to compensate the musicians and engineers for their work on this album.  We have been enjoying an exciting  and vital performance schedule in New York City and throughout the Northeast, and our music aims to reach urban youth (through a dynamic collaboration with the Harlem Village Academy) and seasoned jazz lovers alike.  This album, which  tells a joyful story of music that comes from the tradition of resistance to oppression, provides an important outlet for important social justice causes as well as our work as professional musicians.

Risks & Challenges

The Eco-Music Big Band's biggest challenge is obtaining the funds necessary to pay for artist fees, studio time, and distribution costs.  

With this crowdfunding campaign, we will secure the money needed to cover all costs for this album recording, and use our subsequent ticket proceeds and album sales to build an operating budget for future seasons and future recordings, with the additional help of foundation and government grants.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute monetarily to our campaign, you can still help: Post, tweet, or gram this campaign.

If you cannot donate money but can donate rehearsal space, recording materials, or goods such as food/beverages, we can accept these as tax deductible through our contribution page: http://thefield.org/sa/613044

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

Marie Incontrera - Eco-Music Big Band is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community. Contributions to The Field earmarked for Marie Incontrera - Eco-Music Big Band are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane, Suite 906 New York, NY 10038, phone: 212-691-6969 or fax: 212-255-2053or for our national charities registration, see details. A copy of our latest financial report may be obtained from The Field or from the Office of Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.
story_txt:
COLORS OF RESISTANCE: our first album! The Eco-Music Big Band is a 15-piece, multigenerational and unique big band that that includes some of the nation's most acclaimed jazz musicians (such as bass trombonist David Taylor, drummer Zack O'Farrill, and trumpeter Adam O'Farrill).  Founded by Fred Ho before his death in 2014, the Eco-Music Big Band is led by Marie Incontrera, his final composing-and-bandleading protege.  
We are proud to announce the recording of our first studio album, COLORS OF RESISTANCE, this October, and we need you to help us in the final push to our goal.  COLORS OF RESISTANCE features new works by up-and-coming composers Livio Almeida, Felix Del Tredici, Marie Incontrera, Albert Marques, Zack O'Farrill, and Stefan Zeniuk; celebrates the five-decade career of bass trombonist and composer David Taylor; and reimagines iconic works by the late Chinese-American composer and baritone saxophone virtuoso Fred Ho and late composer and activist Cal Massey.
COLORS OF RESISTANCE will be recorded on Halloween weekend at Peter Karl Studios in Brooklyn.  We have an exciting season planned (an opera premiere at BAM Next Wave Festival; a feature on the American Composers Orchestra SONiC Festival for composers under 40; a collaboration with Hard Rubber Orchestra; and our very first Philadelphia show, among others!), and this is a necessary step in our work as an ensemble.  And we need you to make it happen!   What We Need & What You Get We are raising $5000 for our recording expenses.  Funds go to:  Paying 16 musicians a fair wage for their time Studio time (fourteen hours over two days!) and mastering time Production and distribution costs for the album (record label costs, iTunes, Amazon)    The Impact Our first priority is to compensate the musicians and engineers for their work on this album.  We have been enjoying an exciting  and vital performance schedule in New York City and throughout the Northeast, and our music aims to reach urban youth (through a dynamic collaboration with the Harlem Village Academy) and seasoned jazz lovers alike.  This album, which  tells a joyful story of music that comes from the tradition of resistance to oppression, provides an important outlet for important social justice causes as well as our work as professional musicians.

story:
Hi,

My name is Alexandru Iulian Musat,I'm a guitar player and singer and I want to become a Berklee Student.I already had the audition and interview for Berklee and I've been accepted,I also received a $ 20.000 scholarship,but I need another $ 25.000 to be able to start the first semester.After I start the first semester I will apply for a full scholarship and I'm sure I'm going to get it,but in order to do that I have to be a student first.

Here are some videos with me.Hope you enjoy !

 

 

 

 

 

Thank you for making my dream come true !

God Bless You !

story:
Who we are

We are Destructive Penguins, a band originated from our hometown, Leiden. Since 2013 we have been grinding our butts off to create some of the dopest music you will ever hear, resulting in a very diverse tracklist whilst maintaining a consistent and coherent sound. Think Hip Hop with Funk, Reggae, Pop and Rock.

For a quick impression of our music and sound you can check our SoundCloud and listen to this rehearsal recording of one of our tracks that will be featured on the EP. Our EP will be even better.


Music is our passion and for us there’s nothing like playing our music for you guys, our fans, our friends and our family.

But now it’s time to take it to another level. We want to get into the world and let our music be heard. We are finally going to record our very first EP!

What we need and what you get

Our goal for this crowdfunding is to generate enough money to make this EP. Now this isn’t just paying the studio time, recording it and releasing it. No, we are going big.

We need to be able to press CD’s, make merch, setup an awesome photoshoot, artwork and licensing. All of the money will be spent on these things.

After all the work is done, we also want to be able to celebrate the release of our EP with you guys. We are releasing our EP on February the 12th in Gebr. De Nobel in Leiden with a very, very special show in a very special venue.

So what’s in it for you guys? By pledging certain amounts, you get different kinds of rewards. There are tickets for the release show, digital downloads, CD’s, merch and some very special rewards like a concert in your living room (we’ll keep it down, we promise).

Some perks, like a CD, can be shipped to your adress. For now we won’t charge any shipping costs as we want to give everyone the chance to pick up their rewards at a later mentioned adress or at the release party. When the time comes we will sent everyone an e-mail asking you whether or not you want your reward shipped. The shipping costs depend on your reward and your location.

By pledging, you will be updated with all the progress we are making.

Stretchgoal

We love vinyl, to our ears it’s the best music listening experience there is (apart from coming to one of our shows of course). If we reach €5000 we will add a vinyl perk! Everyone who would normally receive a CD is given the option to upgrade their CD to a vinyl!

Other ways to help

Besides donating a certain amount of money to our crowdfunding, there are of course other ways to help us out during our campaign! We need to get the word out to as many people possible and by sharing our campaign to your friends you’re doing exactly that!

It's also possible to add any amount of money to the perks if you feel you'd like to contribute extra.

Let’s create as much noise as possible!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Hello,my name is Bill martin. I am working with my friend Jonathan Gonzales to create a documentary exploring rap and hip-hop in the church. The documentary follows Jonathan as he goes to Haiti to help integrate hip-hop into a small church's ministry.
  • By contributing to this project, you will help shed a positive light on the genre of hip-hop. Rap and hip-hop has been painted in a negative light with drugs and violence. This project is here to show that this ever-growing genre doesn't just glorify a negative lifestyle. It shows that Rap and hip-hop can show a lighter , more constructive lifestyle that glorifies god and community over drugs and violence.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • The $15,000 we are asking for go towards travel costs, equipment fees, food, and lodging (for Haiti) and insurance for the equipment. The money will also employ a translator forHaitian Creole, the native language of Haiti.


  • If we do not reach our goal, we will still film the documentary the best we can.  We are seeking as many venues of fundraising we can. We need the money to go, but we will continue to raise funds until we reach our goal.

    Risks & Challenges

    • As with any projects that take us out of the country, there are some safety risks. People who are accompanying us on the trip have been to Haiti before and will help us stay safe.
    • Other Ways You Can Help
    • If you can't contribute please feel free to share this cause with friends 
    you can also like us on the Facebook link below.
    https://www.facebook.com/pages/Rhythm-of-God-A-...
