story:
Radio Indigena On the Air

Radio Indígena speaks to Ventura County’s 20,000 Mixtec and Zapotec farmworkers in our own languages.  We indigenous leaders are the journalists and DJ’s, informing our community about local events, national news, and public health information, as we also broadcast popular indigenous music that we cannot find on mainstream Spanish networks.  Radio Indígena reaches indigenous farmworkers in the fields, building pride, promoting unity, and ending isolation. 

Radio Indigena en Vivo

Radio Indígena lleva la voz  a 20.000 trabajadores del campo agrícola de origen Mixteco y zapoteco en el Condado de Ventura en nuestro propio idioma. Nosotros, líderes indígenas, hacemos el papel de periodistas para informar a nuestra comunidad sobre eventos locales, noticias nacionales e información de salud pública. También hacemos el papel de DJ para la difusión de la música popular indígena la cual no se transmite en las radio fusarás populares del contado. Radio Indígena llego para dar voz a los campesinos indígenas, promover unidad y terminar aislamiento. 

---

Who are we?

The Mixteco/Indígena Community Organizing Project (MICOP) has 15 years of experience aiding, organizing, and empowering Ventura County’s indigenous immigrant community.  We are a trusted voice of the community and a respected partner of over 15 county agencies and foundations in serving this community.  MICOP first learned of community radio from Hugo Morales of Radio Bilingue.  As soon as we discussed the possibility of having our own radio station, a community-wide dream was born.  Mixteco and Zapoteco speakers began to imagine indigenous language call-in shows, and indigenous musicians offered to donate their music and play live concerts.  Over 100 people actively joined our Radio Committee.  Leaders organized three community wide dances and raised over $15,000 from over 1,000 enthusiastic farmworker radio supporters. 

MICOP applied for a frequency from the Federal Communications Commission in 2013 and received 94.1 FM in April 2014.  Our awesome engineer and lawyer are making our dream a reality, with support from partners Prometheus Radio, KDAR, KCLU, KQED, and KCSB. 

Quiénes Somos

El Proyecto Mixteco (MICOP) tiene 15 años de experiencia ayudando, organizando, empoderando a la comunidad emigrante indígena del condado de Ventura. Somos la voz de confianza de la comunidad y un respetado socio de más de 15 fundaciones y agencias del condado al servicio de comunidad. MICOP se enteró de la radio comunitaria a través  Hugo Morales de Radio Bilingüe. Tan pronto que se habló de la posibilidad de tener nuestra propia estación de radio, nació un sueño de toda la comunidad. Indígenas Mixtecos y Zapotecos comenzaron a imaginarse programaciones en la lengua indígena y músicos indígenas ofrecieron donar su música y conciertos en vivo. Más de 100 persona de la comunidad se unión a este gran proyecto formando nuestra comisión de Radio. Los líderes han organizado tres conciertos/danzas en la comunidad lo cual recaudó más de $15,000 dólares. Esto se pudo lograr gracias al apoyo de entusiastas campesinos.

MICOP aplicado para una frecuencia de radio en la Comisión Federal de Comunicaciones en 2013 y recibido 94.1 FM en abril de 2014. Nuestro increíble ingeniero y abogado están haciendo nuestro sueño realidad con el apoyo de socios de Radio de Prometheus, KDAR KCLU, KQED y KCSB. 

---

Internet Launch in June, and On Air Launch coming soon!

Radio Indigena will launch over the internet on June 6.  Our 25 trained DJ's each have their programs scheduled, and our On-Air and Production studios are ready.  We are working on the details of our antenna lease, looking forward to our on-air launch in late 2015.  

It takes a village!

Radio Indígena unites supporters from area businesses, foundations,  and individuals.  YOUR SUPPORT IS CRITICAL to getting Radio Indigena on air!   

To launch our radio, we estimate a Year One budget of $80,000 including the cost of our antenna,transmitter/receiver setup, and remaining studio production equipment.  Our crowd-sourcing goal is to fundraise at least $20,000 on Indiegogo to purchase our equipment.  It would be our dream to reach $80,000 and above to ensure the full first year expenses are covered. In return for early support we will look forward to celebrating your name on air and on our studio wall.

Together we will broadcast Radio Indígena into the future!

Radio Internet se lanzará en Junio y "On Air" muy pronto!

Radio indígena pondrá en marcha Radio internet el 6 de junio del 2015. Nuestros 25 capacitados DJ cada uno tiene sus programas ya programado, nuestro estudio y la producción están listos. Estamos trabajando en los detalles de nuestro contrato de arrendamiento de la antena, y esperando nuestro lanzamiento “On-Air” en los último meses del 2015.

Radio Indígena une a individuos, fundaciones y empresas de la zona que apoyan a la radio. Su apoyo es fundamental para conseguir Radio Indigena “On-Air”!

Para el lanzamiento de nuestra radio, estimamos un presupuesto anual de $80.000; incluyendo el costo de nuestra antena, instalación de transmisor/receptor y equipo de producción de estudio que falta. Nuestro objetivo es recaudar al menos $20.000 en Indiegogo para comprar nuestro equipo. Sería un sueño poder recaudar la cantidad $80,000 dólares o más, para asegurar que los gastos del primer año estén cubiertos. Como gratificación de su temprano apoyo, le esperamos a celebrar con su nombre en la pared de nuestra cabina y estudio. Juntos transmitiremos Radio Indígena en el futuro!

---
The Impact
The majority of indigenous Mixtecs work in the agricultural fields of California picking fruits and vegetables consumed domestically and globally, but remain underserved in terms of information, resources, and artistic opportunities.  The radio station would be a big step towards  promoting indigenous pride, preserving our indigenous language, and building indigenous leaders.  Radio Indigena helps to build a united, proud and informed indigenous community.

Radio Indígena will reach farmworkers throughout their workday.  The average farmworker listens to the radio steadily for 8-10 hours in the fields. Oxnard’s Spanish language stations do not currently play Mixtec music or broadcast in indigenous languages. As we produce our own programming, we will share Radio Indígena with farmworker stations  throughout California

MICOP is the trusted hub of the indigenous immigrant community in Ventura County.  We serve over 5,000 people each year through community organizing, language access promotion, family strengthening, cultural promotion, and basic needs services.  We have a long history of launching leaders on successful new career paths, and have trained over 100 indigenous language speakers to be medical interpreters and health educators.  The radio station represents the culmination of our efforts over the last 13 years to literally raise the voices of the Mixtec community.

El Impacto!

La mayoría de los indígenas mixtecos trabaja en los campos agrícolas de California piscando frutas y verduras consumidas a nivel nacional y mundial, pero siguen siendo marginados en términos de información, recursos y oportunidades artísticas. La estación de radio sería un gran paso hacia la promoción del orgullo indígena, preservar nuestra lengua indígena y la creación de líderes indígenas. Radio indígena ayuda a construir una comunidad indígena, unidad, orgullosa e informada.

Radio Indígena tendrá alcance a los campesinos a lo largo de su jornada laboral. El campesino escucha la radio de 8-10 horas en promedio. Las estaciones radio fusaras en Español de Oxnard actualmente no tocan música Mixteca ni tampoco dan  difusión a los idiomas indígena. Como producimos nuestra propia programación, compartimos Radio Indígena con radio fusarás de trabajadores agrícolas de California

MICOP es de plena confianza de la comunidad de inmigrantes indígenas en el Condado de Ventura. Servimos a más de 5,000 personas cada año a través de la organización comunitaria, promoción de acceso a la lengua, fortalecimiento familiar, promoción cultural y servicios de necesidades básicas.

Tenemos una larga historia de lanzamiento de líderes en nuevas y sobresaliente profesiones y hemos capacitado a más de 100 indígenas para ser intérpretes en el área medicina y educadores de salud. La estación de radio representa la culminación de nuestros esfuerzos en los últimos 13 años para elevar las voces de la comunidad Mixteca.

---

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can help us spread the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about this important community project. It starts with the Mixtecos who most need to be heard, but our station will serve the wider community. 

Otras maneras que usted puede ayudar!

Incluso si usted no puede contribuir, puede ayudarnos a difundir y compartir nuestra voz! Utilizar las herramientas de participación Indiegogo para compartir e informar a tus amigos sobre la importación de este proyecto para la comunidad. Se iniciara con los Mixtecos que son los más necesitados en ser escuchados, pero nuestra estación servirá a la comunidad en general.

en el futuro!

---

The ImpactThe majority of indigenous Mixtecs work in the agricultural fields of California picking fruits and vegetables consumed domestically and globally, but remain underserved in terms of information, resources, and artistic opportunities.  The radio station would be a big step towards  promoting indigenous pride, preserving our indigenous language, and building indigenous leaders.  Radio Indigena helps to build a united, proud and informed indigenous community.


Radio Indígena
will reach farmworkers throughout their workday.  The average farmworker listens to
the radio steadily for 8-10 hours in the fields. Oxnard’s Spanish language
stations do not currently play Mixtec
music or broadcast in indigenous languages. As we produce our own programming,
we will share Radio Indígena with farmworker stations  throughout CaliforniaMICOP is the trusted hub of the indigenous immigrant community in Ventura County.  We serve over 5,000 people each year through community organizing, language access promotion, family strengthening, cultural promotion, and basic needs services.  We have a long history of launching leaders
on successful new career paths, and have trained over 100 indigenous
language speakers to be medical interpreters and health educators.  
The radio station represents the culmination of our efforts over the last 13 years to literally raise the voices of the Mixtec community.El Impacto!
La mayoría de los indígenas mixtecos trabaja en los
campos agrícolas de California piscando frutas y verduras consumidas a nivel
nacional y mundial, pero siguen siendo marginados en términos de información,
recursos y oportunidades artísticas. La estación de radio sería un gran paso
hacia la promoción del orgullo indígena, preservar nuestra lengua indígena y la
creación de líderes indígenas. Radio indígena ayuda a construir una comunidad
indígena, unidad, orgullosa e informada.
Radio Indígena tendrá alcance a los
campesinos a lo largo de su jornada laboral. El campesino escucha la radio de
8-10 horas en promedio. Las estaciones radio fusaras en Español de Oxnard actualmente
no tocan música Mixteca ni tampoco dan  difusión a los idiomas indígena. Como
producimos nuestra propia programación, compartimos Radio Indígena con radio
fusarás de trabajadores agrícolas de California
MICOP es de plena confianza
de la comunidad de inmigrantes indígenas en el Condado de Ventura. Servimos a
más de 5,000 personas cada año a través de la organización comunitaria,
promoción de acceso a la lengua, fortalecimiento familiar, promoción cultural y
servicios de necesidades básicas. 
Tenemos una larga
historia de lanzamiento de líderes en nuevas y sobresaliente profesiones y
hemos capacitado a más de 100 indígenas para ser intérpretes en el área
medicina y educadores de salud. La
estación de radio representa la culminación de nuestros esfuerzos en los
últimos 13 años para elevar las voces de la comunidad Mixteca.

---
  Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute, you can help us spread the word! Use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends about this important community project. It starts with the Mixtecos who most need to be heard, but our station will serve the wider community. 
Otras maneras que usted puede ayudar!


Incluso si usted no puede contribuir,
puede ayudarnos a difundir y compartir nuestra voz! Utilizar las herramientas
de participación Indiegogo para compartir e informar a tus amigos sobre la
importación de este proyecto para la comunidad. Se iniciara con los Mixtecos
que son los más necesitados en ser escuchados, pero nuestra estación servirá a
la comunidad en general.

story:
---> [ ENGLISH BELOW ] <---

[FR]

 

Bonjour à tous !


Après la sortie de nos deux premiers albums "Syndrome" (2011)  et "Eutheria" (2012), nous sommes en train d'enregistrer notre 3ème album pour lequel nous avons créé un univers émotionnel, violent et atmosphérique .

Avant de continuer, pour ceux qui sont tombés sur note campagne Indiegogo et qui ne nous connaissent pas, nous sommes Gravity, groupe de métal Montpelliérain formé depuis 2009. Le groupe est composé d'Alex (guitare), Emilie (chant), Tim (basse) et Richy (batterie) et depuis notre formation nous avons fait de nombreux concerts, notamment au côté de groupe comme Betraying The Martyrs, Uneven Structure, More Than A Thousand, Upon This Drawning, Zuul Fx, As They Burn, Kalisia ...

Jusqu'à présent, nous avions pour habitude de financièrement mener notre barque par nous même, mais récemment nous arrivons à une étape de notre avancée musicale où nous manquons de fonds et c'est ici que vous pouvez nous aider !   Chacune de vos contributions nous sera grandement utile! 

Vous pouvez devenir acteur de ce projet et nous soutenir dans cette aventure !


Actuellement, nous avons terminé la composition de notre troisième album ( dans lequel nous avons mis tout notre amour évidemment ^^ ) et commencé son enregistrement. 

 L'utilisation  des fonds nous permettrait donc :

- A partir de 1500 euro : Mixer et masteriser le troisième album
- A partir de 2000 euro :Réaliser le design de l'album
- A partir de 3000 euro :Pressage de l'album
- A partir de 5000 euro :Réaliser un clip vidéo !
- A partir de 7000 euro :Créer de nouveau design pour les t-shirts et faire leurs impressions

Néanmoins, si la somme n'est pas atteinte, sachez que nous ferons quand même tout notre possible pour réaliser notre troisième album ! 


--> Un petit aperçu du contenu du projet : 


Pour ce 3ème album, nous avons choisi de travailler avec :

- Aurélien Peirera de Uneven Structure/Flatcurve pour le mixage et le mastering. 
   Liens : https://www.facebook.com/flatcurve
                 http://fltcrv.com/


- Igor Omodei de Uneven Structure/Igor Omodei A/V pour le design de l'album et le clip !
Liens: https://www.facebook.com/igoromodei
             www.igoromodei.com 

Nous vous invitons à aller checker leurs travaux ! \o/

Comment faire  ?

1. Choisissez le montant du don

2.Partagez ce projet autour de vous , parlez en, pour que nous puissions réaliser ce projet ensemble  ! Même si vous ne pouvez participer financièrement, le partage sera déjà un véritable soutien !

Les frais de port seront inclus dans la contre partie !

--> Pour nous contacter :

gravityband@live.fr
brownstache@gmail.com

--> Pour nous trouver :

https://www.facebook.com/Gravitymetal
https://www.youtube.com/GravityMetalOfficial
https://gravitymetal.wordpress.com/ 
https://soundcloud.com/gravitymetal 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[EN]


Hi Everyone ! 


After the relese of our albums « Syndrome » (2011) and « Eutheria » (2012), we’re recording our third album which is atmospheric, violent and emotional.

But first, for those who don’t know who we are, let us introduce ourselves. We’re Gravity, a French Metal Band from Montpellier. The band is composed by Alex (Guitar), Emilie (Vocals), Tim (Bass) and Richy (Drums), since 2009 we’ve made a lot of gigs and tour, some of them with famous bands : Betraying the Martyrs, Uneven Structures, More Than A Thousand, Upon This Drawning, Zuul Fx, As They Burn, Kalisia and more…


Until now, we were able to fund our band by ourselves, but now we’ve reached our financial limits, we need your help ! Each of your donations will be very helpful !

You can become an actor of this project and follow us in this journey !

Currently, we’ve finished the composition of our third album (there is a lot of love in it <3) and we’ve started the recording. But it will be difficult for us to go further.

This crowdfunding will allow :


- From 1500 euro : Mix & mastering
- From 2000 euro : Album design
- From 3000 euro : CD Pressing
- From 5000 euro : Music Video
- From 7000 euro : New T-shirts designs and new merchandising

If the goal is not reached, we will do our best to make the album by any means necessary !


How to help us ?


1. Choose a donation

2. Share this project massively and spread the word ! We need that to make it ! Even if you can’t make a donation, it will be very helpful !

The counterparts traductions are just below :

1 euro :  Thanking on our Facebook Page ! Each euro is important <3 !

2 euros : Thanking on our Facebook Page ! Each euro is important <3 !

5 euros : Digital album «Syndrome» + Thanking on our Facebook Page + a roulade made by Alex and Richy.

10 euros : Digital album « Eutheria» + Thanking on our Facebook Page !

15 euros : Digital album « Eutheria » and « Syndrome » + Thanking on our Facebook Page !

20 euros : New album in digital + Thanking on our Facebook Page !

25 euros : New album in digital + Digital album « Eutheria » and « Syndrome » + Thanking on our Facebook Page !

30 euros (+10 euros Shipping fee) : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + New album in digital + a broken drumstick from Richy and a pick from Alex + Thanking on our Facebook Page !

40 euros (+10 euros Shipping fee) : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + New album in digital + T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking on our Facebook Page !

50 euros (+10 euros Shipping fee) : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + Mystery gift + Thanking on our Facebook Page !

60 euros (+10 euros Shipping fee) : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + New album in digital + T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking on our Facebook Page + fouet catalan (french sausage).

80 euros (+10 euros Shipping fee) : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking on our Facebook Page + Cookies handmade by Gravity

100 euros (+10 euros Shipping fee) : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking in the booklet and on our Facebook Page + One track of the new album in advance + a sample of our hair and skin appendage <3

150 euros  : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking in the booklet and on our Facebook Page + One track of the new album in advance + 4 slot on guest list on our show + Cover personnalized + mail shipped ice cubes + A pizza 4 Cheeses.

200 euros : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + 2 T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking in the booklet and on our Facebook Page + One track of the new album in advance + 4 slot on guest list on our show + Your voice on our Gang Vocals for the new album + a picture of us when we were childs and a can of tuna « à la catalane »

500 euros : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + 2 T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking in the booklet and on our Facebook Page + One track of the new album in advance + Your voice on our Gang Vocals for the new album + Guest at our shows for life + Dumb challenge video (we have our limits too).

1000 euros : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + 2 T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking in the booklet and on our Facebook Page + One track of the new album in advance + Your voice on our Gang Vocals for the new album + Guest at our shows for life for 2 + Guest in our music video

2000 euros : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + 2 T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking in the booklet and on our Facebook Page + One track of the new album in advance + Your voice on our Gang Vocals for the new album + Guest at our shows for life for 4 + Guest in our music video + Showcase in your home + we take you in a restaurant.

7000 euros : CD "Eutheria" + CD "Syndrome" + CD of the new album + 2 T-shirt (Among the available models) + Thanking in the booklet and on our Facebook Page + One track of the new album in advance + Your voice on our Gang Vocals for the new album + Guest at our shows for life for 4 + Guest in our music video + Showcase in your home + You become our God + back drop and Kick head with your face on it + a underwear from each one of us + infinite love

--> Contact :

gravityband@live.fr
brownstache@gmail.com

--> Find-us and follow-us :

https://www.facebook.com/Gravitymetal
https://www.youtube.com/GravityMetalOfficial
https://gravitymetal.wordpress.com/ 
https://soundcloud.com/gravitymetal

story:
Hey Everyone! Just wanted to give you an update to officially announce the album WILL BE funded through behind-the-scenes donations, investors and most importantly YOUR extremely generous spirits that came through on this page. Thank you to all who were apart of this project. I can honestly say you have made my dreams come true. Stay tuned funders, new comers, and friends - I will be in touch about when the album is coming out within the end of this year <3 

All the best,

Bb

  • Hello Everybody! Bre here, writing to you from good ol’ Brooklyn, NY. As some of you may already know and for those of you who don't, I have a big opportunity on my hands. My iPhone recordings have made it into the hands of a dream producer of mine down in Nashville, TN. His name is Andrija Tokic; he’s the guy responsible for some really wonderful albums from bands such as Alabama Shakes, Clear Plastic Masks, The Ettes & Hurray for the Riff Raff. We’ve been corresponding for a few months now, mapping out the schedule, nailing down the new sound as well as bringing on board some incredibly talented musicians all in pursuit to make the most rockin’ blues album your ears will ever hear.

But! There is a catch (there’s always a catch isn’t there?) And here’s where you come in. Everything from getting down to Nashville to paying the musicians to even pressing the physical C.D’s costs mula. And that’s why I’ve decided to begin this campaign. I need your help. If you have made it this far, I thank you. I thank you SO much for caring enough even to click on this link. And although $15,000 sounds like a great deal of money for one little ol' blues album, it is on the minor scale in the recording world. Please know that ANYTHING you can give is appreciated. And in exchange for your dollar bills, not only will you be receiving an incredible record, BUT you will also gain cool perks such as personally recording songs to late night dinners in the park to even free shows! (Check out the perks for more details) And if you can’t give, I completely understand. Please don’t fret! There have been many times where I have been a nickel shy of even an ice cream cone and unable to donate to your beautiful art. Luckily your love and support is more than enough. Just sharing this link or spreading the word is just as helpful :) 

Here's where your hard earned mula would be going to: 

-Gas in order for me to get to/from Nashville, TN 

-Using The Bomb Shelter studio in Nashville, TN

  •  (Check out the studio! ) http://bombshelterstudio.com/

-Feeding the producer of the record, Andrija Tokic

  • (Here's an awesome article about the man himself!) http://www.npr.org/blogs/therecord/2014/07/29/336133410/east-nashville-rocks

-Feeding the musicians on board

  • Jem Cohen of The Ettes (Keys/BV/Perscussion) https://www.facebook.com/TheEttes
  • Matt Menold (Lead Guitar/Organ), Charles Garmendia (Drums), Eduardo DuQuesne (Bass) of Clear Plastic Masks https://www.facebook.com/Clearplasticmasks
  • Jon Etes (Upright Bass/Pedal Steel/Keys) http://jonestes.com/
  • David Grant (amazing drummer/percussionist) 

-Mixing and mastering the album once it's finished

-Pressing the physical CD

-Printing the cover of the CD’s

So that alone covers most of the expenses. But being the risk taker I am, I set the goal a little higher than absolutely necessary in order to ambitiously: 

-Press Vinyl for you record players our there! 

-Make merch! (T-Shirts & Posters) 

-Hire a publicist to help spread the album into unknown hands 

That's all she wrote...

And that, my friends, will send these new songs of mine, birthed in times of laughter, triumph, confusion, and tears into a shiny new record for your listening and dancing pleasure. Again, thank you for your support. As an independent artist, you are the sole reason for my continuance on this musical journey of mine.  I walk around these streets and I sing these songs and pursue these dreams with all with your beautiful faces and moments of memories in my mind and in my heart. Thank you for supporting, believing, giving space, being there, not being there, making me laugh, making me cry, making your music, inspiring me, and listening to me. 

With love,

Breanna Barbara

 (Check out the studio! ) http://bombshelterstudio.com/

(Here's an awesome article about the man himself!) http://www.npr.org/blogs/therecord/2014/07/29/336133410/east-nashville-rocks
-Feeding the musicians on board

Jem Cohen of The Ettes (Keys/BV/Perscussion) https://www.facebook.com/TheEttes


Matt Menold (Lead Guitar/Organ), Charles Garmendia (Drums), Eduardo DuQuesne (Bass) of Clear Plastic Masks https://www.facebook.com/Clearplasticmasks


Jon Etes (Upright Bass/Pedal Steel/Keys) http://jonestes.com/

David Grant (amazing drummer/percussionist) 
-Mixing and mastering the album once it's
finished-Pressing the physical CD
-Printing the cover of the CD’sSo that alone covers most of the expenses. But being the risk taker I am, I set the goal a little higher than absolutely necessary in order to ambitiously: -Press Vinyl for you record players our there! 
-Make merch! (T-Shirts & Posters) 
-Hire a publicist to help spread the album into unknown hands That's all she wrote...
And that, my friends, will send these new songs of mine, birthed in times of laughter, triumph, confusion, and tears into a shiny new record for your listening and dancing pleasure. Again, thank you for your support. As an independent artist, you are the sole reason for my continuance on this musical journey of mine.  I walk around these streets and I sing these songs and pursue these dreams with all with your beautiful faces and moments of memories in my mind and in my heart. Thank you for supporting, believing, giving space, being there, not being there, making me laugh, making me cry, making your music, inspiring me, and listening to me. With love,Breanna Barbara

story:
The Campaign Continues!

Due to a lack of foresight on my part, the initial campaign had great success, but was cut short by my overly optimistic deadline! (Oops…)

Here's the scoop:

  • We're still hoping/planning to record a new album. (It even has a name now, TBA soon)
  • The plan is still to fund the recording costs up front by asking friends, family, and fans to "pre-order" a digital album or CD (or more, if you so choose)
  • See the "Perks" to the right.

The old campaign page will remain active. You can get to it here:
http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/new-album-by-basic/x/8816119
  • If you contributed previously to this campaign, you should have just been refunded (today, 12/19) the amount you contributed.
  • If you'd like to still contribute, please do so here.
  • It would be really nice if you'd help us let people know about this campaign. Please use the sharing tools here, or just start a conversation with another music lover!

Thanks so much for all the feedback we've gotten so far through the initial campaign, and since.
Looking forward to making this new recording for you, and with you!
Peace to you,
Greg & Jen Campbell

story:
Who are we? 

The Christmas EP is the product of three guys getting together and making music that we wanted to hear. Nathaniel Aifili is driving the album with his distinct and powerful voice. The music is grounded  with the measured rhythm section of Heath Beam and  Matthew Weatherly. It's pretty good stuff. You should buy an album.


What is The Christmas EP? 

 All of the music is written and arranged by us. We wanted to hear the Christmas music we love done in a new and sincere way and we truly believe that you will come to love these songs as we have over the last months. Seriously, you should get an album. 


How can you help?

One of the biggest purposes of this project was to spend our time creating quality music, not chasing down funding.  Instead of getting non-invested investors we believe that if YOU want to see this project happen, YOU will make it happen. Any donation will only go towards getting our music to you. Whatever you choose to give will go along way. This will be the first of many projects offered to friends and new friends. Long story short, buy an album.

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys!  Thanks for taking the time to watch my IndieGogo campaign video.  Most of you know me as recording artist, Detonator.  I've been building my "Mr. 9 To 5" movement, which represents the new generation of independent thinkers & dreamers looking to escape the shackles of their 9-to-5 day job.  It's time we take this show on the road!!
I want you to be a part of getting Detonator to perform at the "Masters of the Road" Showcase during the SXSW (South by SouthWest) Music Festival!  This takes place March 21st, 2015, in Austin, TX.  I've had so many people who rock out with me and support the movement ask me how they can help out.  I need you now more than ever!!
There's a $500 sponsorship fee that's required for performers to participate in this showcase.  Now that's a lot of money to come up with, but with your help, it would only take 50 people contributing just $10 each (that's just 1 Alex Hamilton or 2 Abe Lincolns or 10 George Washingtons).  It's up to you how much you want to throw in the plate.  Check out all the dope perks and incentives for the amount you choose to contribute.
Raising this $500 sponsorship fee doesn't only guarantee my spot at performing.  It allows me to spread the "Mr. 9 To 5" movement to a way larger audience of independent artists and music fans.  It's an amazing opportunity for networking and exposure.  The showcase is actually free to the general public and a portion of the sponsorship funds go directly to the #MoreArtLessGuns charity.
Be a part of getting Detonator to the SXSW Music Festival!!

What We Need & What You Get

Campaign Goal: $500 to cover sponsorship fee

Every penny counts.  But the more you can contribute, the more great stuff you'll get in return.  Check out the perks:

  • $10:   Let's Get It Started - Thanks!
  • $22:   Physical CD Copy of "Mr. 9 To 5"
  • $35:   Early Release of "Mr. 9 To 5"
  • $60:   Limited Edition T-Shirt
  • $80:   SXSW Greeting Video
  • $100: Studio Session
  • $125: Guest Appearance
  • $150: Director's Cut
  • $250: The CEO - Brand Sponsorship

The Impact

Performing at the "Masters of the Road" showcase during the SXSW Music Festival allows our movement to reach a much larger and broader audience.  (We can't be the only ones sick of the 9-to-5 right?)  

Revolutions start small, with ideas and motivated people.  This is our chance to be a part of something major.  Be inspired.  I go so hard for my music because I want people to realize you can achieve anything if you just dedicate the time and not allow your day job to hold you hostage.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everybody can contribute..and that's OK.  Here are some other ways to help out:

  • Invest in funding your own greatness! No really, dedicate $10 TODAY towards your own personal goal..and get your idea moving!  I'd love to support.
  • Spread the word!  SHARE this campaign post on your social media accounts.  The more that people see it, the more likely they are to take interest.
  • Support the "Mr. 9 To 5" mixtape when it's released.  That's a year and a half of blood, sweat, and tears rolled up into an hour of musical euphoria and bliss (unicorns sold separately).  Download it, click play, and tell a friend how much you loved it!!

story:
The Shenandoah Valley Children’s Choir serves children and youth ages 5-18 from diverse socioeconomic and cultural backgrounds.  We change lives through musical excellence, high standards, character and leadership development, compassion, and beauty. 

YOU can help us with this important mission!  Our uniforms are a tangible and important symbol of our unity and our excellence.  Our current uniforms are nearly 20 years old, and frankly, falling apart!  New uniforms will enable ALL of our choristers to continue to look proud, polished, and professional. 

We are also increasingly attracting young people whose financial circumstances would not allow them to participate in this amazing choir without significant support.  Contributions to our scholarship fund will help us fulfill our promise to provide this life-changing opportunity for any talented young singer who seeks it, regardless of ability to pay.

story:
Suite au concert exceptionnel du 25 juillet sur le site de la sainte Baume «  Saint- François, Saint Dominique et la communion des Saints » oratorio de Michel Garnier qui célèbre les 800 ans de l’ordre Dominicain, avec la présence exceptionnelle de l’acteur Michaël Lonsdale en tant que narrateur et aussi de nombreux artistes, chanteurs, musiciens , la soliste chanteuse Pakoune,  Marylène Ingremeau et Michel Garnier ainsi que le nouveau chœur de Magdala dirigé par l’excellent chef de chœur Stephan Nicolay.

Le caméraman réalisateur Fred Ripert, a filmé pendant 3 jours de nombreuses ambiances, autant dans les répétitions que dans le captage de ce concert inoubliable, un véritable reportage du tout début de l’arrivée de la scène jusqu’à l’aboutissement du concert en passant par la rencontre avec de nombreux invités, également des moments de prières et de recueillement mais aussi des témoignages pris sur le vif, entre autre les interviews de Michaël Lonsdale, Michel Garnier, Pakoune , artistes et musiciens , ainsi que plusieurs ecclésiastiques et quelques témoignages de l’équipe d’organisation…

Bref tout y est, Fred Ripert a filmé en plus de tous ces moments intenses en émotions, la forêt, la nature de la Sainte Baume avec des images magnifiques.

Nous en sommes maintenant au tri de ces heures de captations en vue d’un montage.

Un superbe DVD réalisé par Fred Ripert peut voir le jour rapidement, témoignant de ce rendez-vous exceptionnel devant plus d'un millier de personnes présentes, dans l'aura de Marie Magdeleine et de la Sainte Baume... c’est pourquoi nous sollicitons à chacun une aide financière, selon vos possibilités, même la plus petite soit elle car nous avons besoin de vous pour réaliser ce merveilleux projet. 

Nous avons choisi « Indiegogo » comme plateforme de financement participatif.

Nous vous en remercions de tout notre cœur et nous vous confions cette réalisation dans la bienveillance de chacun.

story:
Short Summary

Founded in 2009, Kids In A New Groove provides kids in the foster system with long-term music mentors.  The students work with their mentor to learn how to play music while building strong social emotional learning skills. Our program's goals teach students:

  • How to set, achieve and celebrate goals.
  • How to build trust and a relationship with an adult role model
  • How to be self-disciplined
  • How to have a strong presence by increasing their self esteem

What We Need & What You Get

Our students earn rewards over the course of the program.  Students have the opportunity to earn their very own musical instrument after showing their commitment to their new skill.  We have many students who are about to earn an instrument and we need to purchase these.  We are seeking $4300 to purchase the instruments that will be awarded by end of the year.  

We are so proud of the students who have not only set their goals to achieve this success but also worked hard to achieve this goal of earning their very own instrument.  Please help us reward them for their hard work!

If we surpass our goal, we will be purchasing more instruments for our next set of students who will be earning their reward in early January.

The Impact

You may wonder why this reward is so important to the students?  Our students move an average of 9 times while in foster care and most of their belongings do not move with them. This reward is theirs and can follow them.

We have 17 students who will be eligible for a reward by the end of the year.  We will be purchasing:

  • Keyboards
  • Acoustic guitars
  • Percussion sets
  • Saxophone
  • Trumpet

Other Ways You Can Help

Interested in supporting Kids In A New Groove?

  • Follow us on Facebook (kidsinawnewgroove)  and on twitter (@kidsgroove)
  • Go to our website and make a general donation (www.kidsinanewgroove.org)
  • Host an event on our behalf.

story:
The Nepal Trip


A Vancouver based non-profit group titled â€œCore Explorers,â€ was given an opportunity to spend time with ancient rural communities in the far out regions of Nepalâ€™s Himalayan Mountains in April 2012.  A mixed team of artists has been assembled to trek into these communities in order to experience their ways of life, and to interpret these customs and values in their own artistic mediums.  I feel exceptionally fortunate to have been invited and selected to this expedition as the musician among the group, and am thrilled to be apart of this project. 

 

The goal in mind with this adventure is multi-pronged.  We are going to observe human beings utilizing tried and true customs of living sustainably, stripping ourselves of material crutches and modern dependencies in order to remember who we really are, and what we really need to be happy, and finally, to come back with a story to share with schools and universities. 

 

The Impact

This opportunity is so unique because the areas we are trekking to have been visited by few, if any, westerners.  Furthermore, these communities have not yet been hit by the flood of tourism, but are going to be in the coming years.  Our project, in essence, is designed to artistically capture this moment in time, to preserve a glimpse of the identity and ways of these people before it is gone, and aim to do this via the production of a documentary movie.  It is our hope that this film and our experience may impact minds young and old, and bring about awareness of a way of life we have long forgotten.  Stories are what keep cultures alive, and what ultimately connects us to discovering who we really are.

 

The Funds


$5000 is what I am in need of to go on this month long journey through the remote mountains of Nepal, and this covers everything.  We will be trekking through the Himalayas and sleeping on the ground in tents, so the amount I am looking to raise goes directly towards travel between points, and to the team/staff (porters and cooks) that are coming with us. Upon returning from this trip, I am looking to embark on my first Canadian tour to share my songs, stories, and journey, so any extra support is most welcome in order to aid my travels around the country.


The Upcoming Show and Album Release (How I am raising funds for this expedition)

The Show - Michael Averill's 1st Official Album Release

Thereâ€™s going to be video, music, alternating accompaniment and speeches by locally and globally recognized artists and presenters, art on demonstration, door prizes, and many more surprises!

List of Speakers and Artists will be disclosed soonâ€¦


Date: Friday March 2nd, 2012

7:30pm

The Denman Theatre 

1779 Comox Street, Vancouver BC, Canada

420 seats available


The Album - What's Life All About Concept


A puzzle, based on a question we all end up asking ourselves at some pointâ€¦.

Whatâ€™s life all about?

 

How it works:

11 blank spaces __ __ __ __ __ __ __ __ __ __ __

11 songs

1 video for every song released once a month for 11 months

1 letter will be cryptically hidden in each video

1 task will be provided to try each month in line with the theme of the video

An online community will be available to share stories of your journey


*If you solve the album, and are at the show, I am offering to meet with you personally to debrief the whole project upon it's completion, and how it may help you moving forward in your life.  If you are not at the show, but still complete the puzzle, I would love to hear about it on the online community page that will be up soon.


Video Submissions

 

For the video component of the show, I would love:


-Video clips of your thoughts on what life is all about in 1- 4 words.

-Ideally filmed on digital camera or iphone with preferred technique in above video.

-Small clips sent to simplyorganicstudios@hotmail.ca

story:
Hi there!

I'm Australian Composer Georgia Scott, and I need your help to make my ballet 'The Undercurrent' become a reality.



A little bit about myself:
  • I'm a composer, which means that I write new music in many different genres
  • I studied at the Royal College of Music, graduating earlier this year
  • I started composing at eleven years old, and it's my lifelong dream to continue writing as a professional career
Composition is expensive. Whilst physically, we need just pens and paper, or perhaps a computer with notation software, the true cost is much dearer.

Recording costs, promotional spending, venue and rehearsal costs and travelling to and from performances of your work all rack up large expenditure, which on an income reliant on long-term composing commissions makes big projects very difficult to afford, particularly for a recent graduate living abroad.

So this is where you come in: I need your help.


'The Undercurrent': a New Ballet

I've written a major orchestral work in collaboration with Choreographer Alice Weber, Set Designer Stephanie Ferris and Costume Designer Lotte Welsh. We are going to be looking for performances all over the world, but cannot submit the pitch of this project to orchestras and ballet companies without having a professional recording of the score to demonstrate the feasibility and artistic integrity of the music.

As such, we've managed to secure a recording session with the world-renowned Janáček Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Mikel Toms on October 12th-13th 2015. 

However, this is not cheap. Whilst I've managed to fund over €10,000 of this project myself, I simply cannot afford the final amount needed to make this happen.


  • We need to raise a total of £3,500 to pay for the rest of the recording session 
  • On top of this, I would like a budget of £1,000 to pay for professional marketing and PR assistance throughout the rest of the production
  • The remaining £500 should cover Indiegogo's commission, with a small amount of contingency funding.

The Impact

The essence of being a composer is hearing your music performed and enjoyed by others, and to hear my music being played on this scale is not something I've had the opportunity to witness before.

This score has the potential to be a life-changing event for me, and to hear 'The Undercurrent' performed by a professional orchestra will be out of this world. To be able to relive that experience with a recording will be unreal.

In addition to this, there are several other positive impacts:

  • Having this recording would mean that the ballet can be performed without a live orchestra in smaller venues, bringing it to a wider variety of audiences and stages

  • We can submit a far more polished pitch by including a professional standard recording to dance companies, orchestras and theatres in order to better our chances of having the work performed.


Risks & Challenges

Right now, the biggest challenge we face is raising the funding.

Put simply: if we do not fund this project, the recording will not go ahead.

We have taken the following steps to ensure that the risks are eliminated.

  • We have engaged specialist arts marketing agency Promote Classical to help with the campaign, acting as professional support to ensure we reach the widest audience possible
  • We are using flexible funding, to make sure that every penny raised goes directly towards the project

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, don't worry - we understand entirely! You can still help this campaign out without pledging:

  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit, Instagram, Pinterest, via Email, smoke signals, post the link to your grandparents, send it by owl or even by using QR codes. Every bit of exposure we get helps enormously.
  • Get in touch if you think you can recommend 'The Undercurrent' on to anyone else.
  • If you want to stage a performance of 'The Undercurrent', email our press team on info@promoteclassical.com
Thanks so much for taking the time to check out my pitch. For more information on me, you can visit my website at: www.georgiascott.co.uk

See you at the Theatre!

Georgia Scott

Twitter: @GScottComposer

Facebook: GScottComposer

Soundcloud: Georgia-Scott-15

Hi there!
I'm Australian Composer Georgia Scott, and I need your help to make my ballet 'The Undercurrent' become a reality.



A little bit about myself:
 
I'm a composer, which means that I write new music in many different genres I studied at the Royal College of Music, graduating earlier this year
I started composing at eleven years old, and it's my lifelong dream to continue writing as a professional career 

Composition is expensive. Whilst physically, we need just pens and paper, or perhaps a computer with notation software, the true cost is much dearer.

Recording costs, promotional spending, venue and rehearsal costs and travelling to and from performances of your work all rack up large expenditure, which on an income reliant on long-term composing commissions makes big projects very difficult to afford, particularly for a recent graduate living abroad.
So this is where you come in: I need your help.

'The Undercurrent': a New Ballet
I've written a major orchestral work in collaboration with Choreographer Alice Weber, Set Designer Stephanie Ferris and Costume Designer Lotte Welsh. Every bit of exposure we get helps enormously.
Get in touch if you think you can recommend 'The Undercurrent' on to anyone else.

story:
Welcome!

Maybe you've been listening to, hanging out with, and tapping your boots to Redleg Husky for years, or maybe you just enjoy heartfelt roots music and as a result have stumbled on this page. Either way, we the bandmates of Redleg Husky are excited to share our second full length album, My Old Heart, with you. We're going bigger than ever for this one, traveling from our home in Asheville, NC, to Connecticut to record at one of the country's premier Americana studios, Dirt Floor, in October. We believe that what we produce there will be the truest representation of our songwriting and musicianship yet.

What This Campaign Is All About

We've been hard at work over the last few years, gigging 4-5 times a week all around the Eastern USA, year-round, while also doing all of our own booking, promotion, and management. We've managed not only to make a living, but to put money aside to fund this second album ourselves.

This campaign is a way to facilitate getting My Old Heart into your hands. You get the new album before every other kid on the block has the chance to go to Tower Records and get it. Moreover, you get the best prices that we'll offer on all of our merch, including brand new Asheville-made, super soft and cozy t-shirts, handmade Husky koozies, durable vinyl stickers, and copies of our first full-length release, Carolina. In return, we get a little extra peace of mind, knowing that the effort and savings that we're putting into this project are being rewarded, and that quite a few ears out there are hearing the songs that we're making.

Other Ways You Can Help Us Do Our Thing

If you're not up for pre-ordering at this time, but you like the cut of our jib, enjoy our music and want to help us continue to make it, we'd really appreciate it if you could help spread the word about this campaign. The other thing that we always appreciate is you coming out to a show, bringing a friend that likes instruments with strings on them, shaking a tailfeather, and possibly buying Son a beer. He plays bass better that way. 

Thanks for reading, and we hope to see you all out there soon.

-Tim, Misa, and Son

story:
We are Homage. We are four friends (sometimes five depending on who fills in for us) that love animals, poutine, telling jokes, and above all else, making music. After recently completing our first 5 songs we found out that professionally recording them at a studio is going to be very expensive. So far we have done as much of this on our own using our own money, but we've hit a financial dead end and just need a little bit ($900) more. This amount will give us the opportunity to round out our funds and afford everything. We want to share our sound and message with the world and with the help from you paired with our hard work, we can guarantee that the final product will be well worth it.

We settled on the band name because we thought it was fair to pay tribute to everyone and everything that not only helped out with the band but also within our own lives. By helping us fund our record, the meaning of our band name will expand to incorporate each contributing person. With your kindness and support we will never be able to forget those who helped us carry out our passion of creating music.

story:
My Story


Hi! my name is Michaela. :)
I'm a musician, music teacher and according to my mother I began singing before I could talk.  I grew up in a musical family, the youngest of six girls. (Imagine an all female Partridge Family!)  I was 14 when I  wrote my first song. I remember the lyrics were something like, " Isn't it just wonderful... take a look at the love that is surrounding you...isn't it just wonderful...." The tune went on to talk about the trees outside...the sunshine...the beauty of nature. Of course, the next 10 songs I wrote were inspired by my first heart break; expressing all the trails, tribulations and joys of relationships.

HA! for those of you who know my music, there seems to be a theme here...not much has changed! :o) I've always loved, admired and been grateful for the world we live in and I thrive on having relationships with people. Naturally, all of this comes across in my song writing!

Over a decade later my love for LIFE and MUSIC has continued to grow and blossom. Now I desire to record my tunes with a professional sound and fulfill a dream of mine by sharing my music on a wider scale. Within the last year I've gotten a band together and have started to play shows locally. It is time for me to take the next step and get my first single recorded so I can promote, share, and spread my love & light out into the world!

Once I reach my goal, I will record my first single, 'Needed More'. From there I will continue to record, write and share my music with you all! I hope someday to produce a complete album. I can't WAIT!! :)

Here is a link to my youtube channel where you can see the acoustic version of 'Needed More'. This is before I had developed the tune with my band and written a middle section, but you'll get the idea. Check it out because it will be cool to hear the 'before & after'. :)

http://www.youtube.com/user/irishg24?feature=mhee


The Impact

Your contribution is HUGE. I won't be able to do this without your help. As a music teacher at a private school, I simply do not have the funds to book studio time. This stuff is expensive!

I desire to spread love and light through the songs I write. I want to help people feel connected to each other, the world, and not alone in the trials and joys they're going through. My hope is that you, the listener will feel connected and moved by the music I share.


What I Need

My goal is to raise $500 in the next 30 days! This will cover all the expenses to record my first single and all of this will be happening within the next few WEEKS!

I have an awesome producer named Loren Toolajian, who believes in my project and has agreed to record this single for me. He works out of a beautiful recording studio in NYC.  

sandblastproductions.com

If I don't reach my goal in 30 days I will use whatever contributions you've given towards the single. I am hopeful however in your generosity and belief in my project. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides contributing monetarily, it would be a HUGE help if you could pass the word on about my campaign! I cannot do this alone. Please help me make some NOISE by forwarding this campaign on through email, facebook, twitter...etc. There are some easy 'share tools' that you can use.

THANK YOU in advance!
Your belief in me, good thoughts, prayers, and love mean everything.
I can't wait to share with you the fruit of your generosity!

peace&love~
Michaela

story:
Hi, My Name is Joe Mifsud. Nice To Meet You!

        Hi, My name is Joe Mifsud and I am a 30 year old Multi-Instrumentalist, Singer-Songwriter from Harrington Park, NJ. In 2009, I played all the instruments, sang, wrote and produced all the songs on my debut album,"Mifology". In addition to independently funding and releasing my first album, I have contributed and written songs for film, composed a film score and wrote and recorded an Indie/Folk Side Project called Here For Now. Although I have experience recording in the studio, I am by no means a studio product. I have performed live numerous times, always working hard to refine the live show and entertain, and at noteworthy venues such as CBGB's, Maxwell's (as a headlining act) & The Bitter End. My live shows have been described as fun, high energy and engaging.

Currently, I am in the process of recording and releasing my second album," Stay Calm and Carry On" and I need YOUR HELP!

This campaign is to raise the necessary funding to complete "Stay Calm and Carry On" and to hire the Award Winning Filmmaking team Francisco Productions to film a music video for the first single,"5 Months"

To Thank You for your generous donation, I have listed some great perks for you!

If you are unable to donate, please share the campaign with others!

For all donations, I will be including a Special Surprise Bonus Gift AND a Postcard from NJ with a Personalized Message AND Autograph!

For Full Artist Bio, Music, Photos, Videos and more Check Out my official website at

http://www.mifmusic.com

Check Out Francisco Productions!

http://www.franciscoproductions.net

Watch the Francisco Productions' Cannes Award Winning Short Film, "An Anomaly of The Theory" by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking on the custom link titled Anomaly.

Contact Me!

Questions? Concerns? Booking? Press? Want to Collaborate? Want to share your campaign with me? Network?  

You can reach me directly at Mifsudjm@gmail.com 

Also Follow me on Twitter @JoeMifsudBand and on Facebook.

Stay Calm and Campaign On Mini Tour!

 

Joe Mifsud will be playing the following shows in support of the Stay Calm and Carry On Fundraising Campaign

  • July 4th , Thursday at 8:30PM- Muchmore's 2 Havemeyer St. in Brooklyn, NY $5
  • July 27th, Saturday at 11PM- Sidewalk Cafe in NY, NY Free One Drink Minimum, Show Will be recorded! 

http://www.sidewalkny.com

  • July 31st, Wednesday at 9PM- The Bitter End in NY, NY $10 Cover, Show will be recorded!

http://www.bitterend.com

  • August 10th, Saturday at 9PM- Goodbye Blue Monday in Brooklyn, NY, FREE!

http://www.goodbyeblue.com/wordpress

  • August 15th, Thursday at 7PM- Hank's Saloon in Brooklyn, NY, FREE! With Friends!

http://www.exitfive.com/hankssaloon

  • August 24th, Saturday at 7PM- Fatbaby's in NY, NY $7 Cover, With Friends!

http://www.fatbabynyc.com

  • Sept 14th, Saturday at 9PM- The Trash Bar in Brooklyn, NY $8 Cover, Show will be recorded!

http://www.thetrashbar.com

  • More To Be Announced
  • With Open Mic Appearances on Sundays at Pete's Candy Store Open mic in Brooklyn runs from 5pm-8pm 2 Songs per performer, Mondays at Sidewalk Cafe in NYC starts at 7:30 with Lotto System and Tuesdays at Goodbye Blue Monday open mic starts at 7PM.

Listen to Stay Calm and Carry On as you read about it! 

Click on the SCACO Link Below for Your Exclusive First Listen

http://joemifsudband.bandcamp.com/album/stay-ca...

 "Stay Calm and Carry On" stream is made possible by special permission and cooperation from Andrew Jaworski. It is one thing to describe to you what the music sounds like but it is beyond description & best experienced to convey how good it is. As unique as our story, so is our campaign. Enjoy the Music and Stay Calm and Campaign On!

Why a New Album?

 

"Why not?", which was actually the counter question from Producer/Engineer/Guitarist Andrew Jaworski when we first met to discuss making an album together. My reply was simple and logical,"Time and Money. Okay, well time I can make happen but really the money".

After barely paying off my first album and the expenses of pressing a limited number, the last thing I wanted to do was put myself back into a money pit of debt. 

Andrew's counter proposal,"Why don't we make the album and worry about the money later?" 

In my head, my first thought was,"Easy for you to say" but my mouth said," Sure, how do you suggest we work it out?"

Andrew and I worked out an agreement that is unusual and not often done in music, if ever. We would begin work on,"Stay Calm and Carry On" , I would pay as we went along in installments, making sure the session musicians' fees were taken care of and then after everyone had been paid, including the string arranger, yes we had a string section perform on the album, and the master-er, and the results came in, Andrew would be the last man standing for payment. 

Such an agreement would not have been possible without an established trust from our friendship and a strong belief that the material was worth sacificing an upfront pay day and possibly a friendship. True to our word, we reconvened in Fall of 2011 to start what would become ,"Stay Calm and Carry On".

As the sessions began, we knew early on that we were recording a special record, one that we would both be proud to have made. The process of making the album started when we met for a pre-production session to review the songs I had written and discuss possible arrangement ideas. I brought in 17 songs that were whittled down to 13 and then ultimately down to a final 12 songs. 

With the aforementioned songs handpicked and agreed upon, Andrew assembled a stellar cast of musicians to participate on the album. Andrew and the musicians were essential in crafting the overall sound. What Andrew and the musicians brought to the songs was a musicianship that didn't previously exist due to my lack of Musical Theory Knowledge and the music greatly benefitted from their arrangements and performances. 

Once the recording sessions were wrapped, what remained to be finished was the post-production. Andrew mixed the album with notes from Terence Deutsch and Terence, who has done live sound for Mumford & Sons, mastered the album. It is one thing to capture excellent performances on recording but it is necessary to have it properly mixed and mastered in order to present the music the way it was meant to be heard.

Finished in early 2013, "Stay Calm and Carry On" was the most ambitious album that any of us had ever had the pleasure to make. "Stay Calm and Carry On" does not sound like a collection of songs made by an indepedent musician but rather an ecletic masterpiece that engages its listeners by indulging them in an auditory experience. With it's overall message of overcoming adversity and heartbreak, it is my sincere hope that anyone listening to the music may find comfort and strength in the songs just as I did in the writing and recording of them.

 

Why A Music Video?

   To further compliment and introduce ,"Stay Calm and Carry On", it was only fitting to want to make a proper music video to present the first single,"5 Months". In thinking about who I wanted to write and direct the music video, I couldn't think of anyone better than Francisco Productions to film it. Francisco Productions' attention to detail, as made evident by their track record of success, had caught my eye. Almost as soon as we had met, we began discussing partnering on creative endeavors. 

In addition to Francisco Productions' filming the "5 Months" music video, I will be contributing a new original song called,"Seedy" to their upcoming full length feature film called,"Awful Sexy". Francisco Productions has previously won an award at the prestigious Cannes Festival for their short film,"An Anomaly of The Theory".

Francisco Productions' website is http://www.franciscoproductions.net

Watch the Francisco Productions' Cannes Award Winning Short Film, "An Anomaly of The Theory" by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking on the custom link titled Anomaly.

What is my hard-earned money funding? 

   In order to make an album and a music video, there are several people involved, specialists as I like to refer to them. "Stay Calm and Carry On" required us to hire outside musicians that were specialists in their respective fields and also to do the things that we couldn't do on our own such as playing stringed parts like Violin and Cello. Expertise costs money and nobody works for free. In many cases, we reached into our networks and called in favors from friends but even then it was only fair to financially compensate the cast and crew for their hard work and time. Similarly to the end credits of a movie, it requires a team to put together a production.

For "Stay Calm and Carry On" I paid all the musicians' expenses, the string arranger and the master-er, however I still need to pay Andrew for his services and Francisco Productions. 

Andew and I Agreed on a $5,000 Budget for the Album

I've already paid $2,500 in Musician Fees, Arranger Fee, Mastering Costs, etc. on my own and have gotten the project this far but need your help to complete it.

Andrew Jaworski (Producer/Engineer/Musician)- $2,500

Franciso Productions (Filmmakers, Cast and Crew)- $2,500

Any additional funds will go towards covering the 4 percent fee that Indiegogo takes, Perk Fulfillment costs, pressing costs for "Stay Calm and Carry On" and Promotional Costs such as Gig Travel Expenses (Gas, Toll, fixing the car) , Contest Submission Fees and Merchandise, anything and everything music-related - like money towards the next album!

 

Awesome perks for generous donations!

Full details on the right.

Exclusive shirts:

Stay Calm and Carry On Personel

Joe Mifsud- Vocals, Guitars, Drums on "Bound","Being There" and "My Soulmate Has No Soul"

Andrew Jaworksi- Background Vocals, Banjo, Dobro, Ukulele, Glockenspiel, Trumpet, Classical Guitar, Slide Guitar, Acoustic Guitar on "Can't Make Plans With Girls", Lead Electric Guitar on "Bound", "Five Months", "My Soulmate Has No Soul"

Scott Greenberg- Drums, Percussion

Bill Thoman- Bass

Patrick Rienzo- Organ

Linea Rondael- Piano

Chelsea Nantz- Background Vocals

Linsay Setzer- Cello

Rozie Dumas- Violin

Colleen Mander- Violin

Jimmy Meier- Percussion on "She's At It Again" and "Lady Liberty"

Gang Vocals- Joe Mifsud, Andrew Jaworski, Peter Res

Recorded and Mixed by Andrew Jaworski

Mastered by Terence Deutsch (Mumford and Sons Live Sound)

String Arrangements on "Afterthought", "Being There" and " Honeymoon's Over" by Chrissy Tignor , String Arragement on "These Days" by Andrew Jaworski.

Additional Engineering by Jimmy Meier

Additional Editing by Mike Ferrante and Jimmy Meier

Artwork by Jessie Greenberg

All Songs Written by Joe Mifsud

Produced by Andrew Jaworski with Joe Mifsud

All Songs Copyrighted and Published by Songs That No One Hears Publishing.

Testimonials about Joe: 

"My brother and I met Joe Mifsud in 2008, when our artistic lives crossed pathes. Joe wasn't far removed from recording his album,'Mifology' and my brother and I were relatively fresh from the success of 'An Anomaly of The Theory' which premiered in Cannes. We talked about our respective arts, exchanged business cards and developed a mutual respect for one another. Throughout the years, we had discussed eventually working together in some capacity and in 2011 an opportunity presented itself. Joe was beginning work on his latest album,' Stay Calm and Carry On' and we began work on the script to our latest film,' Awful Sexy'. We had mentioned the film to Joe and he was interested in contributing a song to the soundtrack even though we were still working on the script. Joe, inspired from reading the synopsis of the film, wrote and recorded an acoustic version of 'Seedy' and sent it to us. When we heard the song, we knew that he got 'IT'; that he understood what we were trying to convey in the film. Months later, Joe recorded and emailed to us the finished version of 'Seedy' and it was a complete 180 from the original version we heard and I mean that in a good way. 'Seedy' was everything we hope for and more. Joe understood what we wanted and was able to incorporate our direction into the final product and the delivery was on point."- Gabriel Francisco of Francisco Productions.

"Joe Mifsud came into my life back when I was working at a radio promotions company out in Santa Monica, CA. We met through email and have been in contact ever since. I am a creative mind and tend to gravitate towards people who have the same outlook on life. I'm happy to say Joe and I share a passion towards not only music, but creating art out of what we love. In the years that I've known Joe, he's gone from this musician that I pester about promotion, to a friend. The one thing that has been consistent is his tenacity for hard work. I've watched him focus so much energy and time on non-music thing like jobs and such, just so that he can continue to make music and perform. I look forward to what the future hold for Joe Mifsud and I can't wait until I can say," Yeah, I knew him when..." - Kendra Beltran of Bryan Farrish Radio Promotions and Blogger at Goldenmixtape.com

"Back in December I met a friend of a friend, Joe Mifsud, as he was collaborating on a music video with cinematographer Matt Rosen for his song 'Bound'. I was a producer on the video and got to hear this and other songs of Joe's while on the shoot. I knew right off the bat that he had talent, but I was impressed with his skill as a guitarist and the care he took with the lyrics of his song, that they came from the heart and had sensitivity to them. That the songs rocked out anyway were a big plus. I had been also at this time working out what songs to use for my feature film 'Green Eyes', and was having trouble with a song that would take the place over a love scene (nothing explicit but tender and stark, a dark scene but with a bluesy feel). I realized Joe was the guy to do it, and after some back and forth on some ideas, and a few demos, he came up with a wonderful song called 'Passion in the Darkest Places'. I couldn't be happier how the experience turned out, and it added something extra to the film I didn't expect as truly soulful. You need that with the blues." - Jack Gattanella, Writer/Director of Green Eyes

"Joe Mifsud has been one of my longest collaborators.  I have had the pleasure of working with him on numerous projects.  In the summer of 2006, we shot two music videos together, in locations around the northern New Jersey area as well as down in the Outer Banks of North Carolina.  Following that, Mifsud acted in my first short film, Brothers of Freedom, and created an entirely original soundtrack for the movie.  After a few sessions of sit downs, telling him what I wanted, Mifsud crafted something that helped give the film an aesthetic tone.  After realizing that we could work with one another and challenge each other creatively, Mifsud and I worked on two more films together, the last one being Seeking Nirvana, where he contributed two of his songs.  “Helpless,” which is played near the very end of the film, helped the scenes I matched it with resonate with audiences.  In short, Joe Mifsud is a multi-talented artist who I will always back and vouch for.  He’s got an ear for music and a talent for writing lyrics that I don’t see in most." - Professor Billy Tooma - Published Poet, Filmmaker 

Discography:

 -Mifology (2009) 15 Song Full Length Debut Album

 -Out On My Own (2009) 20 Song Solo Acoustic Album

 -These Days Single (2010)

 -Here For Now- Letters Home (2012)

 -What Happens In Vegas (2012) 8 Song Covers Album 

 -All We Got! Records- Good Music For Better Days featuring "Helpless"

 This is a benefit compilation for Suicide Prevention. It's for a great cause and there are a lot of other great artists on the compilation as well. Not only did I donate "Helpless", I bought a copy to support the cause, it's only $10.

 http://allwegotrecords.bandcamp.com/album/good-music-for-better-days

 -Stay Calm and Carry On (2013) 12 Song Sophomore Album

Soundtrack Work:

-Chronicles of the Beyond- Song For The Bomb That Didn't Explode (Demo) (2009)

 -Seeking Nirvana- "Helpless" & "Hard To Get" from Mifology (2012)

 -Green Eyes- "Passion In the Darkest Places" (2013)

 -Awful Sexy- "Seedy" (2014) for Francisco Productions.
