story_txt:
Hi, My Name is Joe Mifsud. Nice To Meet You!
        Hi, My name is Joe Mifsud and I am a 30 year old Multi-Instrumentalist, Singer-Songwriter from Harrington Park, NJ. In 2009, I played all the instruments, sang, wrote and produced all the songs on my debut album,"Mifology". In addition to independently funding and releasing my first album, I have contributed and written songs for film, composed a film score and wrote and recorded an Indie/Folk Side Project called Here For Now. Although I have experience recording in the studio, I am by no means a studio product. I have performed live numerous times, always working hard to refine the live show and entertain, and at noteworthy venues such as CBGB's, Maxwell's (as a headlining act) & The Bitter End. My live shows have been described as fun, high energy and engaging.
Currently, I am in the process of recording and releasing my second album," Stay Calm and Carry On" and I need YOUR HELP!
This campaign is to raise the necessary funding to complete "Stay Calm and Carry On" and to hire the Award Winning Filmmaking team Francisco Productions to film a music video for the first single,"5 Months"
To Thank You for your generous donation, I have listed some great perks for you!
If you are unable to donate, please share the campaign with others!
For all donations, I will be including a Special Surprise Bonus Gift AND a Postcard from NJ with a Personalized Message AND Autograph!
For Full Artist Bio, Music, Photos, Videos and more Check Out my official website at
http://www.mifmusic.com
Check Out Francisco Productions!
http://www.franciscoproductions.net
Watch the Francisco Productions' Cannes Award Winning Short Film, "An Anomaly of The Theory" by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking on the custom link titled Anomaly.
Contact Me!



Questions? Concerns? Booking? Press? Want to Collaborate? Want to share your campaign with me? Network?  
You can reach me directly at Mifsudjm@gmail.com 
Also Follow me on Twitter @JoeMifsudBand and on Facebook.
Stay Calm and Campaign On Mini Tour!

 

Joe Mifsud will be playing the following shows in support of the Stay Calm and Carry On Fundraising Campaign

July 4th , Thursday at 8:30PM- Muchmore's 2 Havemeyer St. in Brooklyn, NY $5
July 27th, Saturday at 11PM- Sidewalk Cafe in NY, NY Free One Drink Minimum, Show Will be recorded! 
http://www.sidewalkny.com

July 31st, Wednesday at 9PM- The Bitter End in NY, NY $10 Cover, Show will be recorded!
http://www.bitterend.com

August 10th, Saturday at 9PM- Goodbye Blue Monday in Brooklyn, NY, FREE!
http://www.goodbyeblue.com/wordpress

August 15th, Thursday at 7PM- Hank's Saloon in Brooklyn, NY, FREE! With Friends!
http://www.exitfive.com/hankssaloon

August 24th, Saturday at 7PM- Fatbaby's in NY, NY $7 Cover, With Friends!
http://www.fatbabynyc.com

Sept 14th, Saturday at 9PM- The Trash Bar in Brooklyn, NY $8 Cover, Show will be recorded!
http://www.thetrashbar.com

More To Be Announced
With Open Mic Appearances on Sundays at Pete's Candy Store Open mic in Brooklyn runs from 5pm-8pm 2 Songs per performer, Mondays at Sidewalk Cafe in NYC starts at 7:30 with Lotto System and Tuesdays at Goodbye Blue Monday open mic starts at 7PM.
Listen to Stay Calm and Carry On as you read about it! 



Click on the SCACO Link Below for Your Exclusive First Listen
http://joemifsudband.bandcamp.com/album/stay-ca...
 "Stay Calm and Carry On" stream is made possible by special permission and cooperation from Andrew Jaworski. It is one thing to describe to you what the music sounds like but it is beyond description & best experienced to convey how good it is. As unique as our story, so is our campaign. Enjoy the Music and Stay Calm and Campaign On!
Why a New Album?


 

"Why not?", which was actually the counter question from Producer/Engineer/Guitarist Andrew Jaworski when we first met to discuss making an album together. My reply was simple and logical,"Time and Money. Okay, well time I can make happen but really the money".
After barely paying off my first album and the expenses of pressing a limited number, the last thing I wanted to do was put myself back into a money pit of debt. 
Andrew's counter proposal,"Why don't we make the album and worry about the money later?" 
In my head, my first thought was,"Easy for you to say" but my mouth said," Sure, how do you suggest we work it out?"
Andrew and I worked out an agreement that is unusual and not often done in music, if ever. We would begin work on,"Stay Calm and Carry On" , I would pay as we went along in installments, making sure the session musicians' fees were taken care of and then after everyone had been paid, including the string arranger, yes we had a string section perform on the album, and the master-er, and the results came in, Andrew would be the last man standing for payment. 
Such an agreement would not have been possible without an established trust from our friendship and a strong belief that the material was worth sacificing an upfront pay day and possibly a friendship. True to our word, we reconvened in Fall of 2011 to start what would become ,"Stay Calm and Carry On".
As the sessions began, we knew early on that we were recording a special record, one that we would both be proud to have made. The process of making the album started when we met for a pre-production session to review the songs I had written and discuss possible arrangement ideas. I brought in 17 songs that were whittled down to 13 and then ultimately down to a final 12 songs. 
With the aforementioned songs handpicked and agreed upon, Andrew assembled a stellar cast of musicians to participate on the album. Andrew and the musicians were essential in crafting the overall sound. What Andrew and the musicians brought to the songs was a musicianship that didn't previously exist due to my lack of Musical Theory Knowledge and the music greatly benefitted from their arrangements and performances. 
Once the recording sessions were wrapped, what remained to be finished was the post-production. Andrew mixed the album with notes from Terence Deutsch and Terence, who has done live sound for Mumford & Sons, mastered the album. It is one thing to capture excellent performances on recording but it is necessary to have it properly mixed and mastered in order to present the music the way it was meant to be heard.
Finished in early 2013, "Stay Calm and Carry On" was the most ambitious album that any of us had ever had the pleasure to make. "Stay Calm and Carry On" does not sound like a collection of songs made by an indepedent musician but rather an ecletic masterpiece that engages its listeners by indulging them in an auditory experience. With it's overall message of overcoming adversity and heartbreak, it is my sincere hope that anyone listening to the music may find comfort and strength in the songs just as I did in the writing and recording of them.
 
Why A Music Video?



   To further compliment and introduce ,"Stay Calm and Carry On", it was only fitting to want to make a proper music video to present the first single,"5 Months". In thinking about who I wanted to write and direct the music video, I couldn't think of anyone better than Francisco Productions to film it. Francisco Productions' attention to detail, as made evident by their track record of success, had caught my eye. Almost as soon as we had met, we began discussing partnering on creative endeavors. 
In addition to Francisco Productions' filming the "5 Months" music video, I will be contributing a new original song called,"Seedy" to their upcoming full length feature film called,"Awful Sexy". Francisco Productions has previously won an award at the prestigious Cannes Festival for their short film,"An Anomaly of The Theory".
Francisco Productions' website is http://www.franciscoproductions.net
Watch the Francisco Productions' Cannes Award Winning Short Film, "An Anomaly of The Theory" by scrolling to the bottom of the page and clicking on the custom link titled Anomaly.



What is my hard-earned money funding? 
   In order to make an album and a music video, there are several people involved, specialists as I like to refer to them. "Stay Calm and Carry On" required us to hire outside musicians that were specialists in their respective fields and also to do the things that we couldn't do on our own such as playing stringed parts like Violin and Cello. Expertise costs money and nobody works for free. In many cases, we reached into our networks and called in favors from friends but even then it was only fair to financially compensate the cast and crew for their hard work and time. Similarly to the end credits of a movie, it requires a team to put together a production.
For "Stay Calm and Carry On" I paid all the musicians' expenses, the string arranger and the master-er, however I still need to pay Andrew for his services and Francisco Productions. 
Andew and I Agreed on a $5,000 Budget for the Album
I've already paid $2,500 in Musician Fees, Arranger Fee, Mastering Costs, etc. on my own and have gotten the project this far but need your help to complete it.
Andrew Jaworski (Producer/Engineer/Musician)- $2,500
Franciso Productions (Filmmakers, Cast and Crew)- $2,500
Any additional funds will go towards covering the 4 percent fee that Indiegogo takes, Perk Fulfillment costs, pressing costs for "Stay Calm and Carry On" and Promotional Costs such as Gig Travel Expenses (Gas, Toll, fixing the car) , Contest Submission Fees and Merchandise, anything and everything music-related - like money towards the next album!
 

Awesome perks for generous donations!
Full details on the right.
Exclusive shirts:


Stay Calm and Carry On Personel
Joe Mifsud- Vocals, Guitars, Drums on "Bound","Being There" and "My Soulmate Has No Soul"
Andrew Jaworksi- Background Vocals, Banjo, Dobro, Ukulele, Glockenspiel, Trumpet, Classical Guitar, Slide Guitar, Acoustic Guitar on "Can't Make Plans With Girls", Lead Electric Guitar on "Bound", "Five Months", "My Soulmate Has No Soul"
Scott Greenberg- Drums, Percussion
Bill Thoman- Bass
Patrick Rienzo- Organ
Linea Rondael- Piano
Chelsea Nantz- Background Vocals
Linsay Setzer- Cello
Rozie Dumas- Violin
Colleen Mander- Violin

Gang Vocals- Joe Mifsud, Andrew Jaworski, Peter Res
Recorded and Mixed by Andrew Jaworski
Mastered by Terence Deutsch (Mumford and Sons Live Sound)
String Arrangements on "Afterthought", "Being There" and " Honeymoon's Over" by Chrissy Tignor , String Arragement on "These Days" by Andrew Jaworski.
Additional Engineering by Jimmy Meier
Additional Editing by Mike Ferrante and Jimmy Meier
Artwork by Jessie Greenberg
All Songs Written by Joe Mifsud
Produced by Andrew Jaworski with Joe Mifsud
All Songs Copyrighted and Published by Songs That No One Hears Publishing.



Testimonials about Joe: 

"My brother and I met Joe Mifsud in 2008, when our artistic lives crossed pathes. Joe wasn't far removed from recording his album,'Mifology' and my brother and I were relatively fresh from the success of 'An Anomaly of The Theory' which premiered in Cannes. We talked about our respective arts, exchanged business cards and developed a mutual respect for one another. Throughout the years, we had discussed eventually working together in some capacity and in 2011 an opportunity presented itself. Joe was beginning work on his latest album,' Stay Calm and Carry On' and we began work on the script to our latest film,' Awful Sexy'. We had mentioned the film to Joe and he was interested in contributing a song to the soundtrack even though we were still working on the script. Joe, inspired from reading the synopsis of the film, wrote and recorded an acoustic version of 'Seedy' and sent it to us. When we heard the song, we knew that he got 'IT'; that he understood what we were trying to convey in the film. Months later, Joe recorded and emailed to us the finished version of 'Seedy' and it was a complete 180 from the original version we heard and I mean that in a good way. 'Seedy' was everything we hope for and more. Joe understood what we wanted and was able to incorporate our direction into the final product and the delivery was on point."- Gabriel Francisco of Francisco Productions.

I had been also at this time working out what songs to use for my feature film 'Green Eyes', and was having trouble with a song that would take the place over a love scene (nothing explicit but tender and stark, a dark scene but with a bluesy feel). I couldn't be happier how the experience turned out, and it added something extra to the film I didn't expect as truly soulful. story:
HELLO AND THANK YOU FOR STOPPING BY MY INDIEGOGO PAGE.

Hi.

I’m Lena Coleman.  If you’re reading this you probably know me, or my parents, or one of my fabulous friends who passed this onto you and are bullying you to donate to help me make my dreams come true. The bare bones info you need to know about me: I’m awesome, I do awesome things and I know awesome people.

The sky is the limit when it comes to what I want to accomplish and what I want to put out in the world, but I thought... baby steps first. This is why I’m starting out with a single release, followed by cutting an EP (a short form album). Recording an album has been a dream of mine for as long as I can remember, so this is also an end in itself.  I want to create something. I want to show the world who I am.  I want to make art. However, it will also be a new beginning for me, as I intend to use this record as a calling card to start the first phase of my musical career. I want to play loads of shows, I want to tour, I want to play for you in your hometown, and I want to be on Glee! Having a great sounding album is what is needed to generate that kind of momentum with booking agents, DJs, promoters, and music lovers like you!

The Project

In order to embark on my very first recording project, I need funding!  Your contributions will go towards the following:

  • Professional recording studio rental fees
  • Compensation for the engineer's time (recording, overdubs, mixing)
  • Compensation for all contributing musicians for their time and creativity
  • Compensation for a mastering engineer's time
  • Initial set-up costs to distribute the album digitally
  • Any additional contributions above my goal will go towards PR and Marketing

Your support will not go unrewarded. Check out the right column for the cool swag and unforgettable experiences you will get in return for your generosity. The money I am raising will be spent solely on bringing my EP to life, I am only raising what I need, not what I want (i.e. that beautiful and ridiculously overpriced whatever I saw on etsy). 

 

If you are new to IndieGoGo (or other online funding platforms), there are two notable factors to keep in mind that determine the success of this endeavor:

  • IndieGoGo operates on an all-or-nothing model.  This means that the full project goal MUST be met for the artist to receive any of the contributions.  Not 25% of it.  Not 10%.  100% of it.
  • IndieGoGo takes 4% of each project. A small price to pay for the use of its sleek interface and exposure to its warm and welcoming community.  This 4% IndieGoGo cost has been built into the project goal, along with the items listed in the cost breakdown described above.  By contributing to this project, you provide support to a company that is entirely focused on helping creative minds like you and me get the extra lift we need.

From reading this, you've probably noticed that the album doesn't have a title yet. Join in, and this is just part of the inside scoop you'll get from supporting me. I will also be checking in regularly to keep you updated of my progress. So, please spread the word, and I thank you in advance for all your support!

For more information on me, you can check me out on Facebook and Twitter (lenacoleman).

A final note: The project goal leaves little room for error.  How far each song gets explored on the EP is entirely dependent on your contributions and whether I exceed my goal.  With that in mind, additional contributions above and beyond our goal will go towards breathing more life into each song, paying musicians what they deserve and marketing the album.

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everyone! Pam Taylor here! I am so excited about finally getting to work on my CD.  It has been a long time coming.  We go into the studio at the end of October and hope to have it finished by Christmas.  The songs are written and ready to go!  

What We Need & What You Get

 

I figure if we can raise at least $3000 we can put out a quality CD.  We already have some money saved up and along with some donations from some fans already. With this we believe we can cover our expenses.  I have come up with some incentives for you, the contributors, in hopes that you will find them fun and exciting.  

The Impact

We really hate to see the disappointment in people's faces when they come to a show and want to buy a CD.  This is a must for every successful band.  We need a CD to shop to record labels and to even get certain gigs.  So you see just how important this is.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, there are still ways to support us, such as sharing this with your friends on social media websites, coming to our shows or just buying our band merchandise.  We appreciate all the continued support that you have shown us and we hope to continue making music for you.  Thanks again for being our fan!

story:
We are The Redhill Valleys.

First of all, The Redhill Valleys' members, Chelsea McWilliams, Tim Allard and Danielle Beaudin would like to thank you for your interest in participating in our campaign! Our main goal is to release an album by Spring of 2015, but we need your help! 
As individual musicians, each of us draw from our unique musical backgrounds as songwriters, teachers, engineers, and multi-instrumentalists. We each perform locally in live bands, teach music lessons at various music studios, work as studio engineers, as well as other part time jobs to pay the rent. As independent musicians, it can be challenging (as most of our peers can relate), to maintain a steady income and still be able to do what you love/are passionate about. As busy as we are, Kraft Dinner is still #1 on the menu. 
After making a trip down south to Nashville, and with weeks of co-writing sessions and gigs, we arrived home with not a penny to our names. Instead, a studio-ready album. 
We are The Redhill Valleys.
This will be the debut album for this Roots/Rock trio, who have been compared to the sounds of Fleetwood Mac, Civil Wars, and The Band. After a month of playing shows in the Hamilton area, TRV have received tremendous responses and support to their original music. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5,000 to put towards our recording fees. This mainly includes Producer/studio fees, and rental costs. At rates of $50/per hour, this is a very expensive process, and takes some people several years to create albums..... *coughDanielle*cough. We would basically like to narrow this window down to 4 or 5 months. 
We would like to give you an incentive to help us out. Consider this to be almost like an advance payment on merchandise. Here is what we would like to offer you:
$25 = Free CD
$60= Free CD + T shirt + 1 Download Card
$100+ = Free CD + T shirt + Poster + 3 Download Cards
$1000+ = All listed above + Private Event Concert

If you are not able to donate, you can still help us out. Share this page with your friends on FB, Twitter etc. 

We hope to see you at our next show!

Many many many thanks,
The Redhill Valleys

theredhillvalleys.com
story_txt:
We are The Redhill Valleys.
First of all, The Redhill Valleys' members, Chelsea McWilliams, Tim Allard and Danielle Beaudin would like to thank you for your interest in participating in our campaign! Our main goal is to release an album by Spring of 2015, but we need your help! As individual musicians, each of us draw from our unique musical backgrounds as songwriters, teachers, engineers, and multi-instrumentalists. We each perform locally in live bands, teach music lessons at various music studios, work as studio engineers, as well as other part time jobs to pay the rent. As independent musicians, it can be challenging (as most of our peers can relate), to maintain a steady income and still be able to do what you love/are passionate about. As busy as we are, Kraft Dinner is still #1 on the menu. After making a trip down south to Nashville, and with weeks of co-writing sessions and gigs, we arrived home with not a penny to our names. Instead, a studio-ready album. We are The Redhill Valleys.
This will be the debut album for this Roots/Rock trio, who have been compared to the sounds of Fleetwood Mac, Civil Wars, and The Band. After a month of playing shows in the Hamilton area, TRV have received tremendous responses and support to their original music. 


What We Need & What You GetOur goal is to raise $5,000 to put towards our recording fees. This mainly includes Producer/studio fees, and rental costs. At rates of $50/per hour, this is a very expensive process, and takes some people several years to create albums..... *coughDanielle*cough. We would basically like to narrow this window down to 4 or 5 months. 
We would like to give you an incentive to help us out. Consider this to be almost like an advance payment on merchandise. Here is what we would like to offer you:
$25 = Free CD
$60= Free CD + T shirt + 1 Download Card
$100+ = Free CD + T shirt + Poster + 3 Download Cards
$1000+ = All listed above + Private Event Concert
If you are not able to donate, you can still help us out. Share this page with your friends on FB, Twitter etc. We hope to see you at our next show!Many many many thanks,The Redhill Valleystheredhillvalleys.com

story:
Music as Medicine 

I've been writing songs for the past 7 years. Music has always been a way for me to connect to the deeper message of my soul, nature, and the small wise voice within guiding me home. Although I don't play out very often (maybe a few times a year), I do sometimes share in intimate healing song circles, and I've always dreamt of making an album of my music.  

I've been in contact with Eric about recording an album for about a year, and as magic would have it, I ended up at his house just a few weeks ago!  Eric has a professional and fully equipped studio, and the skills to help me make this a beautifully produced album. We've already begun the work on the album, but I need your help to make it epic!  

What We Need & What You Get

The recording process is very complex and time consuming!  In order to bring the songs to their full potential, I'll also need to hire some musicians, and to compensate Eric for playing various instruments on the track.  To really get the album to sound right, I'll need to have it mixed and mastered, which takes hours of work.  I'm raising funds to help with the costs of studio time, musicians, and the mixing and mastering process. 

How $3,333 will be spent:

$3,000: Production and post production; recording, editing, mixing, mastering, additional musicians, and making CDs.

$333: Album artwork

Any additional funds raised will go towards making the album even more awesome (more musicians, etc). It may mean that I make the album 8 tracks instead of 6 (or even 10!).  Extra funds could also go towards covering indiegogo fees, setting up a music website, or extra unforeseen studio costs.

Stretch Goal #1: $4,444: $1,000 would go towards recording an additional 2 songs

Stretch Goal #2: $5,555: $1,000 would go towards building a website, covering indiegogo fees, and adding more layers to the songs.

There are some really fun and unique perks for contributing!  A number of my friends are donating some of their amazing gifts such as readings, specialty products, and more!  I'm also offering some free coaching services. If there are still people that would like to donate gifts as perks, I am still receiving donors.

The Impact

I've already begun the process of recording, and I intend to finish the album by the end of September.  My hope is that these songs will touch peoples hearts, and help them to tune more deeply into their soul essence. I believe that when we live from the heart, the world is a better place.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this page on your social media networks
  • Consider contributing a "perk"
  • Share with people who love soulful indie/folk music

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
We’ve got big new music dreams

From our first concert in 2006, to our 10th Strange Beautiful Music marathon, we’ve made it our mission to bring you expert-level performances of music by living composers. Now we want to take it up a notch. We need your help to commission Annie Gosfield for a new piece inspired by one of Detroit’s most prized artworks, the DIA’s “Detroit Industry” murals.

Break it down now!

You’re just like us, you love new music! That’s why we came up with a bunch of rewards we know you’ll love. The Knight Arts Challenge is just that: a challenge to engage our community and draw on your support to make exciting, strange, new music that is unique to Detroit. When you give to our campaign, you’re helping us generate new Detroit-centric music by a major composer AND getting access to an incredible spectrum of rewards, such as…

  • Next-generation NMD t-shirts
  • Flashdrive roulette (with some super exclusive stuff from the archives)
  • Our forthcoming Marc Mellits album and access to the release party on April 2 at El Club
  • Strange Beautiful Music swag and superfan care packages
  • And you could even pick a song for us to cover, yes any song.

Iconic work, important meaning

Odds are that anyone from Detroit will have a relative who worked in the auto industry. You don’t need to look hard at Rivera’s murals to see the message: that working together, we can achieve incredible things. Detroit Industry depicts the Ford Assembly Line, a place where anyone could come to work and everyone played and important part. It didn’t matter who you were, you could sign up and get that famous $5-a-day wage. These murals have become one of the city’s most beloved pieces of art and we think the message is worthy of celebrating with new music!

So why Annie Gosfield, you ask? First off, Annie has long been inspired by the Rivera murals and has always wanted to write for them. Secondly, to put it simply, her music is "industrial". She has a distinctly futuristic way of using sounds that we absolute love and that makes her music as innovative & timely as ever.

Annie is also one of the most important voices in the current American new music scene. She recently premiered her new opera "War of the Worlds" with the LA Philharmonic, to top-notch reviews -- just the latest in a long string of accolades & accomplishments. As NMD looks to work with the most significant composers of our time, Annie -- whose work so creatively balances art and industry -- was an obvious choice for this project.

 

Risks & Challenges

Along with a considerable amount of tender loving care, New Music Detroit is able to pull off big projects like Detroit Industry with support from our community, contributors, and friends. The Knight Foundation has agreed to fund half of the project, but we need your help to raise the other half!

NMD’s got a big 2018 lined up - helping us with this campaign ensures we can do the other stuff too, like:

  • Another 3-day Strange Beautiful Music in September
  • Our new Marc Mellits album (forthcoming in April)
  • Performances in new areas of the city and beyond

Perks, swag, rewards, and thank you's!

NMD Gen-II t-shirt (Back us at the $30 level)

 

Strange Beautiful T-shirt (Back us at the $40 level)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey we get it, you might not have enough to spare. But you can still help us amplify the love of new music! Make some noise about our Detroit Industry on social media, find us on Facebook / Instagram / Twitter or at newmusicdetroit.com - Indiegogo has provided lots of sharing options right here on this page. Let people know you value new music!

story:
Introduction

Hi! I am a Portuguese vocalist, composer, improviser working  in the field of jazz, improvised and experimental music since first arriving in New York in 2008. I am launching this campaign to raise funds to record my new album, Recognition.

 

What is Recognition?

Recognition is an interdisciplinary project,  in which music and image highlighted with texts by revolutionary Amílcar Cabral, invite the viewer/ listener to reflect on history in a non-literal way.  

I produced Recognition  using Super 8 footage filmed by my grandfather, in Angola and Portugal in the 60’s, by then a fascist and colonizer regime. I then composed the music for the film and invited the amazing Zeena Parkins (harp), Mark Turner (tenor sax) and David Virelles (piano) to perform it.

This extraordinary ensemble probes deep into the emotional core of this era through scored material and flowing improvisation. The project questions the collective amnesia on Europe’s colonial past. Recognition invites all for reflection on history through music, film and text, 

We have presented Recognition live during the year of 2018 at The Drawing Center (curated by John Zorn), Winter Jazz Festival 2018, Alwan For the Arts (curated by Amir Elsaffar) and The Kitchen (curated by Vijay Iyer). 

Now it is time to document it and record the music, so Recognition can be available to everyone. 

 

What I am asking for?

For this recording to happen I need to raise  $8000 to support the following costs:

1 Day in Studio

4 Musicians + 1 Engineer (Pete Rende) Fees

Mixing Session

Mastering Session

Vinyl + CD  Printing

I envision the digital release of the film with music, with the option of supporters purchasing the audio file as mp3 or vinyl, DVD, CD with or without access to the film. The release of this album is scheduled for December 2019. Pre-ordering your Digital Download, CD, Vinyl, Flashdrive, etc... means you are contributing directly to this recording. I hope you can join me on this campaign!

 

Why did I create Recognition?

Talking about Angola and Portugal, is talking about Brazil, United States and Europe - the western world shares a collective shameful past of occupation, exploitation, slave trade, oppression, racism, segregation, violence and abuse.

I created Recognition:

- to bring awareness to general audiences, making them listen, see, reflect and recognize privilege and inherited structures of racism,  silently and deliberately perpetuated through present times.

- to bear witness to the events that passed and the legacy of colonialism, particularly in a moment of rising nationalist and white supremacists movements.

- to highlight the power of music as a tool for social evolution, reflection and education.

- To break the silence about Portuguese Colonialism and institutional racism. Empathy and emotional contagion during music listening are crucial to this piece. Listening (opposed to silencing) means to deliberately channel attention toward a sound. 

 

 With music, the silence is broken.

 

When will it be ready?

Our studio session is scheduled to July 2nd 2019. The album will be released in December 2019. As a backer of this project, you will have access to everything as soon as it is ready, which will be around September 2019.

 

How can you help?

Any contribution is greatly appreciated, but if you are unable to contribute, here are a few ways you can help out:

  • Spread the word, and share the links with your friends and family.

  • Share this campaign with others via social media, email, or good old word of mouth

  • Follow me at @serpush (Instagram) or @saraserpa on Facebook!

I am truly grateful for your support and can't wait to have this album ready to share with everyone.

story:
Get Aug. 16 or Aug. 17 tickets at the door.



Or call 253.845.6880 or 253.874.8400



Experience Church 10012 122nd St. E., Puyallup, WA 98373


I'm coming to the Seattle/Tacoma area and need your help presenting a great concert with a band and special guests Bob Carlisle, Yvette Williams and Tony Hooper (Blues Counsel) at 7:00 pm on August 17 at ExerienceChurch.tv in Puyallup, WA. Seating is very limited, so don't miss out. Read more about my special guest artists and hear their music here.

Join me and share the pre-concert VIP Experience.

Here's something else exciting...I'm planning to do an audio and video recording of the event! So, don't miss your chance to be there!

I'd love for you to be there with your family and friends. Please share this page and choose the perk you want, including concert tickets, a VIP experience, my new album, the new Sweet Comfort Band CD and more. Each perk has details on how and when you'll receive it. You can even suggest a custom-designed perk.---->

I've got a new album called Conversations (listen here), featuring the song I See You, that you can get now. You'll receive extra songs (for a total of 21 on the download), bonus features and better quality audio. Why should you get the album now? See my video about this album. Watch new music videos here and videos of some of my classic songs from past albums here.

I'm thrilled with this album and want to make sure it gets heard. I've learned the hard way that if you don't promote an album well, very few people even learn that it is available. But it takes money to promote an album well. It costs thousands of dollars to do publicity or send songs to just one radio format, for instance. Here what backers like you have helped me accomplish so far and what I'm hoping to do next at radio. There's a great team excited about helping me make sure this album gets noticed but I've had to turn many of them down because I can't afford them. 

That's where you come in. You could look for the album in stores but you'll get fewer songs, none of the extras and you won't get the higher quality audio files that are included in the downloads here. Here's why this model works better and is essential to my getting to interact with you more and to my ability to continue to record.

I’ve got some great rewards for individuals, churches and charities -- something for everyone. Each one has a different delivery date so you'll know when you should receive it. Check them out over there. -->

You can also invite me to your town - for a Conversation or a concert. You’ll find the details–yep, you guessed it–right over there. -->

Click a "Claim This Perk" button to see more information about ordering it, delivery dates, etc. If you pay by credit card, Indiegogo doesn't complete the transaction until several days after the campaign ends, so your delivery date is after that. If you use PayPal, the delivery date will be earlier than the one posted. 

Thanks again for your interest in my music.  Please share this page with your friends... choose the cool stuff you want... and check out some of the songs on my Conversations album.

Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations.

I look forward to connecting with you and learning what you think about these songs on social media like Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Kondoot, ReverbNation, Stageit, MySpace and Pinterest. 

P.S. I am also a founding member of the Sweet Comfort Band. We have a new album called The Waiting Is Over and you can get a copy, which I'll autograph, here too.

FAQ

How can I buy the Conversations album and/or the Conversations video?

I'm offering the album and video through this Indiegogo campaign right now. A shorter version of the album, with fewer songs and none of the bonus features, will be available through other channels. Indiegogo allows you to use a credit card or your PayPal account.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

All perks except for digital downloads will be available for you to pick up at Experience Church on Saturday, August 10. If your perk includes a download, you'll get that after I receive payment from Indiegogo. PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. 

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.

How can I help with this campaign?

There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?
You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.
Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?
All perks except for digital downloads will be available for you to pick up at Experience Church on Saturday, August 10. If your perk includes a download, you'll get that after I receive payment from Indiegogo. PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. 
What happens if you don't reach your goal?
You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.
How can I help with this campaign?
There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).
What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?
Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page.

story:
HELP GET LEF STUDIOS UP AND RUNNING WHILE THEIR SON IS VERY ILL

Uden - My brother Lars and his fiancée have been building a dream, their recording facility in the south of the Netherlands, for a few years now. Using state of the art building constructions and materials, working like nuts and devoting all of their spare time, money and creativity, to build a studio, that produces the best possible sound.

While reaching the end of that project, their 5 year old son got diagnosed with leukaemia a few weeks back. Now, instead of finishing the studio, their son and his family are facing at least 2 years of intensive chemo and time consuming hospital visits.

They used all of their time and money on building and buying materials. Now, that money goes to fuel for the time-consuming trips to from the hospital, and meals and sleepovers while staying with their son. They are stuck. I would like to see them get out of that impasse - with your help.

Without the illness of their second son, my brother would have continued to build up their dream studio, being a very creative builder to say the least, in a steady pass.  Now, with the costs (in time and money) going into travelling and residing at the hospital several times (including nights)  a week, the studio needs to open up as soon as possible.

Update: We just made national radio, for those of you that understand dutch, start listening around the 27th minute. http://www.npo.nl/de-staat-van-stasse/24-10-201... 

What We Need & What You Get

In short: They need help. But that help unfortunately comes with a price tag (which was the main reason they took on the build of the project themselves). What they need, is funding for materials and the possibility of hiring a professional building crew.

Your donation will make it possible for them to finish the studio, get it up and running, and provide their family a normal continuation of their lives, as much as achievable.

They need at least €50.000. There is no beating around the bush. It is a lot of money, that will be spent on the following:
 
  • Building materials for finishing the recording hall and glass for the secluded sound booths for vocals, drums & and piano
  • Floor work throughout the building
  • Plaster on every wall
  • Paint on all that is unpainted
  • A front door that actually opens and closes without having to twist your arm
  • Getting the extra rooms ready, for musicians to stay overnight during recording sessions
  • And last but not least: certified construction workers to help realize all of the above.
If we don’t reach this goal, funding that we have received before the end of this campaign, will be spent in order of the list above, minus the amount Indiegogo asks for this campaign. Of course, if we do reach the goal and the studio gets running, we will donate part of the profits to an organisation for children with cancer, i.e. KiKa or Clini Clowns.

Please note: The money raised will NOT be used for recording equipment, they saved up for those before and therefore already own all the required professional studio equipment. This was necessary to start generating some income by mixing and mastering.

Quotes  

Known artists have already visited the location. They were heavily impressed with the possibilities and the sound of the studio, and all expressed their intention to record at LEF when it will be finished.

Arjen de Vreede (dj DNA): ‘The vinyl version of my latest single with Kurtis Blow was mixed at LEF, the studio is one of the kind that you just have to visit once to understand that you want to come back and record.This studio was built by someone with an extremely high understanding of what it takes to make a creative environment, technically and vibe-wise.Me and Kytopia engineer Sam Jones are looking forward to future projects to work on at the LEF studio.’ www.djdna.net
Kay, directeur DandA Design & Authoring: ‘Lars is an extraordinary sound specialist. Several months ago I visited his new studio, what I saw and heard acoustically knows no equal. ' www.DandA.nl 

Altin: ‘From the start I was impressed with his studio plans, I was there recently, even though it was not finished yet, I was impressed by all of the possibilities.’ www.altin.nl

Alexander van der Zouwen, engineer: ‘LEF is a studio with remarkable acoustic results. The smart design and routing of all available equipment, makes working there very comfortable. No more patch cables, everything can be arranged through the mixer (even the outboard fx), a must for every engineer.’

The Impact

With your help, the complete studio could be up and running in +/- 8 months. The Netherlands gain a high end studio, my brother can start making money for the expenses made for their son, & the most important part: their son can get all of their time in the coming years of treatment, which is, if you ask me, the best perk there is.
   
On the other hand, contributors can choose a variety of amounts and perks. Donating will for instance make your first recorded album a fact. Or, would you rather have your company record a fab Christmas Song? All can be arranged. Check out the perks to find out how donating can make this worth your while too.  

My brother Lars has almost two decades of experience, being a licensed sound engineer and having been the co-owner of Studio Scala, where he recorded many artists ranging from jazz & heavy metal to classical music, and everything in between.

Also, please check http://www.gearslutz.com/board/photo-diaries-recording-studio-construction-projects/476992-lef-studio-scala-building-new-recording-facility.html  and his Facebook page for all kinds of technical gadgets and stuff I can’t begin to explain, to understand the magnitude of their project. 

Please note: If you are not able to use the payment method provided, you can also contribute directly on the studios bank account number that will be active starting tomorrow, the 25th of october:

LEF v.o.f., NL24 RABO 0130 9222 69 (BIC RABONL2U)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to make a donation, you can help a lot by spreading this campaign to other people that might. That would be a great contribution as well. You can easily use the Indiegogo share tools provided. Tell your friends! And LIKE us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/lefstudios 

The Perks

Prices are suggestions, you can contribute any amount you want for any Perk, as long as you meet the minimum requirement.  Also, LEF will randomly pick a winner out of all contributors above €50, to win a full recording day as well, when the opening of LEF is a fact!

story:
Hi, my name is Ken Kutsch and I manage House of Hats and Carrie Tree. From 1980-95, I managed bands with contracts with EMI and Island Records and then stopped it all to do international social development work for fifteen years with various United Nations agencies and international NGOs. Since moving to Brighton, England in January 2013, I have entered the music business again and am happily developing these two emerging alternative folk acts - House of Hats (http://www.houseofhatsmusic.com/) and Carrie Tree (http://carrietree.co.uk/).

Both bands are doing their first UK tour in February 2014. The tour will visit 20 cities over four weeks. This will not be a luxury tour by any means with tour bus, 5 star hotels, etc. but it still is very expensive to tour - especially when you are an emerging talent and most of your live performance fees are minimal. We need to cover transportation, petrol, accommodation for eight people, per diems and booking agency fees.

In the music business, touring, getting covered in the press and getting radio play are all strongly linked. Radio stations want to know that you are touring in order for them to start playing you - journalists want to know that you are touring for them to start reviewing you. Doing this tour is so important for both bands because it will be the key link to starting to get national and regional press coverage and radio play! They already have been getting great attention from the press here in Brighton due to their strong live shows and I am convinced that they will generate the same interest if they tour the UK. Even the BBC has recently invited both bands to perform on radio shows due to the buzz they have created in Brighton!

So we need £19,500 to cover the costs of eight musicians on the road for one month, covering the length of the United Kingdom. We are offering some great perks that range from pre-release digital albums, signed set lists from the tour, your name personally thanked in the album credits AND your own song recorded for you on Youtube in a 40 minute private concert by both band beamed into your living room via wide angle, HD Skype webcam!

If we don't reach our goal, we will use what we get to go out on tour anyhow - we just might have to eat less, do eight to a hotel room instead of four and maybe run out of petrol a few times! In all seriousness, if we don't reach our goal, then we will shorten the tour according to the budget that we receive and do a shorter tour of a few of the biggest cities. And, you will still get your relevant perk that you qualified for!

Just last week we received interest from promoters in New York and Los Angeles to bring both bands to the States. This UK tour will only help those prospects because of the story that will unfold through press reviews and radio play. You will have not only helped us tour the UK but will be helping us get our foot into the door of America as well. In addition, whenever anyone experiences House of Hats or Carrie Tree they describe their live shows with ''a real feel-good experience'' and ''I feel like I have just been hugged by the band''. This is what their music brings to the public who get to experience them live. This is good for the world...

Lastly, we know that times are hard around this planet at the moment. If you like the sound of this project but just don't have any extra cash now, we understand and ask you to at least please SHARE this project to others that you know by using the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks so much and big love from us all!

story:
UPDATE: Wow, we've been absolutely floored by the support we've received in reaching our goal. There are no words to fully express how much gratitude we have for each and every one of you who helped make this happen. You guys are the best, and we'll be keeping all of you in mind as we finish crafting Better Days. Thanks to you, this album is going to ROCK!

With many humble thanks,

 - No Island


Hey everyone!

We’re No Island, a five-piece indie rock band from Vancouver. We play what you might call Modern Vintage Rock music — original songs that embrace the past while keeping an eye on the future. We’d really love for you to hear exactly what that sounds like, but we have one small problem:

Our previous releases don’t sound like us anymore. In fact, they don’t even have all of us on them. 

We’re currently in the process of recording a full-length CD of all new material, but we’ve hit a financial roadblock. In order to get this music to your ears in the near future, we’re asking you to consider pre-ordering your copy today. And if you’re feeling extra generous, we’ve set up some great perks and rewards for contributions that go above and beyond the cost of the CD itself. It’s that kind of support that will ultimately take these songs from a recording studio in Langley, BC to a finished CD you can enjoy later this year (estimated release date: Fall 2014).

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

This is a very expensive process that is already well underway, and we’re determined to do it right. The amount we’re looking to raise will cover a variety of things — first and foremost all of our remaining studio and production costs. Additional funds will be allocated for the equally important elements of artwork, printing, packaging, and promotion. And if we exceed our $8000 goal, we’ll even be able to consider additional projects such as music videos, extended touring, and producing additional album merchandise such as vinyl printings and t-shirts!

WHAT YOU GET

To show our gratitude for your support, we want to give back to you in all the best ways we know how. This is a pre-order campaign after all, so every contribution of $10 or higher will get you a copy of our new album on CD and digital download. For those who contribute more, we’re throwing open the doors and inviting you in to experience every aspect of life as a No Islander. Perks include getting the album ahead of its official release date, exclusive bonus tracks and unseen content, and even hanging out with us for a van ride, dinner, or a private concert. Check out the many rewards listed on the right side of this page — we’re confident you’ll find something you like! *See "Perks Details and Disclaimers" below.*

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If money is tight for you (it is for us, after all), the best way you can help us is by spreading the word. The bigger the crowd, the better we can crowdfund. Share this page with your friends, have them check out our music, and make sure they don't miss out on this chance to help make some incredible Canadian music happen.

LET'S DO THIS

Over the past 14 months we’ve done lots of things — we’ve solidified the perfect lineup of musicians for this band, we’ve toured Canada successfully in our van, and we’ve written many great new songs. The logical next step is to record this music and share it with you. Ever since we played our first notes as No Island back in 2009, we’ve always been a do-it-yourself kind of band. Asking for help isn’t easy, but this project has become bigger than five young men and their savings accounts. We need your involvement to make it happen. Please pre-order, contribute, and help spread the word by sharing this link with your fellow music lovers. It would mean the world to us!

Love,

No Island
(Max Ley / Keith Sinclair / James Martin / Andy Rice / Jay Esplana)

Have questions? Want to make us an offer?  Email the band here.


*DETAILS AND DISCLAIMERS*

Option: Digital Album Only

If you're not a fan of CDs and only want a digital copy of the album, simply write "NO CD PLEASE" in the address field of the shipping information. This will save us time and money on unnecessary shipping. If you still want to receive any of the other physical perks you've earned, contact us and we can make arrangements.

Shipping Fees

If you reside outside of Canada, please be sure to add the additional international shipping fee mentioned in the perk description. Without this additional fee, we will not be able to deliver your CD or any other physical perks. If you elect not to add the shipping fee, your non-physical perks (including the digital album) will still be delivered.

"The CD Release Show" Perk Substitution

We recognize that opting for The CD Release Show perk is a bit of gamble for you because the show’s date has not yet been confirmed, so we’ll make you this deal: if you get this perk but are unable to attend the show once the date is announced, let us know and we’ll let you choose one of the $40 perks as a replacement.

Scheduled Perks

For any perk that involves meeting up with the band members, we will contact you by email to arrange a date. We will bend over backwards to make our schedules work with yours as best we can. However, in some cases we may not be able to oblige your first choice of date. Don't worry though, we'll work with you to pick another time that makes you happy. Also see "Limitations on Duration" below.

Limitations on Duration

No Island reserves the right to annul our obligation to any Scheduled Perk not fulfilled within 24 months of the conclusion of this Indiegogo campaign. We will make a good-faith effort to satisfy all perks as soon as reasonably possible, and two years should be more than enough time for that. Really all we're saying is that if we don't hear back from you about the details, don't come calling 20 years later saying we still owe you a ride in the van.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Introduce yourself and your background.
Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?


What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.



The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
Make it real for people and build trust.



Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
NECROPTIC ENGORGEMENT needs your help! We have the opportunity to go on tour with Sacrificial Slaughter. We can't afford to fund the whole thing ourselves, traveling, food and merch expenses are a bitch, but if we could get some help from our friends and fans we will make it worth your while! 

We are an unsigned local death metal band from Orange County new york and have been together for roughly 3 years. We play non stopped local and out of state shows. We intend to keep death alive and would love if you would be there with us! Anyone who helps out in any way will be mentioned in out debut release!

story:
Short Summary

I need your help not only to record and make this album special, but to be able to promote it so that it can compete in the market against the signed artists with labels spending hundreds of thousands of dollars on promotion!
It's VERY tough to get noticed as an independent artist but with a smart promo plan and your support, we can make it happen!
I need your help.
Please spread the word!!!
 

If you're reading this, chances are you already know who I am. If not, let me introduce myself. My name is Emanuela Bellezza, I'm originally from San Remo, Italy. I moved to the US in 2007 to pursue my musical career.

I attended Musicinas Institute in Hollywood, CA and soon after graduation I started teaching voice as substitute teacher. 

 I also teach voice, piano and guitar to little kids starting form age 2. I really enjoy working with kids and seeing up close how the music seed grows in them. It is really a blessing to be able to experience those magical moments.

I write my songs in Spanish, English and of course Italian (my native language). I write about life, love, happiness, sadness, etc... in other words, anything that sparks an emotion in my soul. 

 Last year I had the incredible opportunity of singing with 17 latin Grammy winner Juanes, for his MTV Unplugged. This was an amazing experince. The song we recorded was "Fotografía".

During the tapings of Juane's Mtv Unplugged, I met producer/engineer Gustavo Borner. A couple of months after the Unplugged, we met up and started talking about working together and recording new music. 

That brings me to the point where I am at right now. So far I have recorded 4 songs for the upcoming album (Produced by Gustavo Borner). I have 6-7 more songs to record. After the music part is done, I plan on starting marketing and promoting my new album and of course playing live.

 

What I need & what you get 

 

I need your help to make this happen. Your contribution can be anything form $1 to $10,000. The truth is that every single dollar makes a big difference towards reaching this goal. There are many cool rewards that I have put together :)

 

Where your money is going

Recording the rest of the songs

Mixing 

Mastering

Promotional Campaign

Professional Photosoot

Artwork and Design

1,000 copies of the album

If I raise more than expected the rest of the money will be used to pay for a music video for the first single "Ella Se Va" 

Other Ways You Can Help

By sharing this video with your family, friends and in your social media networks, such as Facebook and Twitter.

 

Thank you

story:
Get Aug. 16 or Aug. 17 tickets at the door. Or call 253.845.6880 or 253.874.8400

Experience Church 10012 122nd St. E., Puyallup, WA 98373

I'm coming to the Seattle/Tacoma area and need your help presenting a great concert with a band and special guests Bob Carlisle, Yvette C. Williams and Tony Hooper (Blues Counsel) at 7:00 pm on August 16 and August 17 at ExerienceChurch.tv in Puyallup, WA. Seating is very limited, so don't miss out. Read more about my special guest artists and hear their music here.

Join me and share the pre-concert VIP Experience.

Here's something else exciting...I'm planning to do an audio and video recording of the event! So, don't miss your chance to be there!

I'd love for you to be there with your family and friends. Please share this page and choose the perk you want, including concert tickets, a VIP experience, my new album, the new Sweet Comfort Band CD and more. Each perk has details on how and when you'll receive it. You can even suggest a custom-designed perk.---->

I've got a new album called Conversations (listen here), featuring the song I See You, that you can get now. You'll receive extra songs (for a total of 21 on the download), bonus features and better quality audio. Why should you get the album now? See my video about this album. Watch new music videos here and videos of some of my classic songs from past albums here.

I'm thrilled with this album and want to make sure it gets heard. I've learned the hard way that if you don't promote an album well, very few people even learn that it is available. But it takes money to promote an album well. It costs thousands of dollars to do publicity or send songs to just one radio format, for instance. Here what backers like you have helped me accomplish so far and what I'm hoping to do next at radio. There's a great team excited about helping me make sure this album gets noticed but I've had to turn many of them down because I can't afford them. 

That's where you come in. You could look for the album in stores but you'll get fewer songs, none of the extras and you won't get the higher quality audio files that are included in the downloads here. Here's why this model works better and is essential to my getting to interact with you more and to my ability to continue to record.

I’ve got some great rewards for individuals, churches and charities -- something for everyone. Each one has a different delivery date so you'll know when you should receive it. Check them out over there. -->

You can also invite me to your town - for a Conversation or a concert. You’ll find the details–yep, you guessed it–right over there. -->

Click a "Claim This Perk" button to see more information about ordering it, delivery dates, etc. If you pay by credit card, Indiegogo doesn't complete the transaction until several days after the campaign ends, so your delivery date is after that. If you use PayPal, the delivery date will be earlier than the one posted. 

Thanks again for your interest in my music.  Please share this page with your friends... choose the cool stuff you want... and check out some of the songs on my Conversations album. 

Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations.

I look forward to connecting with you and learning what you think about these songs on social media like Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Kondoot, ReverbNation, Stageit, MySpace and Pinterest. 

P.S. I am also a founding member of the Sweet Comfort Band. We have a new album called The Waiting Is Over and you can get a copy, which I'll autograph, here too.

FAQ

How can I buy the Conversations album and/or the Conversations video?

I'm offering the album and video through this Indiegogo campaign right now. A shorter version of the album, with fewer songs and none of the bonus features, will be available through other channels. Indiegogo allows you to use a credit card or your PayPal account.

Can I give the album or other perks to my friends?

You betcha! Indiegogo allows you specify who you want the perk sent to and indicate that it is a gift. You can even include a note for the recipient of your gift.

Can you tell me more about the estimated delivery dates?

All perks except for digital downloads will be available for you to pick up at Experience Church on Saturday, August 10. If your perk includes a download, you'll get that after I receive payment from Indiegogo. PayPal payments happen fairly quickly but credit card payments aren't processed until several business days after the campaign closes. 

What happens if you don't reach your goal?

You'll still get whatever perk you've selected. I'll have to pay higher fees to Indiegogo if I don't reach the goal but you'll still get everything.

How can I help with this campaign?

There's lots you can do in addition to backing this campaign and sharing this page. Any comments you post help raise the profile of this page. Christopher Redner created a Facebook group, which you can join, to help you learn how to increase your social media impact. He'll be sharing examples of how to be more effective on the social media campaign for Conversations. You can also send Christopher a message here if you'd like to be added to my Indiegogo campaign team (see the group below).

What if I have a question that isn't answered here or want a perk that isn't offered?

Send me a message. There is a big "Send User A Message" button on my Indiegogo profile page.

story:
Short Summary

I am a musician and music producer. Club ABsurd is a project I
've been working on for quite a while. All tracks are recorded and I am in the final stages of mixing a full length album. With your support I plan to finish the music, manufacture CD's and release the music digitally online.

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise $1,000. This will cover out-of-pocket expenses related to mastering the msuic and manufacturing a short run of CDs.

The Impact

Listen to the music. The story is self-evident. The production value is good. I think you'll agree that the vocal talent, musicianship and overall quality of the work merits completion and release.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the project then please pass the word along!

story:
Who are we and what are we doing?

We are Post Mortem Delirium, a  Horror Punk band from the Gulf Coast city of Mobile, AL, comprised of three members: Andy Scott, Drums; Kevin "Buzz" Olsen, Bass and backing vocals; Jesse Bones, Guitars and vocals. We all have one goal, to take this project another step forward and record a quality album we can be proud to share with you, the fans!

The idea for this band started some years ago and finally began to come to fruition in the Summer of 2013 with current members Jesse and Buzz as part of the founding line-up. Several line-up changes in the first year and a half set back any sort of studio sessions which would have occurred. With the recent addition of Andy on drums,  we are now fully equipped to record our first album.



Why is your help needed? 

With just two days to go before we take to the studio and just a few days of funds to get us started, we are needing to raise extra funds to help us finish the album and to press and master the album.

$2,500 dollars is what we need to bring everything to light. This money will fulfill the cost of extra studio time to finish recording, the cost of mastering and pressing the album, along with miscellaneous expenses that come with completing this campaign.

We want to give you something tangible with our perks and things that can create memories. We're not exactly looking for handouts here. We want to give back to those who are willing to go to bat for us and our cause!



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

And we understand that! If you are unable to contribute there are other ways you can help! Share the URL for this campaign to any of the social media outlets that are available at your fingertips. Share our facebook page and posts, as we will be posting updates from the studio. Invite people to "like" our Facebook page                   ( www,facebook.com/postmortemdelirium ). We appreciate anything you can do to help us!

story:
Revelation of Form

When I look at a photograph, if just for a moment, I believe I can understand what the artist felt when he or she captured it.  This is one of the inspirations for this project. There is so much natural beauty that is constantly changing and evolving, and I believe it is my time to capture it and share it with the world.  This adventure will take us to 13 National Parks; we will see lakes, rivers, mountains, a rainforest, deserts, sand dunes, and so much more.  It's not to say this hasn’t been done before, but not by me, and I hope to bring my own creative edge to this subject matter.  

 

There are many goals for a project of this magnitude.   First, I hope to create a photography book using images from our travels to expose the beauty of these National Parks.  I will also be creating a Time Lapse Video using video from all the parks.  Additionally,  I will be exploring Infrared (IR) technology with a dedicated IR converted camera.  This will hopefully create a large and diverse body of work.  

 

Another goal is to further illuminate the effects we are having on the environment and the delicate ecosystem of the National Parks.  Preservation of Scenery is a goal of the National Park Services, and has been since Yellowstone became the first National Park in 1872.  However, when the goal is to preserve the scenery for tourists, there is an effect on the ecosystem.  The scenery, or facade, of most of these parks will not be the same in 50 years.  If I am able to capture the beauty of the scenery as it is now, just maybe we can help facilitate the preservation of our amazing National Parks System.  

 

Trip Logistics and the history of Jay Scott Photography

This project has been a dream of mine since I was a child. With your help I can achieve my dream and share this amazing world with you.   The trip will cover 13 National Parks, almost 9000 miles, and countless other adventures on the way.  We will be leaving from Columbus, Ohio around August 31, 2013.  We will be traveling via SUV, camping all along the way.  We plan to return around November 20, 2013.  My assistant and girlfriend, Sarah Butke, will be along to assist, plan, and document the trip using Twitter, Facebook and journals.  Below is our current trip map. 

 

1.  Yellowstone National Park

10.  Las Vegas, Nevada

2.  Glacier National Park

11.  Grand Canyon National Park

3.  Olympic National Park

12.  Antelope Canyons

4.  Mount Rainier

13.  Whitehouse Ruins

5.  Astoria, Oregon

14.  Zion National Park

6.  Yosemite National Park

15.  Bryce Canyon National Park

7.  Sequoia National Park

16.  Arches National Park

8.  Joshua Tree National Park

17.  Rattlesnake Canyon

9.  Death Valley National Park

18.  Great Sand Dunes National Park

 

Photography has interested me as a creative medium for as long as I can remember.  I have always strived to show people how I see the world through my photographs.  I studied film photography at Brookdale College, and then moved on to lighting design at Purchase College.  I pursued a career in Lighting Design working in theatre, dance, TV, Film, and concerts.  I had the honor of working on the Olympics twice, presidential campaigns and debates, a Broadway show, countless off Broadway productions, and even more TV shows.  Working in lighting has made me a stronger photographer.  I have made the decision to change career paths and focus solely on being behind the camera. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Traveling and gear is expensive.  This project will be funded personally and publicly with your help.  Our goal of $7,500 is not the entirety of the funds needed, but will be a great help in not being in a mound of debt after the trip.

Here is a breakdown of what $7,500 can cover:

Photography Equipment

  • $1550 (with trade in) Canon 5d Mark III
  • $750 Canon 50d converted for IR Photography
  • $700 Dolly Rig for Time Lapse Photography 
  • $400 2 MeFOTO tripods for Dolly Rig

 

Camping Equipment

  • $900 camping gear 
  • $250 first aid/survival gear
  • $450 Deuter backpacks for backcountry camping
  • $2500 gas budget

 

We have some amazing perks for you when you donate today.  Don’t miss out on one-of-a-kind photographs, and some amazing gifts for yourself or a loved one.  Almost all can be delivered by the holidays 2013, so get your shopping done now!

 

The Impact

In a blink it will all be gone.  Our impact on the environment, especially in this country, will decimate some of these natural wonders.  I hope by showing their true beauty we can raise awareness about our environmental impact and the impact our government can have by protecting our national parks.  We have been inspired by reading the history of these parks, and how the government was able to protect our national wonders.  Trail Blazers like John Muir, Theodore Roosevelt, and Stephen Mather helped create the very idea of a national park system so that generations could enjoy their beauty.  We have an obligation to carry on their legacy and I can use photography to help achieve that.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot donate today, please follow us on Facebook at Jay Scott Photography, check out the website jayscottphotography.com, and check back for more information about our travel blog!

Also, it would be incredibly helpful if you could share this campaign on your Facebook or Twitter account #revelationofform, or even email someone you think would be interested!  

Every little bit helps, and thanks for reading about our campaign and our adventure.
