Trip Logistics and the history of Jay Scott Photography
This project has been a dream of mine since I was a child. With your help I can achieve my dream and share this amazing world with you.   The trip will cover 13 National Parks, almost 9000 miles, and countless other adventures on the way.  We will be leaving from Columbus, Ohio around August 31, 2013.  We will be traveling via SUV, camping all along the way.  We plan to return around November 20, 2013.  My assistant and girlfriend, Sarah Butke, will be along to assist, plan, and document the trip using Twitter, Facebook and journals.  Below is our current trip map. 
 



1.  Yellowstone National Park


10.  Las Vegas, Nevada




2.  Glacier National Park


11.  Grand Canyon National Park




3.  Olympic National Park


12.  Antelope Canyons




4.  Mount Rainier


13.  Whitehouse Ruins




5.  Astoria, Oregon


14.  Zion National Park




6.  Yosemite National Park


15.  Bryce Canyon National Park




7.  Sequoia National Park


16.  Arches National Park




8.  Joshua Tree National Park


17.  Rattlesnake Canyon




9.  Death Valley National Park


18.  Great Sand Dunes National Park



 
Photography has interested me as a creative medium for as long as I can remember.  I have always strived to show people how I see the world through my photographs.  I studied film photography at Brookdale College, and then moved on to lighting design at Purchase College.  I pursued a career in Lighting Design working in theatre, dance, TV, Film, and concerts.  I had the honor of working on the Olympics twice, presidential campaigns and debates, a Broadway show, countless off Broadway productions, and even more TV shows.  Working in lighting has made me a stronger photographer.  I have made the decision to change career paths and focus solely on being behind the camera. 
 
What We Need & What You Get
Traveling and gear is expensive.  This project will be funded personally and publicly with your help.  Our goal of $7,500 is not the entirety of the funds needed, but will be a great help in not being in a mound of debt after the trip.
Here is a breakdown of what $7,500 can cover:
Photography Equipment

$1550 (with trade in) Canon 5d Mark III
$750 Canon 50d converted for IR Photography
$700 Dolly Rig for Time Lapse Photography 
$400 2 MeFOTO tripods for Dolly Rig

 
Camping Equipment

$900 camping gear 
$250 first aid/survival gear
$450 Deuter backpacks for backcountry camping
$2500 gas budget

 
We have some amazing perks for you when you donate today.  Don’t miss out on one-of-a-kind photographs, and some amazing gifts for yourself or a loved one.  Almost all can be delivered by the holidays 2013, so get your shopping done now!
 
The Impact
In a blink it will all be gone.  Our impact on the environment, especially in this country, will decimate some of these natural wonders.  I hope by showing their true beauty we can raise awareness about our environmental impact and the impact our government can have by protecting our national parks.  We have been inspired by reading the history of these parks, and how the government was able to protect our national wonders.  Trail Blazers like John Muir, Theodore Roosevelt, and Stephen Mather helped create the very idea of a national park system so that generations could enjoy their beauty.  We have an obligation to carry on their legacy and I can use photography to help achieve that.  
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you cannot donate today, please follow us on Facebook at Jay Scott Photography, check out the website jayscottphotography.com, and check back for more information about our travel blog!
Also, it would be incredibly helpful if you could share this campaign on your Facebook or Twitter account #revelationofform, or even email someone you think would be interested!  
Every little bit helps, and thanks for reading about our campaign and our adventure.

story:
About the Choir:

  Selah Gospel Choir is an all inclusive community gospel choir that needs your support to continue sharing the art of traditional and contemporary gospel music!  

Who we are:

  Selah Gospel Choir was formed in 2007 by two individuals who had a vision for a multi-cultural, multi-generational, interfaith group of vocalists sharing a passion for gospel music. Selah has now grown in spirit and in number to 40 members from all over the Los Angeles area. Circling around central values such as love, diversity and community, SGC demonstrates these values as they sing for a purpose greater than themselves.  This vibrant, fun, and challenging ensemble strives to remain true and authentic to the traditional and contemporary gospel form of music.  

Enough of what we think, read the concert reviews from the community who we continue to touch and inspire:  

- "fervent and poignant, emotive and bewitching" 

-"This group is uplifting, harmonious, and inspirational. That BIG sound they produce envelops the whole room. Selah Gospel Choir is colorful and beautifully enjoying the music they make together. They transported me to a sweet bliss."

-"That choir had me dancing in the aisles!"

 - "...those 2 hours were totally uplifting and like a vacation for my soul." 

  Why we need your support:

  Each year, Selah Gospel Choir performs Spring and Fall concerts to bring hope and encouragement to the community. In order to continue making music and sharing our voices, our choir needs to raise $5000. The Altos hope to raise $2500 through your support and donations and the additional $2500 through other fundraising efforts. Your money will directly affect our dire financial situation and help pay the for rehearsal space, performance venues, union wages for musicians for the concert and our publicity. This money will also go into a prudent reserve to prevent our organization from going into debt.   If we do not reach our goal, we will unfortunately no longer be able to continue as Selah Gospel Choir thus making our Spring 2013 concert our final season. Any money that is donated will still be used to to cover the expenses of our Spring performance. Therefore, we are asking for your support now more than ever! Please know that any support you can offer will go a long way toward changing the lives of others through music--  You'll also get some great perks for your contribution! 

  Other Ways You Can Help:

  If you are unable to give financially, that's okay! You can still help by promoting and sharing our IndieGoGo fundraising link with your social network/friends and encourage them to do the same.

Please also "like" us on Facebook at the "Selah Gospel Choir Official" page!    Oh, and come to our shows on May 18th & 19th!  

With all our love and appreciation, the Altos of  Selah Gospel Choir

story:
What’s up Guys! We are A Breathless September a pop/punk band based out of Pittsburgh, PA. We started this group less than 2 years ago in the summer of 2011. It started with Leo and Brandon and eventually we got Eric and Everett after a few lineup changes. Soon after forming A Breathless September we managed to write and record a 6-Track EP titled “Affinity For Asphyxiation”.  We also released a single titled “Cry Wolf” late last year. The past year as a band has been a great year, we have played numerous shows with National Touring Acts after building a relationship with Concert Chaos, and we have also met a lot of great people and musicians along the way. 

Why did we start this campaign ?

Well this campaign was created to help fund the recording and production of our new full length CD. Shortly after we released our single “Cry Wolf” we shot it out to a bunch of different record labels.  We soon got a response from a well-recognized label. We were all very excited after receiving this email. After some discussing and emailing back a forth we were offered a deal that we couldn’t turn down.  We have been scoping out different studios for a good while now in hopes to record our full length album and to have the opportunity to record and produce it with a well-recognized professional studio is just an awesome opportunity that no band could turn down. This is a big step for us to be able to record and release a full length album with a professional label and we are hoping that by doing this it may lead to bigger and better things.

We hope by you guys reading this you might want to help contribute and we appreciate any initiative you take to help us reach our goal whether it is spreading the word by telling your friends or donating to our fund. We appreciate your support to the fullest! Your contributions in helping us reach our goal will give us the opportunity to make an awesome Full Length Album for our fans and also get some awesome prizes in return for your donations!  

 

We are asking for help in raising a total of $4,500. This will cover all the costs of the Producer, the mixing/mastering, and any additional fees we might have while we are out of state for 2 weeks.  The normal cost to record a full length CD at a professional studio can be anywhere from $7,000 to $20,000 so we are getting an amazing deal on our part. We also have some pretty awesome perks for each contribution you make to our fund. Some perks you may receive for donating: Free CD’s , T-Shirts, Digital Downloads, Free shows for 1 year, a feature in our next music video,  special thanks in our CD, house show, and a snare drum and guitar used in the recording of our full length will be some of the many prizes you can receive in return for your donations !!

In the situation of us not reaching our goal if this were to happen we would still use all the funds raised to the recording of our Full Length CD. This might make our time of recording later which could set us back a bit but no matter what we plan on recording our New CD and getting it out to you guys as quick as possible and any contribution you guys make just make us that much closer to making this happen!

After reaching our goal and completing the recording of our next CD we will have a ton of new merch and music to get out to you guys whether it be at shows or by you obtaining our stuff online. We hope that our new record will gain us a lot more exposure in the music scene. We spent a lot of days and nights writing and writing hoping to get to this point and we are finally there. We really think you guys will like our new stuff. It’s a lot more in your face and hard hitting then the last CD we released and we know you guys will really enjoy it.  This is an awesome opportunity for our fans to be a part of something big. We want you guys to feel like you are a part of ABS and we love all the support we have gotten over the past 2 years. 

If you took the time to check out our fundraiser please help by sharing on facebook, twitter, or any means to get the word out and have our fundraiser known. The more people that are aware the greater chance we have of reaching our goal.

We can’t express how much your support means to us. Stay updated on our progress through some of the links below !

story:
Our Elvis Presley Bottle Rocks... Help Us Rock The World!

What’s Up with the Guitar Bottle?

A few years ago we thought it up and since then have been designing it and refining it.  It’s done.  Our bottle is actually two highly crafted glass bottles.  Everybody loves this bottle, and everybody wants one.  We want you to have one too!

The bottles we make as pledge rewards with the funding from this campaign will all be distributed as empty decanters.  However, since we are a start-up tequila company we have designed the bottle so that we can fill it with tequila too... 

So... the bottom (guitar body part) can hold 750ml of one flavor of tequila and for the top (guitar head stock part) we put another bottle with a 50mL sample of some other tequila flavor.  The top also serves as a cork for the bottle, and can be refilled.  Again, all that said, all bottles offered here are empty and contain no alcohol.

Help Us Keep the Party Going!

We now have one of the best rock n roll related products hitting the market, but we've spent most of our money to get here.  That's why we really need you to become a Rock N Roll Founding Member and help us get our company off the ground. Get on the tour with us!  It's our dream to some day be a huge brand, and now by pledging you can play a big part in turning our dreams into that reality.

___________________________________________________________________

Who Are We?

We are a small start-up brand and for about a year we have been selling (fairly small-time) our Rock N Roll products in our distinctive guitar bottles.  We are trying to establish ourselves as a huge tequila brand recognized all over, and be a real player in our market.  We think we must be onto something too because we now have the blessings and license from Elvis Presley Enterprises (EPE) to create our Elvis bottles, boxes and tequila adorned with the King Of Rock N Roll Elvis Presley image and name.

Who is Andy?

Way back when, our company's co-owner Andy Herbst used to help out in the promotion of concerts (even legends like Jimi Hendrix, The Doors and the Eagles) and ever since Andy has been involved in some way with rock bands, concerts or recording music.  Whether he was pushing the broom, tearing tickets at the door or organizing the whole damn event, he was totally loving it.  Even though he can't sing a note, Andy actually has a great ear for rock music.  We could go on and on about how much we like him, or how nice and humble and generous he is, and all the amazing things he's done in his life, or all the people he knows.  But trust us...  Andy is the perfect person to make this company successful.  Anyone that knows him will agree.

Who is Keith?

Keith Impink is the starving artist guy behind the look and feel of everything we do.  Keith designed our bottle, our boxes and all our logos and labels. He’s an artist, musician, songwriter type, but is probably best known for all the rock posters and art he has designed for rocker legends like Bob Dylan, Neil Young, Lynyrd Skynyrd, the Goo Goo Dolls, Jackson Brown, Bonnie Raitt and tons of others.  He probably made next to nothing from all that work, but he has been on the fringes of rock n roll promotion for decades which is good for us!  Keith also does our posters, ads, promotional materials, the Elvis art and he handles our web stuff too. He even created most of this page.  View his portfolio here at impink.com.

We don't have any employees, but we do have friends helping us out like Jose.  Jose is our master distiller and he has a factory in Mexico ready to make our  tequila, and he handles most of the customs and border stuff too.  So here's a shout-out thanks to Jose, Dennis, Mandy, Gordon, Jay C, Mark, Bret, Tom, Justin, Bob, Bob L., our friends, family, everyone who posed with our bottle, and all of you who helped us make our video... kudos!

___________________________________________________________________

What Are We Trying to Do?

So far, we've used our own money for the design and manufacturing of prototype bottles and packaging.  It's cost us just about everything to cover the development, licensing, designs, website and tons of legal stuff just to get to this point.  We did it though wholeheartedly because we really believe in our Rock N Roll products.  And we know we have a rock solid plan.  And you are a major part of our plan.  We're ready to rock, are you ready to roll?  See us on Elvis.com.

Our project is to have made a 40 foot truckload of Elvis Presley branded Rock N Roll decanters, and of course ship it here so we can box it, case it and make ready for sales.  We flat-out don't have the money to make this happen!  That's why we need your help.

Our project also includes having empty limited edition Founding Member bottles and collectors Elvis boxes made for you.  In fact, a huge part of this project is to reward you with creative collectibles and adventures you can't buy anywhere.

___________________________________________________________________

Why Elvis?

Simply put, Elvis is the "King of Rock N Roll" and is without a doubt the most recognizable Rock N Roll icon of all time... and we love Elvis.  Are you a huge fan like we are?... Then you'll appreciate the quality of everything about our Elvis bottle. We really feel that our product showcases Elvis and honors his legacy.  Rock N Roll Tequila is a tribute to "The King".  See us on Elvis.com.

We spent a lot of time building the relationships needed to make this happen, and have put in a lot of effort to get to this point.  The folks at Elvis (EPE) and Graceland are really happy with us and have given us a green light.  We think Elvis would be proud of what we have done and think he would want you to have your own collectible Founding Members guitar bottle available here by supporting our project.

___________________________________________________________________

Do We Have Fun?

You tell us.... If we’re not participating in a party or event, you may find us on one of our many Rock N Roll Bus Tours, where we charter a big bus, crank the music and travel with our fans to rock n roll concerts.  Is this fun?  We think so.  We get to listen to the best rock music all day long, hang out with musicians, artists, DJs, promoters and all sorts of cool people.

Rock N Roll Tequila is a product that brings fun to every party we go to, and we actually have fans!  One thing we like to do for fun is sneak backstage as much as possible to show off our bottle to the bands and musicians.  Rockstars always love the bottle, and they always want to pose with it.  That's how we got these pictures here.  thanks guys:)

Oh and here is a picture of Randy Maranz posing with our bottle.  He is the radio DJ from 104 The Hawk in Modesto CA.  Randy really likes what we are doing and made us an audio recording type commercial... so give it a listen.  thanks Randy:)



Listen (MP3) to Randy Maranz talk on the air about our product.

___________________________________________________________________

We Don't Just Look Good, Our Flavors are Awesome!

All of our Tequilas are made with 100% pure agave and are available in Blanco, Mango and Coffee flavors.  With your help, we plan to dominate the mid-priced tequila market with Rock N Roll Tequila.  We're not kidding, people really like what we are doing here.  We have great taste, the coolest bottle ever made, and Elvis.

___________________________________________________________________

How Will The Money Be Spent?

We've done a lot... the designs, the patents, certification of flavors, label approvals, trademarks... and we now have the Guitar Bottle and molds... it's almost done!

•  There are pledge costs and fees associated with servicing this campaign such as the PERKS, shirts, bottles, boxes, printing, travel tickets, shipping etc.
•  We need money primarily to get a 40 foot truckload of Rock N Roll Elvis decanter bottles and Elvis boxes printed, packed and ready for shipping.
•  We also need your help to pay for essential marketing, promotion and advertising.
•  There are also fees for Indiegogo and campaign related costs.

___________________________________________________________________

Why Are We So Great?

•  We Have Music Fans.  We have a brand name closely associated with rock n roll music and it's built-in base of rock n roll fans.  Isn't this billions of people?
•  We Have Approvals.  We have utility and design patents pending on our guitar shaped bottle features in many countries.  We have labels approved by TTB and CRT for all of our flavors and in all the sizes.  We have trademarks and all that stuff too. 
•  We Have Elvis Presley.  We have a sweet licensing deal with Elvis Presley Enterprises and therefore a built-in Elvis fan base. See us on Elvis.com.

View Video Andy and Keith made on Veterans Day 2013

___________________________________________________________________

What Do The Perks Look Like?

Here is a bunch of stuff to look at.  The thing to remember is that the Founding Member rewards you get from us here, are only available here. Many of the items here are custom for our Founding Members only.  Also, don't expect to get alcohol in your pledge rewards. All the bottles are empty.

1.  Founders Membership

Founding Members are allowed access to shop our online store and will receive email updates as you'd expect.

2.  Founders Certificate & Personalized Founders Certificate

These certificates are 8.5 x 11 inches printed on high grade parchment paper.  Some pledges include a personalized certificate with a hand written thank you, by either Andy or Keith.

3.  Cocktail Menu Card

This is the Rock N Roll Tequila menu that we plan to put in restaurants and stores all over that show pictures and simples descriptions of our cocktail favorites.  This menu is printed double sided on high gloss durable cardstock, and folded in the center.  really cool.

4.  Recipe Mix Card

This menu shows the actual recipes of each drink so you can make them yourself.  This card has no pictures and is printed on high gloss heavyweight cardstock.  A collectible item.

5.  Commemorative Coaster

These coasters are full color on both sides, printed on very heavy duty coaster board stock.  Oops.. on some pledges we may throw in an extra one of these.

6.  Rock N Roll Founding Member T-Shirt

Screen printed in full color on quality shirt.  You will be able to choose either male or female style and from several sizes.  (This is an artist rendering of our proposed design and approximate garment)

7.  Embroidered Rock N Roll Founding Member Hat

Embroidered in full color on a quality black cloth adjustable hat.  (This is an artist rendering of our proposed design and approximate hat style)

8.  Rock N Roll Founding Member Hooded Sweatshirt

Screen printed full color on a quality black hoodie. (This is an artist rendering of our proposed design and approximate garment)

9.  Founding Member Bottle with Elvis Presley Labeling

This Founding Member Elvis guitar bottle is only available here during this campaign so get a cool bottle and help us out.  Some pledges offer this bottle alone, and others come with the collectors box.  (contains no alcohol).

10.  Founding Member Bottle with Elvis Labeling in Elvis Presley Box

This box is customized with a silver foil insert.  The bottle is the same as if it came without the box (see above), and has custom labels too indicating that you are a FOUNDING MEMBER.

11.  Founding Member Rock N Roll Guitar Bottle (No Box).

Here is our classic Rock N Roll bottle (decanter) except this limited edition version tells everyone who sees it that you are a proud Founding Member. (contains no alcohol)

12. Founding Member Rock N Roll Guitar Bottle in Rock N Roll Guitar Box.

13. Pit Crew Race Shirt.

These shirts are on order, and are a high quality garment, similar to what the pit crews wear at a major race. This is an artist rendering of what we propose the design will look like.

14.  Founding Member Rock N Roll Tequila Banner.

30"x42" custom Founding Member vinyl banner .  Keith prints these himself and he will sign it for you if you want.  These high quality banners are big too, about the size of a movie poster.  You can even hang it outside if you want!  (no grommets unless requested)

15.  VIP Lanyard / Backstage Pass

This exclusive VIP pass allows all-access to our site's BackStage Area and signs you up for special alert updates about upcoming events, bus tours, opportunities to meet rock stars, cool people, us, etc.

16. First Edition 13"x19" Posters.

Bob Dylan, Bonnie Raitt, Goo Goo Dolls, Buffalo Springfield (Neil Young) etc... Signed by me Keith Impink, the poster artist . Yep! I illustrated these posters in collaboration with Randy Tuten over the years and I can get him to sign these posters too.  I am offering these cool posters as a reward for your pledge. I only have about 5 or 6 posters of each design, so be first to choose which posters you want.  In most  cases, the band or performer got most of the posters for their own crew and friends... so they are very limited edition original prints.  I have done other designs too which you may prefer, such as Crosby, Stills & Nash, Bonnie Raitt, Steve Miller, Doobies etc.  Check out my portfolio and if you see a poster you prefer, email me at keith@impink.com.  here is Randy's site... Randy Tuten.

17.  Authentic Professional Race Car Drivers Suit

We love all kinds of racing!  We go to as many races as we can for the excitement.  It's a great place to show off our brand and we meet tons of people at races.  Did you see ARCA driver "Rookie of the Year" Justin Boston as he drove the #25 Rock N Roll Tequila / zLoop car at Talladega SuperSpeedway this year?  Our friends at ZLOOP Recycling & Venturini Motorsports styled us and put us on their car and it didn't cost us any money!  And they even made a custom suit that Justin wore.  Are you kidding?... we could never afford that, thank you guys!

Anyway, this custom designed Rock N Roll race suit duplicate (as seen in the picture below) will be made by IMPACT and personalized with your name - Also in tribute to Elvis Presley,  includes 1 Pair of blue racing shoes that look kinda like "Blue Suede Shoes". 

18. Two Tickets in the "V.I.P. Suite" to Watch the 2014 Sonoma NASCAR Sprint Cup Race

- Watch the NASCAR Race from the comfort of your VIP Suite which includes Friday, Saturday and Sunday
- Admission including practice, qualifying and racing
- Includes hotel accommodations
- Includes round trip airfare (within the Continental US)
- Includes either transportation to and from the SF Bay Area Airport to the track or a Bay Area rental car. (we haven't decided which yet).


___________________________________________________________________
___________________________________________________________________


“We're Ready to Rock… Are you Ready to Roll?”

Thank you for becoming a Founding Member by supporting our Elvis bottle project. See you Backstage!

VIDEO Testimonials

- YouTube Video: Rock N Roll Tequila at X-Fest California 2013 
Keith and Andy walk around showing the Elvis bottle to random people.  See how much people like our project!

- YouTube Video: Our Company Mascot Parrot Shreds on a Rock n Roll Guitar Bottle
This is a video of Ally, Keith's yellow nape amazon parrot.  enjoy!

- YouTube Video: Video of Veterans Day - 2013
Andy and Keith go to a couple events on veterans Day 2013 and thank veterans and service members for their service, patriotism and sacrifice.

story_txt:
Our Elvis Presley Bottle Rocks... Help Us Rock The World!

What’s Up with the Guitar Bottle?
A few years ago we thought it up and since then have been designing it and refining it.  It’s done.  Our bottle is actually two highly crafted glass bottles.  Everybody loves this bottle, and everybody wants one.  We want you to have one too!

The bottles we make as pledge rewards with the funding from this campaign will all be distributed as empty decanters.  However, since we are a start-up tequila company we have designed the bottle so that we can fill it with tequila too...  
So... the bottom (guitar body part) can hold 750ml of one flavor of tequila and for the top (guitar head stock part) we put another bottle with a 50mL sample of some other tequila flavor.  The top also serves as a cork for the bottle, and can be refilled.  Again, all that said, all bottles offered here are empty and contain no alcohol.

Help Us Keep the Party Going!
We now have one of the best rock n roll related products hitting the market, but we've spent most of our money to get here.  That's why we really need you to become a Rock N Roll Founding Member and help us get our company off the ground. Get on the tour with us!  It's our dream to some day be a huge brand, and now by pledging you can play a big part in turning our dreams into that reality.
___________________________________________________________________
Who Are We?
We are a small start-up brand and for about a year we have been selling (fairly small-time) our Rock N Roll products in our distinctive guitar bottles.  We are trying to establish ourselves as a huge tequila brand recognized all over, and be a real player in our market.  We think we must be onto something too because we now have the blessings and license from Elvis Presley Enterprises (EPE) to create our Elvis bottles, boxes and tequila adorned with the King Of Rock N Roll Elvis Presley image and name.
Who is Andy?
Way back when, our company's co-owner Andy Herbst used to help out in the promotion of concerts (even legends like Jimi Hendrix, The Doors and the Eagles) and ever since Andy has been involved in some way with rock bands, concerts or recording music.  Whether he was pushing the broom, tearing tickets at the door or organizing the whole damn event, he was totally loving it.  Even though he can't sing a note, Andy actually has a great ear for rock music.  We could go on and on about how much we like him, or how nice and humble and generous he is, and all the amazing things he's done in his life, or all the people he knows.  But trust us...  Andy is the perfect person to make this company successful.  Anyone that knows him will agree.
Who is Keith?
Keith Impink is the starving artist guy behind the look and feel of everything we do.  Keith designed our bottle, our boxes and all our logos and labels. He’s an artist, musician, songwriter type, but is probably best known for all the rock posters and art he has designed for rocker legends like Bob Dylan, Neil Young, Lynyrd Skynyrd, the Goo Goo Dolls, Jackson Brown, Bonnie Raitt and tons of others.  He probably made next to nothing from all that work, but he has been on the fringes of rock n roll promotion for decades which is good for us!  Keith also does our posters, ads, promotional materials, the Elvis art and he handles our web stuff too. He even created most of this page.  View his portfolio here at impink.com.
We don't have any employees, but we do have friends helping us out like Jose.  Jose is our master distiller and he has a factory in Mexico ready to make our  tequila, and he handles most of the customs and border stuff too.  So here's a shout-out thanks to Jose, Dennis, Mandy, Gordon, Jay C, Mark, Bret, Tom, Justin, Bob, Bob L., our friends, family, everyone who posed with our bottle, and all of you who helped us make our video... kudos!
___________________________________________________________________
What Are We Trying to Do?
So far, we've used our own money for the design and manufacturing of prototype bottles and packaging.  It's cost us just about everything to cover the development, licensing, designs, website and tons of legal stuff just to get to this point.  We did it though wholeheartedly because we really believe in our Rock N Roll products.  And we know we have a rock solid plan.  And you are a major part of our plan.  We're ready to rock, are you ready to roll?  See us on Elvis.com.
Our project is to have made a 40 foot truckload of Elvis Presley branded Rock N Roll decanters, and of course ship it here so we can box it, case it and make ready for sales.  We flat-out don't have the money to make this happen!  That's why we need your help.
Our project also includes having empty limited edition Founding Member bottles and collectors Elvis boxes made for you.  In fact, a huge part of this project is to reward you with creative collectibles and adventures you can't buy anywhere.

___________________________________________________________________
Why Elvis?
Simply put, Elvis is the "King of Rock N Roll" and is without a doubt the most recognizable Rock N Roll icon of all time... and we love Elvis.  Are you a huge fan like we are?... Then you'll appreciate the quality of everything about our Elvis bottle. We really feel that our product showcases Elvis and honors his legacy.  Rock N Roll Tequila is a tribute to "The King".  See us on Elvis.com.

We spent a lot of time building the relationships needed to make this happen, and have put in a lot of effort to get to this point.  The folks at Elvis (EPE) and Graceland are really happy with us and have given us a green light.  We think Elvis would be proud of what we have done and think he would want you to have your own collectible Founding Members guitar bottle available here by supporting our project.
___________________________________________________________________
Do We Have Fun?
You tell us.... If we’re not participating in a party or event, you may find us on one of our many Rock N Roll Bus Tours, where we charter a big bus, crank the music and travel with our fans to rock n roll concerts.  Is this fun?  We think so.  We get to listen to the best rock music all day long, hang out with musicians, artists, DJs, promoters and all sorts of cool people.
Rock N Roll Tequila is a product that brings fun to every party we go to, and we actually have fans!  One thing we like to do for fun is sneak backstage as much as possible to show off our bottle to the bands and musicians.  Rockstars always love the bottle, and they always want to pose with it.  That's how we got these pictures here.  thanks guys:)






Oh and here is a picture of Randy Maranz posing with our bottle.  He is the radio DJ from 104 The Hawk in Modesto CA.  Randy really likes what we are doing and made us an audio recording type commercial... so give it a listen.  thanks Randy:)
Listen (MP3) to Randy Maranz talk on the air about our product.
___________________________________________________________________
We Don't Just Look Good, Our Flavors are Awesome!
All of our Tequilas are made with 100% pure agave and are available in Blanco, Mango and Coffee flavors.  With your help, we plan to dominate the mid-priced tequila market with Rock N Roll Tequila.  We're not kidding, people really like what we are doing here.  We have great taste, the coolest bottle ever made, and Elvis.
___________________________________________________________________
How Will The Money Be Spent?
We've done a lot... the designs, the patents, certification of flavors, label approvals, trademarks... and we now have the Guitar Bottle and molds... it's almost done!
•  There are pledge costs and fees associated with servicing this campaign such as the PERKS, shirts, bottles, boxes, printing, travel tickets, shipping etc. •  We need money primarily to get a 40 foot truckload of Rock N Roll Elvis decanter bottles and Elvis boxes printed, packed and ready for shipping. •  We also need your help to pay for essential marketing, promotion and advertising. •  There are also fees for Indiegogo and campaign related costs.
___________________________________________________________________
Why Are We So Great?
•  We Have Music Fans.  We have a brand name closely associated with rock n roll music and it's built-in base of rock n roll fans.  Isn't this billions of people?•  We Have Approvals.  We have utility and design patents pending on our guitar shaped bottle features in many countries.  We have labels approved by TTB and CRT for all of our flavors and in all the sizes.  We have trademarks and all that stuff too. •  We Have Elvis Presley.  We have a sweet licensing deal with Elvis Presley Enterprises and therefore a built-in Elvis fan base. See us on Elvis.com.

View Video Andy and Keith made on Veterans Day 2013
___________________________________________________________________What Do The Perks Look Like?
Here is a bunch of stuff to look at.  The thing to remember is that the Founding Member rewards you get from us here, are only available here. Many of the items here are custom for our Founding Members only.  Also, don't expect to get alcohol in your pledge rewards. All the bottles are empty.
1.  Founders Membership
Founding Members are allowed access to shop our online store and will receive email updates as you'd expect.
2.  Founders Certificate & Personalized Founders CertificateThese certificates are 8.5 x 11 inches printed on high grade parchment paper.  Some pledges include a personalized certificate with a hand written thank you, by either Andy or Keith.


3.  Cocktail Menu Card
This is the Rock N Roll Tequila menu that we plan to put in restaurants and stores all over that show pictures and simples descriptions of our cocktail favorites.  This menu is printed double sided on high gloss durable cardstock, and folded in the center.  really cool.
4.  Recipe Mix Card

This menu shows the actual recipes of each drink so you can make them yourself.  This card has no pictures and is printed on high gloss heavyweight cardstock.  A collectible item.

5.  Commemorative Coaster
These coasters are full color on both sides, printed on very heavy duty coaster board stock.  Oops.. on some pledges we may throw in an extra one of these.

6.  Rock N Roll Founding Member T-Shirt
Screen printed in full color on quality shirt.  You will be able to choose either male or female style and from several sizes.  (This is an artist rendering of our proposed design and approximate garment)




7.  Embroidered Rock N Roll Founding Member Hat
Embroidered in full color on a quality black cloth adjustable hat.  (This is an artist rendering of our proposed design and approximate hat style)





8.  Rock N Roll Founding Member Hooded Sweatshirt
Screen printed full color on a quality black hoodie. (This is an artist rendering of our proposed design and approximate garment)


9.  Founding Member Bottle with Elvis Presley Labeling

This Founding Member Elvis guitar bottle is only available here during this campaign so get a cool bottle and help us out.  Some pledges offer this bottle alone, and others come with the collectors box.  (contains no alcohol).

10.  Founding Member Bottle with Elvis Labeling in Elvis Presley BoxThis box is customized with a silver foil insert.  The bottle is the same as if it came without the box (see above), and has custom labels too indicating that you are a FOUNDING MEMBER.


11.  Founding Member Rock N Roll Guitar Bottle (No Box).
Here is our classic Rock N Roll bottle (decanter) except this limited edition version tells everyone who sees it that you are a proud Founding Member. (contains no alcohol)

12. Founding Member Rock N Roll Guitar Bottle in Rock N Roll Guitar Box.

13. Pit Crew Race Shirt.These shirts are on order, and are a high quality garment, similar to what the pit crews wear at a major race. This is an artist rendering of what we propose the design will look like.


14.  Founding Member Rock N Roll Tequila Banner.30"x42" custom Founding Member vinyl banner .  Keith prints these himself and he will sign it for you if you want.  These high quality banners are big too, about the size of a movie poster.  You can even hang it outside if you want!  (no grommets unless requested)


15.  VIP Lanyard / Backstage PassThis exclusive VIP pass allows all-access to our site's BackStage Area and signs you up for special alert updates about upcoming events, bus tours, opportunities to meet rock stars, cool people, us, etc.


16. First Edition 13"x19" Posters.Bob Dylan, Bonnie Raitt, Goo Goo Dolls, Buffalo Springfield (Neil Young) etc... Signed by me Keith Impink, the poster artist . Yep! I illustrated these posters in collaboration with Randy Tuten over the years and I can get him to sign these posters too.  I am offering these cool posters as a reward for your pledge. I only have about 5 or 6 posters of each design, so be first to choose which posters you want.  In most  cases, the band or performer got most of the posters for their own crew and friends... so they are very limited edition original prints.  I have done other designs too which you may prefer, such as Crosby, Stills & Nash, Bonnie Raitt, Steve Miller, Doobies etc.  Check out my portfolio and if you see a poster you prefer, email me at keith@impink.com.  here is Randy's site... Randy Tuten.


17.  Authentic Professional Race Car Drivers Suit
We love all kinds of racing!  We go to as many races as we can for the excitement.  It's a great place to show off our brand and we meet tons of people at races.  Did you see ARCA driver "Rookie of the Year" Justin Boston as he drove the #25 Rock N Roll Tequila / zLoop car at Talladega SuperSpeedway this year?  Our friends at ZLOOP Recycling & Venturini Motorsports styled us and put us on their car and it didn't cost us any money!  And they even made a custom suit that Justin wore.  Are you kidding?... we could never afford that, thank you guys!
Anyway, this custom designed Rock N Roll race suit duplicate (as seen in the picture below) will be made by IMPACT and personalized with your name - Also in tribute to Elvis Presley,  includes 1 Pair of blue racing shoes that look kinda like "Blue Suede Shoes". 

18. Two Tickets in the "V.I.P. Suite" to Watch the 2014 Sonoma NASCAR Sprint Cup Race
- Watch the NASCAR Race from the comfort of your VIP Suite which includes Friday, Saturday and Sunday- Admission including practice, qualifying and racing- Includes hotel accommodations- Includes round trip airfare (within the Continental US)- Includes either transportation to and from the SF Bay Area Airport to the track or a Bay Area rental car. (we haven't decided which yet).

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
“We're Ready to Rock… Are you Ready to Roll?”
Thank you for becoming a Founding Member by supporting our Elvis bottle project. See you Backstage!
VIDEO Testimonials
- YouTube Video: Rock N Roll Tequila at X-Fest California 2013 Keith and Andy walk around showing the Elvis bottle to random people.  See how much people like our project!- YouTube Video: Our Company Mascot Parrot Shreds on a Rock n Roll Guitar BottleThis is a video of Ally, Keith's yellow nape amazon parrot.  enjoy!- YouTube Video: Video of Veterans Day - 2013Andy and Keith go to a couple events on veterans Day 2013 and thank veterans and service members for their service, patriotism and sacrifice.

 
 


















 Elvis Presley used under license © EPE REG. U.S. PAT & TM OFF

story:
THANKS TO ALL WHO'VE CONTRIBUTED AND HELPED SPREAD THE WORD FOR HUNTRESS! WE'VE SURPASSED OUR GOAL OF $15,000!

Huntress has surpassed our Indiegogo goal of $15,000 on June 24, 2013 to help fund our run with the Rockstar Energy Drink Mayhem Festival! When asked about the crowd funding campaign, Huntress vocalist responded “What has been most rewarding for me is truly getting to connect with our fans…I’ve found a new respect for the power of the music enthusiast. There is a stigma that goes along with crowd funding, we were very careful in the presentation — we kept our humility. We aren’t pretending to be more than we are, we’ve had some amazing opportunities handed to us. But Huntress is still in the infant stages of this business…The fans are lifting us to the next level. Napalm Records has been tremendous for Huntress, but they are an indie label and I can’t bleed them dry. The fans are my blood, there’s no end to the life they supply. I adore them. I live for them.” Excerpt from Skull Fracturing Magazine.

Short Summary

We are Huntress, and we're about to embark on the biggest tour opportunity of our lives thus far; the Rockstar Energy Drink Mayhem Festival! But the kicker: it's also the most expensive and demanding tour opportunity of our lives too. When we found out our van couldn't take the heat and run our AC this summer, we realized we could be screwed.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $15,000 and will be sharing a bus this summer on the Mayhem Festival with brothers of metal and fellow indiegogo campaigners Battlecross! We aren't bringing a merch person or sound guy. No crew. No help. Our 5 bunks alone on this bus cost $18,500, and that is just the beginning. The required insurance alone costs over $3,000. Tour insurance, what the hell is that?? And trust us; Blake the accountant did his research and our share of the bus IS cheaper than a Sprinter or pimped-out van with a generator. Huntress is new to this world of mosterous tours, but we plan to live through this one and conquer many more.

We're offering up some of our beloved oddity's and will be adding new perks weekly, so check back often!

The Impact

With your help, Huntress can survive the Mayhem Festival tour and become one step closer to developing the intergallactic harmony we aspire to create with our music. Just like Bill and Ted. It's really that simple.

Other Ways You Can Help

Post about it! Just get the word out and we will owe you big time.
 

[NOTE: ALL INTERNATIONAL PERKS ADD $10 FOR SHIPPING]

----------------------------------------------------------------------

NEW FEATURED PERKS!

 

~ SIGNED JACKSON GUITAR ~ $800

Jackson RR24XT Rhoads X Series guitar signed by the band!  Includes 2 packs of Dunlop "Heavy Core" strings that Blake and Ant use, a set of each of the guys custom Huntress Dunlop picks, signed CD DigiPak and Vinyl of our new album “Starbound Beast”, signed limited-edition poster. AND in the US get two VIP tickets to receive the guitar at any Huntress show ON STAGE with the band! For international buyers, we will ship to you for free!

 

 

~ MICRO GPEN PARTY ~ $200

Two tickets to any 2013 Huntress show, meet the band, get a micro GPen set + "essential oil" packing lesson from Blake! Each microG set includes 2 microG portable vaporizers, G Keychain + more! CD DigiPak, Vinyl and limited edition Huntress poster signed by the band.

 

 ~ ZENITH PACKAGE ~ $100

Own the DVD of the upcoming Huntress music video "Zenith" by award-winning director Phil Mucci (High on Fire, Stone Sour), featuring exclusive behind-the-scenes footage, limited edition “Zenith” t-shirt, signed CD DigiPak of our new album “Starbound Beast”, limited edition “Zenith” vintage-style poster signed by the band and a handwritten note from Jill Janus.

story:
Hello! My name is Ekah Kim, a drummer / composer living in New York City. Thank you so much for your interest in this fundraising for the upcoming new album!


The album is moving towards the end of the mastering stage and it's almost done! I'm starting this fundraise in order to print physical CD's and distribute the music online worldwide.




If you choose to participate, you are not only receiving the new album with corresponding perks, but you are also helping us putting this music out there with the last financial push, for everyone else to enjoy!


The absolute minimum amount was set as our goal and every penny collected through this campaign will be spent towards the rest of this music making process- licensing, CD pressing, online distribution, CD artwork designing, and packaging & USPS mailing for those who choose to receive physical CD's.


I've also included a few perks with previously released albums of mine / a project that I participated as a musician + co-producer. Please visit http://www.ekahkim.com to hear short album previews in BGM, as well as some of my past projects!


 Treasure Hunt (2010)

 Ekahsonic (2011)

 New Ground (2012)

 Family Circus - Boylston Jazz (2013)


Once again, Thank You very much for your time and interest in this project. We sincerely hope that you enjoy this music as much as we did making it!


Yours Truly

Ekah Kim

https://www.facebook.com/EkahKim



안녕하세요? 뉴욕에 거주중인 드러머 / 작곡가 에카킴입니다. 새 앨범 발매를 위한 펀드레이징에 관심 가져주셔서 진심으로 감사드립니다. 

새 앨범 "Under the Sun"은 작년 5월 뉴욕 맨해튼의 로피쉬 스튜디오에서 녹음하고 일본 오사카에서 믹싱과 마스터링을 거쳐 현재 거의 완성 막바지 단계에 있습니다. 

소규모의 개인 프로듀싱에 따르는 금전적인 제약을 해소하고자 예술을 사랑하시는 여러분들의 도움을 받아 모금된 모든 액수는 해당 프로젝트의 완성을 위한 앞으로 남은 과정- 라이센싱, 음반 자켓 디자인, CD발매, 온라인 디지털 트랙 등록/배포, CD배송을 위한 소포 포장료/배송료- 에 모두 쓰이게 됩니다.

후원금 액수에 따라 약소하나마 새 앨범을 포함한 몇 가지 해당 상품을 준비했습니다.

  • $15 : 디지털 다운로드
  • $25 : 새 앨범 CD
  • $40 : 새 앨범 CD 2장 + 악보(가사포함)
  • $55 ~60 : 새 앨범 CD 2장 + 과거 발매 앨범중 택일
  • $100 : 새 앨범 CD 3장 + 앨범 자켓 후원자 크레 + 앨범 제작 당일 촬영 비디오 클립
  • $125 : 새 앨범 CD + 뉴욕 스튜디오에서 드럼레슨 / 스카입 레슨
  • $155 : 새 앨범 CD 3장 + 과거 발매 전 앨범 4장 (2010~2013)
  • $200 : 새 앨범 CD 5장 + 악보(가사포함) + 녹음에 사용된 드럼스틱 + 드럼헤드
  • $350 : 새 앨범 CD 5장 + 녹음에 사용된 심벌; 비디오 상 오른쪽에서 두 번째
  • $500 : 새 앨범 CD 5장 + 후원자를 위한 작곡 + 녹음해서 보내드립니다
  • $1,000 : 새 앨범 CD 10장 + 프로듀서 크레딧!
새 앨범과 과거 발매된 앨범들의 프리뷰는 
http://www.ekahkim.com
여기서 들어보실 수 있습니다.

관심과 성원에 다시 한 번 감사드립니다.


에카킴 드림

Thank you so much for your interest in this fundraising for the upcoming new album!The album is moving towards the end of the mastering stage and it's almost done! I'm starting this fundraise in order to print physical CD's and distribute the music online worldwide.If you choose to participate, you are not only receiving the new album with corresponding perks, but you are also helping us putting this music out there with the last financial push, for everyone else to enjoy!The absolute minimum amount was set as our goal and every penny collected through this campaign will be spent towards the rest of this music making process- licensing, CD pressing, online distribution, CD artwork designing, and packaging & USPS mailing for those who choose to receive physical CD's.I've also included a few perks with previously released albums of mine / a project that I participated as a musician + co-producer. Please visit http://www.ekahkim.com to hear short album previews in BGM, as well as some of my past projects! Treasure Hunt (2010) Ekahsonic (2011) New Ground (2012) Family Circus - Boylston Jazz (2013)Once again, Thank You very much for your time and interest in this project. We sincerely hope that you enjoy this music as much as we did making it!Yours TrulyEkah Kimhttps://www.facebook.com/EkahKim안녕하세요? 뉴욕에 거주중인 드러머 / 작곡가 에카킴입니다. 새 앨범 발매를 위한 펀드레이징에 관심 가져주셔서 진심으로 감사드립니다. 새 앨범 "Under the Sun"은 작년 5월 뉴욕 맨해튼의 로피쉬 스튜디오에서 녹음하고 일본 오사카에서 믹싱과 마스터링을 거쳐 현재 거의 완성 막바지 단계에 있습니다. 소규모의 개인 프로듀싱에 따르는 금전적인 제약을 해소하고자 예술을 사랑하시는 여러분들의 도움을 받아 모금된 모든 액수는 해당 프로젝트의 완성을 위한 앞으로 남은 과정- 라이센싱, 음반 자켓 디자인, CD발매, 온라인 디지털 트랙 등록/배포, CD배송을 위한 소포 포장료/배송료- 에 모두 쓰이게 됩니다.후원금 액수에 따라 약소하나마 새 앨범을 포함한 몇 가지 해당 상품을 준비했습니다.
$15 : 디지털 다운로드
$25 : 새 앨범 CD
$40 : 새 앨범 CD 2장 + 악보(가사포함)
$55 ~60 : 새 앨범 CD 2장 + 과거 발매 앨범중 택일
$100 : 새 앨범 CD 3장 + 앨범 자켓 후원자 크레 + 앨범 제작 당일 촬영 비디오 클립
$125 : 새 앨범 CD + 뉴욕 스튜디오에서 드럼레슨 / 스카입 레슨
$155 : 새 앨범 CD 3장 + 과거 발매 전 앨범 4장 (2010~2013)
$200 : 새 앨범 CD 5장 + 악보(가사포함) + 녹음에 사용된 드럼스틱 + 드럼헤드
$350 : 새 앨범 CD 5장 + 녹음에 사용된 심벌; 비디오 상 오른쪽에서 두 번째
$500 : 새 앨범 CD 5장 + 후원자를 위한 작곡 + 녹음해서 보내드립니다
$1,000 : 새 앨범 CD 10장 + 프로듀서 크레딧!
새 앨범과 과거 발매된 앨범들의 프리뷰는 
http://www.ekahkim.com
여기서 들어보실 수 있습니다.관심과 성원에 다시 한 번 감사드립니다.에카킴 드림https://www.facebook.com/EkahKim

story:
What is Portraits In The Key Of Punk Rock all about?

I was trying to think of a witty quote to start this all out with, but I have nothing. Sorry.

Portraits In The Key Of Punk Rock will be a high quality photo book documenting the on and off stage lives of  current Punk Rock musicians and early Punk Rock progenitors. The goal for the book is to capture more than just the on stage persona but the people and lives behind the music. I want to make a visual record of the current state of Punk Rock including a look back at where it came from. 

All photos will be taken by me, Patrick McLeod and unless you know me personally I'm pretty sure you have no idea who I am, but that's ok I'm a great guy. Go ahead ask me, I'll tell you I'm a great guy. In all seriousness though I am dedicated 100% to the success of this project fully funded or not. I am a photographer, good thing since this is a photography project, from London Ontario Canada, living in Phoenix Arizona for the last eleven years. I have a love of animals, two cats and two dogs to show for it, I love peoples stories and I love music among many other things. 

The book will be sold at a price still to be determined, taking into account sponsorships, if any, final expenses and final publication costs. The goal is to keep quality high and price low.

 

What I need help with and what you will get.

Where the money goes.

I know you saw that number, it's a really big number, just let me tell you I felt the same way when I got an early quote on how much a book like this will cost to publish.

So there's that, publication of the book, unless I can find someone to sponsor that.

Equipment, yes I am a photographer and I have a camera, but I am a photographer without much money. So right now I have what gets me by. For this project I need a bit more, just to do this project justice. DSLR with a full frame sensor, critical for low light shots, as well as a couple of fast lenses for the same reason. A new laptop, this 2010 Dell just ain't cutting it anymore with all the photo processing. I'll sell this one and put the money towards the book when I get a new laptop.

Travel and expenses, I can't do this all at home. I plan to get to the west coast and east coast and everywhere in between. Canada and the UK. and who knows where else.

I will not compromise on quality, so this means more money, better book and if enough money volume two as well.

Perks, oh yes the perks.

Thank yous, both on the website and Facebook and in the book. Post cards, really nice ones with great pictures of Punk Rock musicians on them. Prints of  musicians, various sizes. T-shirts. Copies of the book, some signed. A picture of me wearing a really cool hat. Limited edition print of the cover photo signed by me and the musician/band on the cover. I travel to you, take your picture and put it in the book.

What happens if I don't get all the money?

The book still happens, no compromises it will just take longer. To what degree things happen depends on the level of non-funding.

The Impact

There will be impact all around on this one. I want to chronicle what is going on right now in the Punk Rock scene. I want to bring attention to bands that struggle everyday to do what they love, but also highlight bands that have succeeded against all odds. I want to give fans of the music something that brings them closer to the musicians that they look up to and have brought them so much enjoyment from their music. 

This will also bring me the experience of meeting countless people and hopefully making some lasting friendships along the way.

I need to mention that I will not be making any money from the sale of this book, I am donating all the money to charity. You can find out more about that on Portraits In The Key Of Punk Rock website and on Facebook.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out, tell your friends, tell your family, tell your band mates. Share the campaign anywhere you can. Check out our website and Facebook page. Portraits In The Key Of Punk Rock.

story:
Who is Maude’s Wagon you ask?

**RIGHT NOW AS OF OCTOBER 11-2013 WE'RE #1 ON THE ROCK CHARTS ON REVERBNATION FOR KENORA, AND #22 & RISING IN ALL OF CANADA**

But back to who we are.....

We're just a few Thirty Something Fathers/Husbands who’ve been writing and performing music since 1990. We’ve played in garage’s, basements, pubs, pit parties, slummy bars, and even a couple of music festivals.

From 1994 to 1998 a couple members of Maude’s Wagon were heavily vested in a band called Stript Stone seen in the video link here:  ( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4J1ngdGzZSc ) - which at the time, at least in our own heads, we were rock stars.

Stript Stone was featured on local television networks, they won a recording contract with a local studio in the 1997 Battle of the Bands, were invited to play at several music festivals, performed multiple shows for 1000’s….but alas, the band came to a grinding halt in October of 1998.

Since then, Travis, Jeremy and Ben (Long time friend and exceptional drummer) have been writing and perfecting songs which are now ready to be recorded professionally.

We have a sample of a previously recorded song, Friend No More which has been TRENDING FOR SIX WEEKS STRAIGHT ON Reverb Nation Which will become our first single.

Recently on Sunday Sept-22-2013, Maudes Wagon got together to re-record a better version of the song plus a couple additional tracks as per request from our fans and will be available soon!

What We Need & What You Get

We will be using the money towards professional recording studio time and part of it will be used for manufacturing actual LP's. We are not recording engineers and want to produce a quality product - therefor the professional studio time is required.

After so many years of loving and creating music, it’s time to get it out of our heads and into the digital world.

What you'll receive for funding this project is a digital download of the album and given at random, other promotional material, and of course an honorable mention on our website which is now online www.maudeswagon.com.

We're also on Twitter and Facebook so be sure to Like our page as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you can still help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • Share this campaign on Facebook and other social media!

THANK YOU!!

story:
Help us record our 2nd EP!

Hey There! We are The Fulfillment from Denver, Colorado! Last January we released our first EP called "Origin", since then we've been playing shows and writing new material non-stop.

This coming May (28th-3rd) we will be heading up to 37 Studios in Detroit, MI to record our 2nd EP. We will track 5 songs with Matt Dalton at 37. 

A lot of people have said that we would benefit from going to a higher quality professional studio, so we're doing just that. 37 Studios is known for recording bands like Atilla, I See Stars, DRUGS, and so many more. We expect working with a producer who has experience will further and mature us sonically.

We want to do big things in the music industry, and we want to make an impact on people's lives. If you help us do that you're just as much a part of this as any of us are.

 

Let's Break Down The Funding

 

  • $2,000 will go to us recording our 5 songs with 37 Studios.
  • $500 will go towards travel expenses including food and gas. We'll have to put some personal money into this as well.
  • $200 will be used for the pressing of the EP
  • $300 will be used to pay for studio time for mystery guest vocals

With the $2,300 going to recording processes, the rest is a rough estimate. We'll cut expenses where possible for travel, as well as getting the best pressing of the EP possible for a fair price.

If we don't hit the total of $3,000 we will be fronting the rest of expenses from our personal money. Everything earned from this campaign will go to recording first, then food/gas/the rest second. 

REMEMBER: Donating gets you some awesome prizes! 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have money? Don't worry! Tweet this, facebook this, reblog it on tumblr! Do something! We appreciate every single one of you no matter if you donate or not. Thank you for your time.

You can also come to a show sometime as compensation for not donating! :D

story:
Bref résumé

Je m'appelle Stephane Lorello, j'ai participe a de nombreux projets musicaux aussi varies que des groupes de rock, de jazz, musiques electroniques et contemporaines.

Actarus est mon premier album solo. Ce n'est pas un album concept a proprement parler mais certains themes relient les dix titres les uns aux autres. Il y a la notion de cycles, declinee sous toutes ses formes (revolutions planetaires, generationnelles, le mythe de sysiphe etc.), il y a aussi l'idee de la lutte interieure pour ameliorer la vie a l'exterieur, en d'autres thermes, reparer la realite grace a l'imaginaire.

La musique est rock mais au sens large, c'est-a-dire qu'elle s'autorise des detours au travers d'autres styles et sonorites. Les influences vont de Pink Floyd a Queens of the stone age en passant par Radiohead, Sigur Ros, Ennio Morricone ou encore Zappa.

Un clip accompagne l'un des titres (Circle) mais d'autres videos sont en cours de production.

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

L'argent recolte servira a payer le mastering, les quelques fournitures dues aux contributeurs (ceux-ci mais aussi ceux d'une precedente campagne de financement). J'en profite pour preciser que tous les t-shirts, poster et CD seront faits artisanalement, donc uniques!

Il restera egalement un peu d'argent pour financer une campagne de promotion (passages radios, reviews, interviews, pubs sur les reseaux sociaux etc.)

 L'impact

Votre contribution aura un veritable impact sur la qualite finale de ce projet. 

 Risques et défis

Malgre le budget serre que cela represente, j'ai la certitude que cette somme sera suffisante a atteindre un niveau de qualite optimale. Car c'est ce qui a deja ete fait pour les prises de son et le mixage. Actarus est un projet ambitieux qui a convaincu de grands professionnels de baisser significativement leurs remunerations voire de travailler gratuitement!

 D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financierement, vous pouvez quand meme nous aider activement en faisant passer l'info autour de vous et en partageant cette campagne de financement sur les reseaux sociaux.

Quelle que soit votre aide, je vous remercie de croire en ce projet et de supporter la creation en general!

story:
So, it's time to make an album

After six years of writing, performing, and fine tuning a catalogue of songs, I’m ready to head into the studio and create a full length album that I can proudly share with the world. I have full band arrangements of ten original songs, from folk to funky rock to soul to straight-ahead jazz, just waiting to be recorded and reach your beautiful ears.

I really believe that these songs speak to truth, beauty, goodness, goofiness, fun, sorrow, and just being human. With your support, this album can finally be made and sent out into the musical chasm of the world.

To me, music is a gift that isn’t supposed to be held on to. If it isn’t shared with others, it’s just like the forgotten apples in the bottom drawer of your refrigerator - rotting away, turning brown and mushy, not giving their sweetness to anyone at all.

And here's the plan

For the past ten years, I’ve been sharing my music in one way or another with those around me - with friends, at church, for family, at events where organizers are looking for music to set the mood or enhance the experience. With my view of sharing music as a gift, I have not amassed any sort of “musical savings” to fund the creation of an album, which is exactly where you can come it right now.

If you help me reach my fundraising goal, I will head into Sacred Heart Recording Studio, the premier recording studio in Duluth, MN, this summer to work with some amazing people and bring this album to life. Many great Minnesota bands have recorded at Sacred Heart in the past, including Trampled by Turtles, Low, Charlie Parr, Gaelynn Lea, and many more. If I don't make my fundraising goal, I will work with a smaller recording studio in Duluth to complete this album.

I have many reward options that you can choose when you sign up to support this project, including music, merchandise, live shows, and some quirky, personalized oddities. The money you pledge will be used for time in the recording studio, mixing, mastering, paying musicians, CD production, and reward fulfillment.

This project can’t happen without you, so I humbly and tremblingly ask for your magnanimous support to create some beautiful music.

Risks & Challenges

There's always an element of risk in supporting a creative project like an album, because you (as the listener) never know what the final product will be until you hear it. But hopefully, that's part of the excitement and the joy in being a supporter.

In addition to the years writing and performing these songs, I've also been spending a lot of time in the last two months specifically planning this campaign and this album. I will absolutely do everything in my power to make sure that at the end of this, you have an album in the hand that you and I can both be proud of.

I've learned a lot in the recording I've done on my own, and with some guidance from professional technicians and the support of a great cast of musicians, I am confident this will be great.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute financially to this project or not, you can still help by spreading the word! Tell your mom, remind your cat, and soliloquize to your next-door neighbor about this album and this campaign. Share this page with all your friends on the interwebs and whatever social medias you use. The more people this campaign can reach, the more likely we can make this goal and get a great album into your hands and ears.

And here's the plan
For the past ten years, I’ve been sharing my music in one way or another with those around me - with friends, at church, for family, at events where organizers are looking for music to set the mood or enhance the experience. With my view of sharing music as a gift, I have not amassed any sort of “musical savings” to fund the creation of an album, which is exactly where you can come it right now.
If you help me reach my fundraising goal, I will head into Sacred Heart Recording Studio, the premier recording studio in Duluth, MN, this summer to work with some amazing people and bring this album to life. Many great Minnesota bands have recorded at Sacred Heart in the past, including Trampled by Turtles, Low, Charlie Parr, Gaelynn Lea, and many more. If I don't make my fundraising goal, I will work with a smaller recording studio in Duluth to complete this album.
I have many reward options that you can choose when you sign up to support this project, including music, merchandise, live shows, and some quirky, personalized oddities. The money you pledge will be used for time in the recording studio, mixing, mastering, paying musicians, CD production, and reward fulfillment.
This project can’t happen without you, so I humbly and tremblingly ask for your magnanimous support to create some beautiful music.

Risks & Challenges
There's always an element of risk in supporting a creative project like an album, because you (as the listener) never know what the final product will be until you hear it. But hopefully, that's part of the excitement and the joy in being a supporter.
In addition to the years writing and performing these songs, I've also been spending a lot of time in the last two months specifically planning this campaign and this album. I will absolutely do everything in my power to make sure that at the end of this, you have an album in the hand that you and I can both be proud of.
I've learned a lot in the recording I've done on my own, and with some guidance from professional technicians and the support of a great cast of musicians, I am confident this will be great.

Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you can contribute financially to this project or not, you can still help by spreading the word! Tell your mom, remind your cat, and soliloquize to your next-door neighbor about this album and this campaign. Share this page with all your friends on the interwebs and whatever social medias you use. The more people this campaign can reach, the more likely we can make this goal and get a great album into your hands and ears.

story:
The CD: New Year

My name is Anne Sajdera. I’m a San Francisco-based pianist/composer who has been part of the Bay Area music scene for almost 30 years. After graduating from the San Francisco Conservatory of Music, I went on to form my own jazz ensemble, performing jazz and Brazilian music throughout the Bay Area. I have also performed with other Bay Area notables such as Alexa Weber Morales, Terrence Brewer, Sandy Cressman and Erik Jekabson’s the Electric Squeezebox Orchestra. My first CD, Azul (Bijuri Records, 2012), featured stellar Bay Area musicians such as Gary Brown, Paul van Wageningen, Phil Thompson and Mike Spiro as well as the percussion legend Airto Moreira.

Inspired by Herbie Hancock’s vision for International Jazz Day (International Jazz Day is an International Day declared by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization in 2011 "to highlight jazz and its diplomatic role of uniting people in all corners of the globe.") I invited two award-winning horn players from Prague: Miroslav Hloucal (trumpet) & Jan Fečo (alto sax), to perform on my newest recording, and to contribute compositions and arrangements, we are truly looking forward to seeing our work finally be released to the public. They will be bringing their amazing energy to our CD release performances.

By contributing to this campaign you will help defray their visa costs and airfare, making this effort toward uniting people from different parts of the world into a reality.

The Specifics

For this campaign I’m hoping to collect $2,500

Here is the breakdown of the travel costs:

I-129 petition fee for Hloucal/FečoDuo, $460

Labor Consult fee from American Federation of Musicians, $250

Visa cost, $392

Airfare, $2,000

Total $3,102 

As you can see the actual travel costs are a little bit more than what I’m requesting.

Here are the choices of different contributions and gifts:

$20 digital copy of New Year

$25 New Year: signed CD

$50 signed CD and two dozen delicious little cookies, baked from a recipe out of Deborah Madison’s cookbook, carefully packaged and mailed to you – your choice of nut, spice nut, almond, tollhouse (chocolate chip) 

$50 signed CD and two dozen chocolate cookies with Reese’s peanut butter chips 

$100 signed CD and charts for all of the compositions on New Year, printed on quality paper and gathered together in an attractive folder. 

$500 signed CD, web-listing on the album credits under ‘executive producer’s circle’ and a private concert in your home by Anne.

If we don't achieve our $2,500 goal, the funds would still go toward those travel costs. Any amount helps.

The Impact

By contributing to this project, you will be helping to bring together musicians from different parts of the world. When I first heard that definition of International Jazz Day back in 2014, "to highlight jazz and its diplomatic role of uniting people in all corners of the globe," I felt the importance of that intention, but could never have predicted how much we would need this humanitarian frame of mind today. Every step we take, no matter what size, leads us toward the goal of a more connected, more peaceful human experience. I invite you to be a part of that.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, please consider sharing this campaign - I'm grateful for it all.

story:
anrimeal

Hey! I am Ana, and I've been developing the anrimeal project in semi-secret for 3 years now. At the heart of my music is a true passion for creative freedom and experimentation with sound. Borrowing from folk tradition and hip-hop boldness, my music combines the worlds of vocal and sound design storytelling.

Since 2016 I have been enthusiastically learning all I can to develop my art and express myself, and the time finally has come for me to share that process with the world. My very own label Demo Records is partnering with Crossness Records (helmed by the ever so generous Hannah Ehrlich) to create a product worth presenting to the independent music lovers out there!

With that said, I kindly ask for your help to make this happen, opening up a pre-pre-order space to help fund the beginning of this campaign.

 

Money

The total budget will be roughly divided between the cost of pressing a limited number of coloured vinyl and paying for people's time in spreading the word about this record. 

The album will still get made if the goal of our target isn't reached, but your contributions will undoubtedly take this project to a different level of future sustainability.

 

Perks

The perks section works essentially like a pre-pre-order, divided into 4 different tiers.

  • For £8, you get a thank you note from me + a download code which will give you access to unlimited streaming via the Bandcamp website & app (Limited to 100)
  • For £20, you get a signed copy of the limited edition coloured vinyl + thank you note + a download code which will give you access to unlimited streaming via the Bandcamp website & app (Limited to 100)
  • For £35, you get all of the above + 1 cassette infinite tape loop of a part of the record + access to a private Discord group where we discuss the inside of campaign decisions, share behind the scenes information & otherwise permanent AMA (Limited to 20)
  • For £100, all of the above + a live performance in your living room/local pub or venue - not inclusive of travel costs (Limited to 5)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help! Independent music survives through word of mouth, so please feel free to share this project with your friends or follow me and Hannah on our socials (all links below):

anrimeal: Instagram / Twitter / YouTube / Bandcamp

Crossness Records: Website / Facebook / Instagram / Twitter

Demo Records: Instagram / Twitter

story: Hey guys! I'm very excited to have the opportunity to make the record I've always wanted to make, and I'm grateful to have your support during this process. I moved to Nashville with the goal of crafting great songs. It's a constant learning process, but I feel I'm gaining ground and establishing myself as a songwriter. I'm happy to be working with Jim Reilley, who has a wealth of knowledge as a producer, musician, artist and songwriter. We listened to several (about 30) songs that I've written and were contenders for this project. We demoed three of the songs, initially, to see how they came together in the studio and to see how we worked together, along with sound engineer, Eric Fritsch. It has been a great experience with great momentum! The potential here is truly inspiring. With a strong start as our launching pad and strong sense of our creative direction for this project, I feel confident that we are about to make something really special. Crowdfunding to me, is about building a community that supports and enjoys the creative process. It's a chance to truly work together, watch things unfold and experience being a part of creating something new. It's all very exciting! The best part is that we know there will be good music at the end of this and music is the greatest gift.

story:
Recording an album is an expensive task for young musicians. Here's some of the things we need moving forward:

Mastering: $150 - $250

Publishing: $90-150

CD Production and Release: $750 - $1000

 

We take our music very seriously and want to be sure that it is released with the highest quality possible and in the most professional manner. In 2014, our songs were submitted to The Library of Congress and have achieved copyright status. If you have any questions about our band and our work, feel free to contact us at officialthirdrailmusic@gmail.com. Thank  you in advance for your contributions!

story:
I’ve been a passionate musician since I was a very young age. A classical pianist from age six, I was introduced to folk music by way of the mandolin in middle school at the Academy for Technology and the Classics. At sixteen, last year, I self-funded my first album, Fly Me By. It was a ten song LP comprised of nine original songs and one cover.

 

The roots: with the ATC Acoustic Americana band in 2014. 

 

My debut album was an incredible experience. Hearing the songs that I’d written quietly in a room or by a river through beautiful microphones and accompanied by my favorite instruments was a true dream come true.

At Frogville studios for  Fly Me By.

 

Since my first album, a lot’s changed. My tastes, for one, have been further broadened, and my songwriting has evolved further due to new experiences and influences. This October for example, I took a solo trip to Europe that changed my life. Being alone with my guitar on the streets of Lisbon, Barcelona and Rome was also a dream come true--and led to some of my best writing yet.

Writing in Tuscany.

 

The Record

Here’s what I want to do: I want to give these ten (and counting) new songs of mine what they need--a beautifully instrumentalized, produced, and published studio album. On my first one, I only had the money for one or two musicians per song plus my own instrumentation. On this one, I’ll be playing mandolin, electric and acoustic guitar, harmonica, and piano. To achieve the folk-country sound that I dream of,  I want a tasteful backing band with some of the best musicians around, recorded by the best producers I know.

Let’s break it down:

  • Lovely studio musicians (pedal steel, backing harmonies, fiddle, drums, accordion, banjo): $2500

 

  • Production by Bill Palmer, the producer on my last record, and in the eyes of most the best in Santa Fe. His shaman-like recording skills and profound taste, criticism, encouragement, and (never forget), cooking skills and humor make recording a transcendent joy. He costs $50 an hour (a bargain). I plan on paying him $2000 for the whole record.

 

  • Super-pro Mastering by 6 time Grammy award winner Bryan Lucey at Magic Garden in LA: $3500

 

  • Printing on my absolute favorite format, Vinyl. Full-color cover, jacket, and inner sleeve, pressed on long-lasting heavyweight 180 gram wax: $3,700 for the minimum 200 copies.

 

  • Finally, the small stuff--photographs, CDs, video, etc--$1500

 

 

It'll be an absolute dream to be able to sound like the greats--the pedal steel of Neil Young, the fiddle of Bob Dylan, and the vocals of Emmylou.

 

I’ve written the songs, now I need your help with the rest. Help this seventeen-year old’s dream come true.

 

SIMONLEEPLUNKET.COM

Hello! My name is Holly Durante and I am a singer songwriter from Albuquerque, New Mexico.  I am trying to raise money to record my very first album in Portland, Oregon at Deer Lodge studios! Any donation is appreciated! Below is a link to my music, as well as my Facebook page! Thanks again, much love!

https://soundcloud.com/hollydurante
